jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. We are seeking a highly motivated and innovative Agile Coach to help guide Costco IT on their Agile journey. We are currently focused on portfolio management, value stream delivery, and role development in order to deliver outcomes faster, improve quality, and grow stronger teams. Working with a team of internal and consultant agile coaches, our selected candidate will have the opportunity to participate in this enterprise IT transformation. Costco is on the path to unlock Costco IT’s full potential, which includes advancing our technology, and turning us into a more agile, entrepreneurial, and customer-focused business unit. We are redesigning our organization and how we work, which will improve our ability to deliver value to our customers. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world, with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family and employee-centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Takes a visible role in a high performing Agile/DevOps coaching team; facilitates the adoption, implementation, and sustainability of Agile/DevOps framework, principles, and practices. Provides high-touch and hands-on team guidance, support, and coaches in close cooperation/collaboration across all roles and functions to facilitate increasing maturity at a sustainable pace. Coaches Agile / DevOps practices, techniques, and frameworks, such as SAFe, Scrum, XP, and Kanban to reduce the gap between Agile / DevOps theory and practice. Learns the business and acts as a dedicated trusted advisor to teams and leaders. Develops content; leads workshops and training sessions to educate individuals and leaders on Agile values, principles, and practices. Recommends, develops, tracks, and monitors Agile/DevOps metrics in areas that affect value-driven delivery. Encourages adoption of Agile/DevOps/ LPM practices to improve delivery, communication, and teaming skills. Instructs teams and leaders on problem solving techniques to identify organizational impediments to successful Agile transformation, and works with the leadership team to create effective strategies to overcome them. Fosters an environment of mutual respect, trust, collaboration, transparency, autonomy, innovation, and quality. Generates new ideas, supports change, encourages innovation, and helps to creatively solve problems. Provides courageous and sometimes challenging feedback to leadership in order to coach and help them ﬁnd their way forward in the new way of working. Collaborates with cross-functional teams to assess the overall health of business agility and help them identify improvement opportunities. Partners with other Leaders, Agile Coaches, OCM, and Talent Management and Delivery Teams to help inﬂuence an environment of consistency and transparency throughout the organization. Serves as a change agent for teams across the organization for Agile/DevOps, SAFe, Kanban, and Lean frameworks; offers guidance and training on effective ways to use physical and electronic tools. Coaches teams to assess, measure, document, and communicate progress against deﬁned goals and OKR’s. Provides strategic guidance for developing and improving program and portfolio prioritization, value stream delivery, and outcome measurement. Assists and participates in Agile iteration and release planning across the organization. Required BS/BA in Computer Science, Business or equivalent experience. 8+ years’ of practical Agile coaching experience guiding teams, divisions, and large IT organizations through the varied challenges of an Agile transformation. SAFe certiﬁcations including SPC, LPM, PO/PM, RTE. Experience in conducting Agile training (SAFe and in-house) to managers, executives, and teams. Practical experience with Lean Portfolio Management and Project to Program transformation including implementation of best practices. Intimate understanding of team and organizational metrics that help to move the maturity of the organization e.g. OKRs, pod, and value stream metrics. Mature leadership skills with the heart of a servant leader, high EQ, and deep level of empathy. Extensive experience training and coaching teams in the use of Agile tools. E.g. ADO, Service Now, Miro, and Conﬂuence. Ability to facilitate discussion at all levels of the organization to resolve conﬂicts. Executive presence with skills at building meaningful concise presentations. Recommended Certiﬁcations in Agile coaching and Enterprise Transformation. Executive coaching experience. Technical DevOps coaching experience. Technical background in software development, architecture, or program management. jobTitle: Analyst - Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Asset and Cloud Intelligence
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Cybersecurity Infrastructure team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member’s and employee’s privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Analyst will be a key member of the Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Asset and Cloud Intelligence team that will support, maintain, and develop tools and projects focused on delivering asset visibility and intelligence to the Information Security and Compliance departments. The Analyst should have in-depth knowledge of system discovery and data management software and tools. They will work with management and vendors for product consideration including the auditing of information system activities. As a Subject Matter Expert, they will provide consultative services, drive innovation in technology, process, and procedure. Additional responsibilities include: maintaining operational excellence for their tools, services, and programs; creating and maintaining documentation related to policies, standards and procedures; leading and mentoring team members with lesser subject matter expertise. The Analyst should have in-depth working experience and knowledge of asset discovery, system integration, data collection, consolidation, manipulation, validation and reporting; solid skills in Windows and Linux environments along with experience with working with enterprise networks; experience with cybersecurity frameworks and best practices. This work will involve working with many groups throughout IT both domestically and internationally. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Assesses existing Cybersecurity Infrastructure platforms and tools. Creates the roadmap for addressing capability gaps, maturity improvements and innovation. Supports security standards and procedures; identifies, develops and implements mechanisms to detect sensitive data and security incidents. Mentors and develops team members. Evaluates and hardens tooling and instrumentation to prevent cybersecurity exploits. Performs duties necessary to assist in establishing practices and system configurations to ensure the safety of information systems assets and to protect information systems from intentional or inadvertent access or destruction. Works with information systems custodians (i.e., department managers, user community and systems administrators) at different levels in the organization to understand their respective security needs and assist with implementing practices and procedures consistent with Costco’s Information Security Policy. Assists with monitoring and auditing of information systems activities and systems to confirm information security policy compliance and provide management with security policy compliance assessments and system monitoring reports. Works with stakeholders to provide security solutions that support their business requirements. Conducts security risk assessments on new products and systems, periodic security risk assessments on existing systems and identifies and/or recommends appropriate security countermeasures and best practices. Coordinates activities or engagements with loss prevention, and interacts with legal and law enforcement. Identifies security gaps that expose Costco to potential exploit and develops short and long term prioritized remediations to address those gaps ensuring management is apprised of the risk in a timely manner. Maintains current knowledge of industry trends and standards. Assumes a leadership role in advocating internally and externally for compliance with security measures to protect Costco’s applications and environments. Required A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or a minimum of 5 years information systems security experience. Expertise in managing IT Asset Management (ITAM) or CMDB systems such as Service Now, Axonius, Etc. Experience with integrating disparate systems for data enrichment such as using PowerBI or APIs. Experience performing complex data management, validation, reporting, and analysis. Experience with discovery protocols and tools such as Ping, NMAP, ARP, SNMP, etc. Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers, and proxies. 3 - 5 years’ experience with deploying, configuring and securing cloud PaaS & IaaS resources such as Azure, GCP and AWS. Experience with at least one scripting/programming language: PowerShell, shell scripting, python, etc. Working knowledge of information systems security standards/practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers, using appropriate language, examples and tone. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Demonstrates a high level of communication skills, verbal and written. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness and quality of work. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Recommended One or more professional certifications such as Security+, Network+, CCNA, GSEC, CISA or CISSP (or equivalent work experience). Thorough experience within both Windows and Linux environments. Experience managing and using Configuration Management systems such as SCCM, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, etc. Strong knowledge of scalable multi-tier enterprise-level applications. Working knowledge of protocols and technologies such as ICMP, HTTP/HTTPS, SSH, SFTP, SNMP and DNS. Thorough understanding of the OSI model, as well as IPv4/IPv6 protocol suite. Working knowledge and experience with data warehouses and data lakes would be beneficial. Experience performing computer forensics. Experience with ITILv2/v3 processes such as Service Support, Service Delivery, or Continual Service Improvement. Experience with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI. Experience in a DevOps or DevSecOps environment. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The Asset Management team is looking for an experienced business operation analyst with a passion for problem-solving looking for an opportunity to create an impact. A high-energy, detail-oriented team player with exemplary communication skills and an innate drive to meet department goals. The Asset Management team, focuses on managing the business operational movement of IT assets and consumables for the full lifecycle from receipt through disposal including managing the relationships between hardware and software for Costco locations. Our team is focused on maintaining software compliance, identifying savings opportunities, and providing visibility of our license position to all business stakeholders. We are looking for a collaborative analyst in a non-technical role to help us elevate our IT processes and lead initiatives to make positive impacts across Costco IT. You will be a part of a passionate business team that is agile and collaborative, working together to develop and maintain an excellent Asset Management program. We are serious about our work but our team knows how to have fun while engaged in this crucial service! Come join our team as we continue to shape and evolve ITAM at Costco! If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Conducts reviews and analysis of software asset data, identifying data integrity issues and root causes of anomalies. Data sets vary from single-system to larger exports that require comparative analysis. Provides resolution of discrepancies between pulled inventory data and CARTS data. This may involve detailed research within Flexera, CARTS, and other source data (BigFix, SCCM). Supports all efforts to expand software visibility of total footprint in software asset management tool. Primarily focused on how to get more information in-tool and ensuring all included info is accurate and complete. Learns, understands, and provides subject matter expertise in proper asset management policies and procedures across purchasing, contracts, supplier management, and business owner teams; ensures software installation is reflective of any hardware retirements and that new hardware is correctly set up in alignment with Software Asset Management (SAM) requirements. Creates, maintains process, and references documentations. This may include policy descriptions, reference lists, process flows, or historical logs of resolved issues. Initiates cross-collaboration with internal and supplier teams and supports team members in problem resolution efforts. Supports the development of ITAM Control Book and related policies. This may include maintenance of existing content, creation of new content, or contributing to process ideation of updates where needed. Supports new SAM publisher candidate onboarding. Identifies opportunities for streamlining, increasing effectiveness through continuous process improvement and in implementing best practice solutions. Required 2+ years’ of experience in asset management with knowledge of industry best practices; or equivalent inventory/materials management experience. Strong understanding of hardware and software asset life cycles and supply chain methods and processes; from purchase through disposal. Experience utilizing Excel to analyze data sets is preferred; including experience with pivot tables and formulas, and the ability to compare different data sets. Analytical, detail-oriented and demonstrates the ability to research and problem-solve effectively. Able to compare and review data for inconsistencies, can communicate and understand root causes, and takes lead on resolution; can engage other teams as necessary. Must possess a positive attitude, ability to work independently, and be self-motivated to take initiative with a strong sense of urgency and ownership. Must possess the ability to communicate effectively, both written and verbal, with suppliers, cross-functional teams, and with all organizational levels of Costco. Previous experience successfully managing multiple projects and tasks; excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize across competing priorities and deadlines. Willingness to take direction and coaching from management and peers; excellent and positive team interaction. Must be flexible and adaptable to changes. Able to work O/T as necessary. Recommended Experience with ServiceNow (“CARTS”) is preferred, especially in the hardware asset management modules. IT Asset Management certification (ex. CHAMP, CSAM, CITAM, or equivalent). Good understanding of Costco Business operations is preferred; or other knowledge of the structure of a large organization with equipment at multiple locations. Experience with discovery tool data from SCCM, BigFix, or ServiceNow Discovery. Experience with G-Suite (GoogleDocs, GoogleSheets, etc.). Creates and manages Infrastructure as Code (IaC). Works with Main POC for Cloud Software Defined Networking. Acts as a liaison to existing Enterprise network and security teams. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem situations. Solid understanding of application architecture, network technologies, application security, and infrastructure architecture. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Team player, good interpersonal, organizational and communication skills. Creative, likes challenges. Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended Microsoft Certification of at least an AZ-900 and AZ-700 or industry experience. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The role of every Policy team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal and regulatory obligations; protecting member privacy, and ensuring a technologically secure operating environment. The Compliance Analyst will support the Policy team through the coordination of ongoing Policy and Standards creation and maintenance to ensure continued compliance with legal requirements such as PCI, HIPAA, SOX, etc. Support will also include acting as a liaison between the Policy team and the Business and SMEs. A successful candidate will be one who thrives in ambiguity and enjoys working across many stakeholders to shore up all aspects of security compliance. The Compliance Analyst will work closely with Risk Engineers and other teams to implement corporate guidance in response to emerging standards and legislations by making certain that all policies and procedures are applied and well documented, performing internal security reviews, and identifying compliance problems that call for formal attention. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Leads the creation, implementation, monitoring, and maintenance of security Policies and Standards. Presents findings, in a professional manner, for policy modifications for improving the overall security posture. Engages with the Business and SMEs to ensure compliance of IT Policies. Assists with auditing of IT activities and systems to confirm information security policy compliance. Proposes solutions to deficiencies found in the Policy and Standards. Works with IT custodians at different levels in the organization to understand their respective security needs and assists with implementing Policies and Standards. Assists with auditing of information systems activities and systems to confirm information security policy compliance and provides management with security policy compliance assessments. Researches and retains currency on PCI, SOX, HIPAA, etc., and adherence to industry standards. Works with other business and legal departments in response to emerging standards and legislation. Maintains a strong understanding of current and upcoming regulatory requirements and legislation. Socializes Information Security policies, standards, and procedures. Develops and executes project/program plans, coordinates required resources. Required Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Team player and willing to establish a strong positive working relationship with all areas of the business. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Works effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to speak both technical and business language interchangeably to effectively communicate and lead. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Recommended One or more professional audit or security certifications such as CISA or CISSP (or equivalent work experience). Project Management skills and experience. A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a minimum of 3 to 5 years’ information systems security or related experience. Understanding of networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, load balancers, and proxies. Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). The role of every Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal and regulatory obligations; protecting member, employee and supplier privacy; and ensuring a technologically secure operating environment. Our Service Continuity Analyst is focused on business continuity, disaster recovery, and resiliency initiatives and will provide consulting services to internal product and project teams, work with suppliers to review high availability solutions under consideration for use in the domain, and mentor others with lesser subject matter expertise. The Analyst will perform services related to but not limited to Business Impact Analysis, Disaster Recovery Plans, and Tabletop Exercises while aligning with Resiliency Team Members and Business Continuity Team Members to provide overarching continuity capabilities. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works with stakeholders (e.g., department managers, user community and systems administrators) at different levels in the organization to understand their respective resilience needs and assist with implementing practices and procedures consistent with Costco’s Information Security Policy. Supports the development and maintenance of Disaster Recovery/Business Continuity policies, standards, and guidelines. Assists with auditing of information systems resilience capabilities. Conducts Business Impact Analysis, Develops Disaster Recovery Plans, Conducts Tabletop Exercises and other related initiatives. Works with stakeholders to identify solutions that support their business requirements. Partners with other Information Security groups to conduct service resilience and continuity risk assessments on new solutions and systems. Coordinates and runs table top exercises and post exercise gap assessments on existing systems to identify and/or recommend appropriate continuity countermeasures and best practices. Drives and makes progress under ambiguous situations. Builds and fosters positive relationships with key IT and business partners. Supports and maintains all disaster recovery related workstreams end to end. Required Experience with business continuity concepts of recovery time and point objectives, and mean time to recovery. Experience supporting and building/implementing enhancements for an Enterprise-wide IT Disaster Recovery Program. Experience with short and long term storage design techniques. Experience with SaaS and PaaS high availability architectures. Knowledge of Cloud and datacenter redundant designs. Understanding of and experience working with agile and waterfall methodologies. Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Ability to interpret information security data and processes to identify potential compliance or risk issues. Ability to quickly understand complicated data flows in order to identify and validate requirements. Must be a team player and willing to establish a strong positive working relationship with all areas of the business. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Recommended A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a minimum of 3 to 5 years of information systems security or related data processing auditing experience. One or more professional certifications DRI, ISO 22301 (or equivalent). Familiarity with SOA governance and policy management best practices. Familiarity of SDM, SDLC, and project management processes. Familiarity with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI Familiarity in a DevOps or DevSecOps environment. Experience in retail, supply chain, e-commerce industries is helpful but not required. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Compliance Analyst will guide and promote all aspects of the analysis, communication, implementation, and risk mitigation of vendor related risks and controls to protect Costco and their partners. Will work with other businesses and the legal department to define and set new corporate guidance to support the vendor risk management program strategy, policy, and standards. This role will be required to anticipate regulatory impacts, promote company awareness, propose solutions to control deficiencies, reach out in support of the business/operations, and communicate effectively at all levels. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Leads and executes security/privacy vendor risk assessments and risk remediation activities to effectively identify and help treat critical risks. Leverages a risk framework to rate and rank associated risks. Documents and communicates findings to the business and third-parties. Identifies control deficiencies and recommends control enhancements to address critical risks. Monitors, tracks, and reports control implementations. Assists in establishing and following methodologies designed to identify general system and business controls, and identify and prioritize risks. Develops, manages, and executes plans to communicate and remediate all known material weaknesses or significant deficiencies; minimizes deficiencies noted by either internal or external auditors. Works closely with I.S. Management, Accounting, Legal, and internal/external auditors to ensure successful follow-through and completion of compliance and mitigation activities. Drives assigned tasks leveraging IT expertise or outside resources where needed. Required Experience in working with Vendor Risk Management (VRM) or Third-Party Risk Management (TPRM) or Risk Management Program. Experience with collaborating and influencing with partner organizations. Working knowledge of Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) tools. Working knowledge of security risk assessment and control frameworks, good understanding of privacy regulations, data management practices, and security stack. Ability to interpret information security data and processes to identify potential compliance issues (SOX, HIPAA, PCI, and Privacy). Ability to quickly understand security systems in order to identify and validate risk exposure from vendors and third-parties. Ability to clearly communicate effectively with executives, auditors, end users, and engineers. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Experience with Standardized Information Gathering (SIG) and vendor interviews. Self-starter and action oriented to drive risk identification and mitigation efforts. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Demonstrated mentoring skills (knowledge sharing and assisting others in understanding technical and business topics). Experience coordinating between external auditors and staff being audited. Recommended A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or 4 years’ information systems security experience. Security+, Certified third party risk professional (CTPRP) and Certified Security Compliance Specialist (CSCS). Working knowledge of firewalls, routers, load balancers and DMZ silos, and packet capture technologies. Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume Last two performance reviews Attendance records for current year (Do not include absences covered by paid sick/personal time, FMLA or other protected absences.) California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

At Costco we are committed to doing the right thing. That means fostering a culture of inclusiveness, collaboration and ethical decision making. At Costco you will have the opportunity to work on complex legal issues while growing as a leader.  The Corporate Counsel will primarily focus on claims and litigation-related matters. Primary responsibilities include handling filed or threatened litigation, regulatory matters, interfacing with suppliers and business clients, overseeing the process of responding to third-party subpoenas, supplier-related bankruptcy issues, as well as patent and intellectual property litigation.  Knowledge of environmental regulations is also a plus. Additional responsibilities include working on processes and projects to mitigate risk and promote compliance. This individual will have at least seven years of experience as a civil litigator defending commercial liability claims and should have experience working with governmental regulatory agencies. The Corporate Counsel must be adept at identifying legal risks and developing a mitigation strategy by understanding legal issues and translating them into easily understood and practical legal advice and counsel to the applicable business group. Individuals who thrive at Costco are able to drive results through collaboration, critical thinking, willingness to grow in their career, and strong communication skills. Responsibilities: Analyze potential claims and develop strategies to eliminate or minimize liability Serve as the primary point of contact on lawsuits and other claims, manage outside counsel, and collaborate with business  Review and comment on legal briefs and motions prepared by outside counsel Assist outside counsel with discovery responses and preparation of witnesses Work on mediation statements, attend mediations and hearings, and review settlement agreements Prepare and deliver training and presentations to employees, management, executives Suggest process improvements and implement communication plan to team and internal stakeholders Address compliance and regulatory issues Assist with the development and implementation of the Legal strategy, vision, and goals as they align with and support compliance initiatives Oversee subpoena responses in collaboration with a legal assistant and outside counsel Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree and Juris Doctorate degrees required Minimum of seven years of experience as a civil litigator required; experience in retail environment and consumer class actions preferred  Demonstrated experience in building and leading an inclusive culture Highly developed writing, editing, and written communication skills Excellent analytical abilities and attention to detail, ability to analyze complex litigation and strategies Ability to operate successfully in a culture that values consultation and collaboration Strong verbal communication skills  Ability to travel as needed   Costco Wholesale is an equal-opportunity employer and strives to provide a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are also committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations, protecting member’s and employee’s privacy, and maintaining a secure technology environment for our operations. The Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst provides threat intelligence to identify threat actors and methods, enable IT solutions to build effective controls against these threats, provide situational awareness to incident response; develop threat assessments for high risk events (zero-days); support proactive threat hunting in Costco Wholesale systems, and provides advice on matters related to policies, standards and procedures. The Cyber Threat Intelligence Analyst conducts in-depth research, documentation, and analysis of potential and actual cyber security threats to the enterprise, but also assists senior analysts and engineers in the development, practices, and monitoring of the Threat Intelligence Program. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Identifies and assesses internal and external cybersecurity risks of Costco Wholesale business operations. Develops and delivers cyber and physical threat intelligence products including tactical, strategic, and operational reports into actionable intelligence for operations teams. Develops, formalizes, and maintains effective threat identification and assessment processes, including playbooks for identifying, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Develops, maintains, and updates a repository of cyber threat information that is used in conducting risk assessments and reports on cyber risk trends. Conducts research and evaluates intelligence data, with emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures. Correlates threat data from various sources and analyzes network events to establish the attribution and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to Costco Wholesale systems. Assists in the development and documenting of threat Intelligence procedures into playbooks. Ensures that Threat Intelligence documentation is comprehensive and accurate. Works closely with in various international Information Technology teams, state agencies and 3rd party suppliers to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors. Assists in the identification and development of existing mechanisms to detect security incidents and report on key metrics. Identifies and improves security incident detection and monitoring capabilities via industry known rules such as YARA, SIGMA, Snort, etc. Participates in the assessment, analysis, and design of improvements for the Threat Intelligence Program. Required A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent certification such as SANS Cyber Threat Intelligence (GCTI). A minimum of one year of experience, good understanding of cyber threat intelligence concepts and principles, and producing analytical assessments. High degree of ethics/confidentiality required and may be required to pass security screening. Ability to provide accurate analysis that minimizes bias and error. Understanding and experience handling numerous types of information security incidents, attacks, and events. Ability to develop processes and tools to effectively share actionable intelligence. A strong understanding of the intelligence cycle. Attention to detail and customer-focused. Ability to communicate technical issues to technical and non-technical audiences. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Ability to work under pressure in a team focused environment. Innovative, creative, and responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Willingness to work outside of regular business hours as required, which can include evenings, weekends and holidays. Ability to travel for occasional summits, events, conferences, and training. Recommended One or more professional security certifications such as CISSP (or equivalent). Experience with scripting languages. Experience with link analysis and data mining tools like Maltego. Experience with OSINT research capabilities. Experience with methodologies such as investigative pivoting models, investigative frameworks, as well as MITRE ATT&CK, and the Cyber Kill Chain. An understanding of geopolitics and cyber espionage groups. Experience with world languages such Russian, Mandarin, etc Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal and regulatory obligations; protecting member, employee and vendor privacy; and ensuring a technologically secure operating environment. Our Information Security Threat Analysts protect the integrity of Costco’s network through aggressive detection and monitoring of potentially malicious behavior. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Monitors, analyzes, and remediates cybersecurity events by adhering to defined operating procedures; works problem tickets, escalates and creates cases as needed; communicates with stakeholders during investigations leveraging appropriate security tools (i.e SIEM, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, EDR, AV, etc), and has a strong understanding of different types of attacks that can occur. Participates in documenting SOPs and playbooks; identifies and reports potential gaps in the environment that poses and overall risk to the company; adheres to compliance and privacy standards. Provides consultation and guidance to users, aligning to best practices while supporting customer needs. Builds strong relationships with business partners and sister teams across the Information Security organization while promoting diversity and inclusion amongst the team. Creates trusting relationships with team members and business partners; becomes a subject matter expert for other engineers on collaborative teams to provide expert knowledge on an ongoing basis. Models Costco’s culture and values while demonstrating the aptitude and capability to learn new tools and performing responsibilities with the highest standards of ethics and integrity. REQUIRED Experience with networking technologies such as: firewalls, routers, load balancers, and proxies. Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Demonstrated experience of “hands on” security knowledge of one or more of the following platforms: Windows, Linux, UNIX, AIX, or iSeries. Experience with threat modeling, security assessments, and evaluating mitigating controls. Experience with network-based detective controls like IDS, IPS, and various SIEMs Working knowledge of networking protocols. Working knowledge of web technologies. Ability to interpret information security data and processes to identify potential compliance issues. Ability to quickly understand complicated data flows in order to identify and validate security requirements. Must be a team player and willing to establish a strong positive working relationship with all areas of the business. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Recommended Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a minimum of 3 to 5 years’ of Information Systems security or related data processing auditing experience. Any of the following certifications: Certified Intrusion analyst (GCIAs), GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED), Certified Geographic Information Systems Professional (GISP), GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Security+ certification. Familiarity with SOA governance and policy management best practices. Familiarity with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal and regulatory obligations; protecting member, employee, and supplier privacy; and ensuring a technologically secure operating environment. Our Information Security Threat Analysts protect the integrity of Costco’s network through aggressive detection and monitoring of potentially malicious behavior. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Monitors, analyzes, and remediates cybersecurity events by adhering to defined operating procedures; working problem tickets, escalating and creating cases as needed, communicating with stakeholders during investigations leveraging appropriate security tools (i.e SIEM, Firewalls, IDS/IPS, EDR, AV, etc), and having a strong understanding of different types of attacks that can occur. Participates in documenting SOPs, playbooks, identifying and reporting potential gaps in the environment that poses and overall risk to the company; adhering to compliance and privacy standards. Provide consultation and guidance to users aligning to best practices while supporting customer needs. Builds strong relationships with business partners and sister teams across the Information Security organization while promoting diversity and inclusion amongst the team. Creates trusting relationships with team members and business partners by being a SME for other engineers on collaborative teams and provides expert knowledge on an ongoing basis. Models Costco’s culture and values while demonstrating the aptitude and capability to learn new tools and performing responsibilities with the highest standards of ethics and integrity. Required Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, load balancers, and proxies. Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Demonstrated experience of “hands on” security knowledge of one or more of the following platforms: Windows, Linux, UNIX, AIX, or iSeries. Experience with Threat Modeling, security assessments, and evaluating mitigating controls. Experience with network-based detective controls like IDS, IPS, and various SIEMs Working knowledge of networking protocols. Working knowledge of web technologies. Ability to interpret information security data and processes to identify potential compliance issues. Ability to quickly understand complicated data flows in order to identify and validate security requirements. Must be a team player and willing to establish a strong positive working relationship with all areas of the business. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Recommended Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a minimum of 3 to 5 years’ of Information Systems security or related data processing auditing experience. One or more certifications recommended but not required: Certified Intrusion analyst (GCIAs), GIAC Certified Enterprise Defender (GCED), Certified Geographic Information Systems Professional (GISP), GIAC Certified Incident Handler (GCIH), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Security+ certification. Familiarity with SOA governance and policy management best practices. Familiarity with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The Data Engineer is responsible for developing data pipelines and/or data integrations for Costco’s enterprise certified data sets that are used for business critical data consumption use cases (i.e. Reporting, Data Science/Machine Learning, Data APIs, etc.). At Costco, we are on a mission to significantly leverage data to provide better products and services for our members. This role is focused on data engineering to build and deliver automated data pipelines from a plethora of internal and external data sources. The Data Engineer will partner with product owners, engineering, and data platform teams to design, build, test, and automate data pipelines that are relied upon across the company as the single source of truth. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops and operationalizes data pipelines to create enterprise certified data sets that are made available for consumption (BI, Advanced analytics, APIs/Services). Works in tandem with Data Architects, Data Stewards, and Data Quality Engineers to design data pipelines and recommends ongoing optimization of data storage, data ingestion, data quality, and orchestration. Designs, develops, and implements ETL/ELT processes using Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services (IICS). Uses Azure services such as Azure SQL DW (Synapse), ADLS, Azure Event Hub, Cosmos, Databricks, Delta-Lake to improve and speed up delivery of our data products and services. Implements big data and NoSQL solutions by developing scalable data processing platforms to drive high-value insights to the organization. Identifies, designs, and implements internal process improvements; automates manual processes and optimizes data delivery. Identifies ways to improve data reliability, efficiency, and quality of data management. Communicates technical concepts to non-technical audiences both in written and verbal form. Performs peer reviews for other data engineers’ work. Required 5+ years’ experience engineering and operationalizing data pipelines with large and complex datasets. 3+ years’ hands-on experience with Informatica PowerCenter. 2+ years’ hands-on experience with Informatica IICS. 3+ years’ experience working with Cloud technologies such as ADLS, Azure Databricks, Spark, Azure Synapse, Cosmos DB, and other big data technologies. 5+ years’ experience with Data Modeling, ETL, and Data Warehousing. Extensive experience working with various data sources (DB2, SQL,Oracle, flat files (csv, delimited), APIs, XML, JSON). Advanced SQL skills; solid understanding of relational databases and business data; ability to write complex SQL queries against a variety of data sources. Strong understanding of database storage concepts (data lake, relational databases, NoSQL, Graph, data warehousing). Able to work in a fast-paced agile development environment. Recommended BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience. Azure Certifications. Experience implementing data integration techniques such as event/message based integration (Kafka, Azure Event Hub), ETL. Experience with Git/Azure DevOps. Experience delivering data solutions through agile software development methodologies. Exposure to the retail industry. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience working with SAP integration tools including BODS. Experience with UC4 Job Scheduler. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

locations: Issaquah, WA; Dallas, TX or Chicago, IL Data Scientist - Experience in Marketing Analytics, Personalization and Adobe Marketing Cloud This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Data Scientist - Data Analytics is responsible for generating insights and to augment decision making by the business. At Costco, we are on a mission to significantly leverage big data to provide better products and services for our members. This role is focused on advanced analytics, machine learning and data science delivery to support multiple business areas. This role will partner with Product Owner and business owners to build, test advanced analytics solutions and turn data into actionable insights. The Data Scientist is a knowledgeable leader with an ability to lead and is passionate about data and using machine learning to solve business problems. The right candidate will have deep knowledge of applying data science for forecasting, customer analysis, item and inventory management and other areas of retail. We are looking for a highly motivated, customer focused professional who wants to work in a fun and highly collaborative environment and willing to be the player as well as coach for the data science community at Costco. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Leads the analysis by applying statistics, machine learning and analytic approaches to predict and optimize business outcomes. Designs and builds ML/DL models to solve business problems. Correctly frames a problem and comes up with a hypothesis. Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of models on an ongoing basis. Identifies new data that could enhance the quality and accuracy of models to improve predictions. Communicates results effectively with storytelling and visualization. Coaches the team in feature engineering using machine learning techniques. Performs peer review for another Data Scientist’s work. Provides feedback to enhance the testing framework and MLOps. Extends beyond core data science work to perform data wrangling and data preparation. REQUIRED 5+ years’ experience in delivering business insights using advanced statistical and machine learning models and visualization. Proficiency in working with diverse databases and other data sources. Strong proficiency in Machine Learning, Statistical and Reporting tools (Python, R, SQL, PowerBI). Knowledge of Deep Learning and Neural Networks, and its applications. Strong experience working in Cloud (AWS, Azure) based analytics platform. Recommended Graduate degree in Computer Science, Data Science, and Statistics/Mathematics or related field. Experience in Marketing Analytics, Personalization and Adobe Marketing Cloud Knowledge of Agile software development. Experience in software development. Exposure to the retail industry. Experience leading team of data scientists. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Data Scientist - Data Analytics is responsible for generating insights and to augment decision making by the business. At Costco, we are on a mission to significantly leverage big data to provide better products and services for our members. This role is focused on advanced analytics, machine learning and data science delivery to support multiple business areas. This role will partner with Product Owner and business owners to build, test advanced analytics solutions and turn data into actionable insights. The Data Scientist is a knowledgeable leader with an ability to lead and is passionate about data and using machine learning to solve business problems. The right candidate will have deep knowledge of applying data science for forecasting, customer analysis, item and inventory management and other areas of retail. We are looking for a highly motivated, customer focused professional who wants to work in a fun and highly collaborative environment and willing to be the player as well as coach for the data science community at Costco. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Leads the analysis by applying statistics, machine learning and analytic approaches to predict and optimize business outcomes. Designs and builds ML/DL models to solve business problems. Correctly frames a problem and comes up with a hypothesis. Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of models on an ongoing basis. Identifies new data that could enhance the quality and accuracy of models to improve predictions. Communicates results effectively with storytelling and visualization. Coaches the team in feature engineering using machine learning techniques. Performs peer review for another Data Scientist’s work. Provides feedback to enhance the testing framework and MLOps. Extends beyond core data science work to perform data wrangling and data preparation. Required 5+ years’ experience in delivering business insights using advanced statistical and machine learning models and visualization. Proficiency in working with diverse databases and other data sources. Strong proficiency in Machine Learning, Statistical and Reporting tools (Python, R, SQL, PowerBI). Knowledge of Deep Learning and Neural Networks, and its applications. Strong experience working in Cloud (AWS, Azure) based analytics platform. Recommended Graduate degree in Computer Science, Data Science, and Statistics/Mathematics or related field. Experience in Marketing Analytics, Personalization and Adobe Marketing Cloud Knowledge of Agile software development. Experience in software development. Exposure to the retail industry. Experience leading team of data scientists. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

The Data Steward role is responsible for the implementation of enterprise data governance and data classification in their respective data domains (i.e. Sales & Inventory, Membership, Accounting, etc.). Their responsibilities include data management that consists of data cataloging, defining and documenting data definitions in a business glossary, metadata management and the creation and maintenance of data classification and standards. Data Stewards will assist in conducting data lineage, deriving business rules (attributes, calculations, derivations, etc.), understanding data attributes (columns) purpose and utilization, and contributing and maintaining metrics for measuring data quality. Data Stewards ensure Costco’s data supports varying business needs and complies with regulatory requirements and Costco data policies, maintaining consistent data quality across the enterprise so that the data consumers can effectively leverage Costco’s data. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Identifies opportunities for improving data quality and potential data controls within their respective data domain(s) to mitigate data issues. Designs guidelines around data access, assures metadata is captured correctly, and creates methods for monitoring and reporting any data quality incidents. Develops control structures within an environment to ensure the accuracy and quality of data through upstream and downstream data pipelines. Collects, organizes, monitors and promotes an accurate and consistent representation of data quality and controls via aggregated quality dashboards and scorecards. Performs data profiling and data cataloging to perform data classification. Partners with data consumers to ensure both data governance and data classification policies are followed. Supports the Test Data Management Team in identifying sensitive production data. Tracks issues raised by business users related to data access or security, business glossary, and lineage. Leads detailed evaluation of data quality and identifies anomalies and discrepancies within data domains. Provides data domain subject matter expertise to understand the root cause of data quality issues and partners with appropriate teams to implement corrective action. Participates in data governance forums. Supports the Product Manager in translating the quality requirements and potential data controls into technical requirements for epics and/or stories. Supports Data Architect(s) in defining logical metadata for data sources across data acquisition, data integration, data curation and data presentation layers. Supports the Data Platform Team(s) and partners with Information Security in the creation of data security models and strategies across multiple layers of the data infrastructure stack (i.e. Databases, Reporting, etc.) based on data classifications. Educates users and producers of data on the importance of certified data. Ensures standards are followed when data definitions are added to the data catalog. Coordinates with the business data owner to develop the business glossary, business definitions, and business rules. Identifies data dependencies and performs impact analysis in support of delivery, release, change management, and updates to business glossary and data lineage. Ensures that data supports varying business needs and regulatory requirements (i.e. PII, CCPA, etc.). Demonstrates understanding of Costco’s data access protocols and data quality rules (along with how to mitigate related issues). Required Minimum of 5 years of data governance experience, including data management principles, data glossary development, metadata development, data classification, and data quality rules. Experience meeting with business stakeholders Data classification and privacy experience Ability to influence and align various stakeholders to a common set of standards Recommended Data Governance experience in a retail environment Experience with a COTS data catalog, especially Informatica EDC and Axon Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work with technical and nontechnical staff Familiarity with the Data Management Body of Knowledge (DMBOK) Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) certification Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The Strategic Planning team partners with leadership to establish a consistent framework to prioritize business direction and align with IT priorities. The Technical Program Manager will establish dependencies between core business direction, solution designs, portfolio planning, and program management; providing the aligned source of direction across the IT horizontal and vertical teams. The Technical Program Manager on the IT Strategic Planning team provides direct program leadership to the delivery teams responsible for the foundational core services that will support the business’s omnichannel goals. We are looking for an experienced, hands-on Technical Program Manager to solve complex problems and support a team as they deliver innovative technology solutions. In this role, you will be responsible for scoping and delivering large projects end-to-end. Responsibilities include collection of business and systems requirements from internal and external customers, writing specifications, driving project schedules from design to release, and managing the production launch. You will lead and coordinate design/implementation efforts between internal teams and outside vendors to develop optimal solutions. You will be expected to make appropriate tradeoffs to optimize time-to-market, clearly communicate goals, roles, responsibilities, and desired outcomes to internal cross-functional and remote project teams. The right candidate will possess a strong technical program management background and will be able to demonstrate having led large cross-functional and cross-organizational projects. You must be able to thrive and succeed in an entrepreneurial environment unhindered by ambiguity or competing priorities. As a TPM, you will anticipate bottlenecks, provide escalation management, anticipate and make tradeoffs, and balance the business needs versus technical constraints. To be successful in this role, you should be comfortable creating and maintaining technical project plans and diving into the technical details to understand the nuances and complexities involved. You will lead by example, balancing development responsibilities while participating in cross team efforts including architecture planning. Maturity, high judgment, negotiation skills, ability to influence, analytical talent, and leadership are essential to success in this role. We have a diverse team and drive towards an inclusive culture and work environment. Our team is intentional about attracting, developing, and retaining amazing talent from diverse backgrounds. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works with the project team to define and document project scope. Provides technical leadership and contributions to improve delivery of new programs. Determines and drives engineering best practices across all of Costco IT. Identifies, tracks and resolves technical issues impacting multiple simultaneous projects. Presents well-reasoned and data-driven solution proposals in both verbal and written form to gain support, prioritize your recommendations on roadmaps, and deliver results. Works with functional managers to staff projects by acquiring the necessary personnel from the various functional areas. Creates a project plan and critical path with appropriate level of detail and manages tasks to support project governance requirements. Develops project budgets, manages changes and tracks actual costs and variance to approved budget. Manages issues, risks, and changes to project scope, schedule and budget. Manages the completion of project tasks according to the schedule. Communicates project status to IS and business management. Finalizes project through identification and summarization of lessons learned and creation of the project closedown report. Mentors team members in project management artifacts, processes, tools and techniques. Ensures all project artifacts and deliverables are documented, approved, and stored for re-usability, support, and audit purposes in designated project tools. Required Minimum of five years’ experience of Technical Program Management experience in a related industry. Minimum of five years’ Agile development experience. Demonstrated leadership in simultaneously managing multiple large, complex projects that span cross-functional teams, establishing sustainable processes while delivering on time, on budget, with requirements met. Experience working on frameworks or platforms consumed by a large developer audience. Experience conceptualizing complex interrelated applications and system platforms. Proven ability to develop business relationships and work successfully with people at all levels of management. Ability to communicate systems to non-technical team members and business partners. Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills to executive level business stakeholders. Proven ability to manage program/project level budgeting and provide financial tracking over several million dollars. Demonstrated ability to motivate project teams in the completion of projects. Extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Must be available for evening, weekend, and holiday work. Recommended PMP, Scaled Agile, Scrum Master or equivalent experience. LEAN Six Sigma certification encouraged. Successfully navigates a highly matrixed organization. Demonstrate technical and/or data related acumen, as a project manager. Working knowledge of Service Now (Carts+) Portfolio & Program Management module and/or similar tools such as; Smartsheets, MS Project, Ariba, Azure DevOps, Google Suite (e.g., Spreadsheets, Doc, Presentation, etc.). Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits — medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, commuter benefits, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan, SmartDollar financial wellness program, to eligible employees.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The Delivery Manager fosters a high performing Agile-centric approach across all delivery teams within a product. This position is responsible for the overall solution delivery and support of large-scale programs with complex integrations. Delivery Managers manage the communication across program stakeholders, define mitigation strategies to remediate risks and issues, and assist teams to ensure that the value being delivered aligns to the product vision defined by product managers. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Assists with the allocation of resources and provides teams with the necessary support to remediate impediments and reported issues . Facilitates program increment (PI) sessions across all delivery teams aligned to a product, value stream, or portfolio, and the accompanying planning sessions (pre and post PI planning sessions). Works with Product Owners and Scrum Masters to plan release schedules across products . Supports product teams with the delivery of new features and capabilities while empowering them and allowing them to be self-organized. Supports the Product Manager with the facilitation of system demos to demonstrate the integration of products to all stakeholders. Leads program increment retrospectives to identify opportunities to improve productivity . Monitors delivery team metrics to evaluate progress against delivery milestones (e.g., release burnups). Aggregates individual delivery team status into portfolio-level risks, assumptions, and interdependencies. Creates reports highlighting the health of the overall delivery status to portfolio and value stream leadership and various stakeholders. Leads regular “Scrum-of-Scrum” meetings with Scrum Masters from all product teams to drive alignment across development activities and review blockers or impediments impacting team productivity. Coordinates the resolution of internal and external dependencies across value streams and shared services. Drives tactical day-to-day delivery process, including removing impediments that impact productivity or block the team’s process. Ensures effective communication, collaboration, coordination, and team engagement in initiatives that cut across portfolios and products. Regular and reliable workplace attendance at your assigned location. Ability to operate vehicles, equipment or machinery. Computer, phone, printer, copier, fax Required 3+ years of Agile Team Leadership (PO, PdM, PgM, TPM, DM, RTE, SM). 3+ years of experience with Scaled Agile Framework or Agile Methodologies. Experience mentoring Scrum Masters, Product Owners, Product Managers in Agile practices. Experience optimizing SDLC processes to improve quantity and quality of work. Recommended Bachelor’s degree or higher. Ability to manage project delivery planning, estimating, budgeting, and metrics reporting. Ability to identify and mitigate technical delivery risks. Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume Last two performance reviews Attendance records for current year (Do not include absences covered by paid sick/personal time, FMLA or other protected absences.)
