Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. In this matrixed role, the Delivery Manager will be responsible for large projects in Costco’s FICO systems, the overall delivery of backlog enhancements within one or more product groups, and solution delivery and support of large-scale programs with complex integrations. This role leads technical, enterprise level initiatives by providing direction, and executing project work-streams and follow-up to ensure projects are delivered within scope, on time, and within budget. The DM ensures requirements are met and completed while meeting quality for operations, and establishing documented processes and service ownership for after the project ends. This position leads using a variety of project management practices, including waterfall and agile, to help the team keep a delivery and learning cadence that remains focused on delivering value against the product vision. The DM supports the ability of the team to deliver value by performing outward facing tasks such as financial tracking, stakeholder relationships (supporting the product owner) and reporting to a wider organization. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Drives large scale projects and collaborates with employees, leadership, clients and other internal and external stakeholders. Creates and maintains project management (plans, WBS, budgets, forecasts, resource tracking, schedules, change requests, etc.) and ensures the project requirements are defined and the project teams meet the project’s objectives. Allocates resources and provides teams with necessary support to address impediments. Works with product owners to plan release schedules from the technology perspective (i.e. coordinate teams for delivery against release schedule). Works with stakeholders to create a high-level preliminary release and project delivery plans for product features. Manages delivery team metrics to evaluate progress against delivery milestones (i.e. releases). Aggregates individual product team status into portfolio-level risks, assumptions and interdependencies. Reports on overall delivery status to program leadership and various stakeholders. Ensures effective communication, collaboration and team engagement in initiatives that cut across portfolios and products. Adheres to technology standards while developing systems. Establishes and organizes application development plans that align with the goals and strategies. Revises standards in response to change. Applies standard techniques and tools to carry out analysis and performance monitoring activities for specified products. Supports problem resolution, resolves issues and acts on feedback and usage of in-life products. Provides input to the requirements base-line. Investigates, manages and applies authorized requests for changes to base-lined requirements, in line with change management policy. Sets clear expectations for self and others and takes appropriate actions to ensure obligations are met. Required 2+ years’ experience as a Delivery Manager and/or Program/Project Manager in an Agile and Waterfall environment. Experience designing and implementing Agile processes. Experience working with Financial Control systems, SAP, iSeries and various Material Management systems. Proven track record for successful delivery of projects and working cross-functionally with business and IT. Strong process knowledge of SDLC and past experience leading development teams in Agile and Waterfall. Ability to create and manage detailed project plans and report critical paths. Understands Resource Management and the value of the resource management and may practice one or more behaviors associated with the skill. Recommended Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation. Working knowledge of Service Now (Carts+) Portfolio & Program Management module. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

This position is responsible for the overall solution delivery and support of large-scale programs with complex integrations. The Delivery Managers manages the communication across program stakeholders, defines mitigation strategies to remediate risks and issues, and assists teams to ensure that the value being delivered aligns to the product vision defined by product managers. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Assists with the allocation of resources and provides teams with the necessary support to remediate impediments and reported issues. Facilitates program increment (PI) sessions across all delivery teams aligned to a product, value stream, or portfolio and the accompanying planning sessions (pre and post PI planning sessions). Works with Product Owners and Scrum Masters to plan release schedules across products. Supports product teams with the delivery of new features and capabilities while empowering them and allowing them to be self-organized. Supports the Product Manager with the facilitation of system demos to demonstrate the integration of products to all stakeholders. Leads program increment retrospectives to identify improvement opportunities that can be implemented to increase productivity. Monitors delivery team metrics to evaluate progress against delivery milestones (e.g., release burnups). Aggregates individual delivery team status into portfolio-level risks, assumptions and interdependencies. Creates reports highlighting the health of the overall delivery status to portfolio and value stream leadership and various stakeholders. Leads regular “Scrum-of-Scrum” meetings with Scrum Masters from all product teams to drive alignment across development activities; reviews blockers or impediments impacting team productivity. Coordinates the resolution of internal and external dependencies across value streams and shared services. Drives tactical day-to-day delivery process, including removing impediments that negatively impact productivity or block the team’s process. Ensures effective communication, collaboration, coordination. and team engagement in initiatives that cut across portfolios and products. Required 3+ years’ of Agile Team Leadership (PO, PdM, PgM, TPM, DM, RTE, SM). 3+ years’ of experience with Scaled Agile Framework or Agile Methodologies. Experience mentoring Scrum Masters, Product Owners, Product Managers in Agile practices. Experience optimizing SDLC processes to improve quantity and quality of work. Recommended Bachelor’s degree or higher. Ability to manage project delivery planning, estimating, budgeting, and metrics reporting. Ability to identify and mitigate technical delivery risks. Costco’s Identity and Access Management (IAM) is responsible for the design and implementation of identity solutions that align with business goals and objectives. Costco is seeking a dedicated and experienced developer to join its IAM Provisioning team. They will participate in design sessions, and configuring and coding new features for various projects to support IAM toolings and/or applications. The development efforts will be focusing around, but not limited to SailPoint IIQ technology. The ideal candidate will work within the Costco development and project management methodologies. This role will be responsible for design, deployment, configuration, troubleshooting, monitoring and supporting Costco’s Provisioning Services Infrastructure including integration of systems and applications utilizing this infrastructure. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops features for integrating and connecting IAM services. Designs and implements solutions into existing environments and designing business workflows to ensure proper application mapping/flow. Creates conceptual and detailed technical design documents. Provides accurate and timely estimates (work breakdown schedules). Documents and executes unit and integration tests. Defines and implements standards and best practices for software development. Participates in code review sessions as a coordinator, owner, reader, recorder or observer. Supports the needs and requirements of other IT departments. Collaborates with Business Analysts, Solution Architects, Quality Assurance Analysts, and Software Developers in a DevOps model to extend the capabilities of the applications. Provides 3rd-level application support for the IAM applications. Required Minimum 3 years’ experience in SailPoint IIQ technology. Strong understanding of Role Based Access Control (RBAC) design and methodology. Strong scripting skills (e.g. Java, JavaScript, BeanShell, etc.). Working knowledge of Web Services, REST, SOAP, and XML technologies. Proficient working knowledge of code versioning tools. Experience product extensions and interfaces to ensure proper functionality and integration with other systems. Familiarity with continuous integration and continuous deployment concepts and tooling. Demonstrated ability to collaborate with other technical experts, develop solution and functional design documents to support development of final solutions, and provide project estimates and lead technical teams to consistently meet commitments. Able to provide project estimates and work-breakdown schedules. Extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency. Responsible, conscientious, organized, self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Detail-oriented and possess strong problem-solving skills, and ability to analyze potential future issues. Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including ability to communicate effectively with all levels of management. Able to manage priorities and timelines, with a focus on delivery. High integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business; available for periodic off-hours work including weekends and/or holidays as required. Recommended Experience as a development lead on major projects utilizing a formal software development lifecycle. Familiarity with Identity and Access Management architectures, solutions, and principles. Strong leadership and team building skills. Experience delivering complex and scalable business driven solutions. Knowledge of software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Able to share technical knowledge and clearly communicate technical concepts. Experience in Role Based Access Control (RBAC) data mining exercises. Knowledge of SAP connection methodology, such as BAPI, HANA, UME, etc. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Costco team is looking for a dedicated and skilled DevOps Engineer to join its Ancillary team. As a DevOps Engineer, your responsibilities will include the automation of software builds, deployment systems, and infrastructure. You will manage various development, test, staging, and demo environments (code deployment, backups, data refreshes), as well as deploy and manage software into Costco’s environments while leveraging as much automation as possible. You will be responsible for continually advancing the technology in a collaborative and creative agile environment using many of the latest technologies and industry best practices and finding better and more efficient ways of delivering solutions that meet business objectives. You will oversee the code releases, combining an understanding of both engineering and coding. From creating and implementing systems software to analyzing data to improve existing ones, a DevOps Engineer increases productivity in the workplace. They understand the software development lifecycle and have a clear understanding of various automation tools for developing digital pipelines (CI/ CD pipelines). If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs, develops, maintains, documents and implements complex Azure Infrastructure environments. Maintains, extends and builds automated Continuous Improvement (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) pipelines . Builds deployment automation with configuration as code to provision Azure cloud services/infrastructure and in non-Production and Production environments. Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions. Follows documented standards and best practices. Works in an Agile environment, collaborates with Operations, Development, and QA functions to develop solutions and systems that are predisposed to scalability, security and simplified maintenance. Designs, develops, documents and implements complex environments for our business partners, vendors and teams. Builds innovative automated solutions to migrate legacy systems and processes to the cloud. Provides technical consultation to our business, vendors and project teams. Develops and documents standards and best practices, and mentors junior engineers. Resolves complex issues in creative and effective ways, adapted to each customer's needs. Provisions applications in virtualized or container based platforms on Linux\Windows systems. Integrates Systems including SQL, Messaging tools and Application code with operating systems and infrastructure. Interprets complex issues and clearly communicates them to others. Stays abreast of existing and emerging DevOps technologies and tools. Monitors official builds and drives infrastructure issues to resolution. Uses tools such as Azure DevOps, Terraform, Jenkins, Puppet, Azure Test Labs and Git to improve and speed up delivery of our products and services. Participates in release processes and contributes to tooling improvement. Drives each team to be self-sufficient by providing tools and training and brings different teams together to work towards common goals. Required 3+ years’ experience with Automation and Orchestration tooling/technology (Azure DevOps, Terraform, Jenkins, Git, etc.). Experience supporting, maintaining and monitoring data pipelines (real time & batch). Strong scripting skills (Powershell, Bash, Python etc.). Working Knowledge of XML, JSON, and Terraform HCL. Knowledge of Agile Methodologies (scrum, kanban). Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Must be extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency. Responsible, conscientious, organized, self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Costco is looking for an experienced Digital Accessibility Analyst to join the IT eCommerce User Experience (UX) team. The Digital Accessibility Analyst is responsible for ensuring eCommerce web properties meet the W3C’s WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards as well as accessibility related laws globally. The ideal candidate will be an empathetic and collaborative problem-solver who communicates effectively with a diverse group of stakeholders who is committed to delivering accessible websites and apps for all Costco business areas. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Manages and schedules ongoing audits for all Costco websites and mobile applications assessing accessibility compliance. Manages, analyzes, and responds to all accessibility audits with external accessibility suppliers. Tracks, reports, and assists eCommerce project/product teams (user experience, business requirements, development, testing, and business content). Tracks, reports, and assists eCommerce business working with third parties in resolving accessibility issues/findings for all digital properties. Communicates findings to leadership teams (IT and business); holds teams accountable for established practices; supports established compliance guidelines. Establishes ongoing mandatory accessibility training for eCommerce teams (User experience, business requirements, development and testing, and business content). Creates and maintains Accessibility Best Practices documentation to host audit findings, remediation plans, best practices, and recommendations. Documents training materials, tutorials, relevant accessibility links, third-party sites, and integrations accessibility standards and governance. Required Minimum 2 years’ accessibility experience with analysis and design in a digital enterprise environment. Knowledge of accessibility standards, specifically the WCAG 2.1 AA. Experience with assistive technology (e.g. screen readers, magnifiers, alternative input, etc.) for desktop and mobile. Demonstrated proficiency with selecting appropriate UI patterns and applying user-centered design (UCD) methodologies to effectively solve accessibility design problems. Strong understanding of responsive web design principles, techniques, and frameworks. Experience with front-end development technologies (HTML/CSS/JavaScript). Excellent task management and organizational skills with ability to work collaboratively with multiple groups or self-directed as needed. Strong presentation and facilitation skills to clearly communicate assistive technology needs and design decisions to multiple stakeholder groups. Strategic thinker; ability to act tactically and solve problems quickly. Ability to manage multiple projects at one time. Recommended Bachelor's degree in Human Computer Interaction (HCI), Design, or a related field. Certification in Accessibility is a plus. Knowledge of react, single page accessibility patterns and mobile accessibility. Familiarity with Websphere and hybris/SAP eCommerce platforms. Working knowledge of Figma. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. As a member of the IT Management Team, you will be responsible for leading, overseeing and developing an effectively engaged team of employees. In general your role will include overseeing team performance and deliverables. However, the role of a leader within our organization requires more than the oversight of resources and day-to-day operations. As a steward of the company, you will be expected to build a relationship and partner with the business teams that will influence the development and execution of all your team's strategic vision. You will also be expected to ensure that your team’s actions align with the larger goals of the company and the IT Division. In a Director role within Global eCommerce, you will be expected to develop and nurture a very collaborative relationship with every country team being supported. This will need to be done creatively as you work with global time differences. Keeping more than a dozen countries in alignment on strategic directions will be done through strategic planning with resulting roadmaps for every area you support, which will be an absolute requirement. This role will oversee multiple areas covering Technical Operations, DevOps, Automation, Data Management along with Security and Compliance and will be expected to Drive Technical Excellence through appropriate disciplines, processes, and standards. As the primary conduit between your employees and upper leadership, your role in communicating and modeling the values and guiding principles of our company culture is of vital importance. All members of IT Management should strive to consciously and consistently foster a culture of engagement, trust, and “open door” communication. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE INTEGRITY: When achieving benchmarks and goals, use methods/strategies that are consistent with the Code of Ethics and the Standard of Ethics for Managers and Supervisors. Always leads by example. Appropriately handles employee concerns and follows through to resolution. MEMBER SERVICE: Provides and ensures staff provides an exceptional member experience. ADMINISTRATION: Ensures proper department coverage (writing schedule and break aids if needed). Understands department budget, able to research and explain budget variances. MANAGING PERFORMANCE: Coaches and mentors employees to provide support and guidance. Has regular open and honest conversations with employees to discuss work performance and career development. Identifies learning opportunities to strengthen employee knowledge, skill and ability. COMMUNICATION: Regularly shares information with employees via meetings and one-on-one conversations. Successfully navigates difficult conversations with employees, members, and suppliers. Listens, expresses empathy and adapts to get points across. Addresses issues immediately to ensure a timely resolution and to avoid escalating the situation. Consistently demonstrates business knowledge during interactions with senior management. SELF-MANAGEMENT: Demonstrates sound judgment, taking a partner when necessary. INCLUSION : Encourages different approaches and ideas to work and to accomplish goals. Seeks employee input. Takes the time to get to know or reach out to candidates who show potential that may not come forward on their own. COMPLIANCE AND SAFETY: Takes measures to ensure employee and member information is kept confidential and adheres to IS security policy. Travels globally as needed. This is a full-time management/leadership position (45+ hours per week). Required 5+ years’ of experience managing highly experienced engineers that have been responsible for eCommerce platforms, networks, and databases. Proven experience in managing and overseeing infrastructures and databases that stood on the Google Cloud Platform. Proven experience in managing and overseeing an eCommerce solution that is classified as a ‘Service Provider’. Proven experience in managing and overseeing infrastructures and networks of highly available eCommerce sites, specifically those based on SAP Commerce. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, 24 x 7 x 365 operations - evening, weekend, and holidays; able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams. Ability and willingness to travel globally. HIPAA Training and Supervisors Orientation (within 30 days of hire); Leadership Development 101 (within one year); Costco Pay Policies (within 90 days of promotion). Recommended Familiarity with Atlassian tools including JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo. Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency. As a steward of the company, you will be expected to build a relationship and partner with the business teams that will influence the development and execution of all your team's strategic vision. You will also be expected to ensure that your team’s actions align with the larger goals of the company and the IT Division. In a Director role within Global eCommerce, you will be expected to develop and nurture a very collaborative relationship with every country team being supported. This will need to be done creatively as you work with global time differences. Keeping more than a dozen countries in alignment on strategic directions will be done through strategic planning with resulting roadmaps for every area you support, which will be an absolute requirement. This role will oversee multiple areas covering Technical Operations, DevOps, Automation, Data Management along with Security and Compliance and will be expected to Drive Technical Excellence through appropriate disciplines, processes, and standards. As the primary conduit between your employees and upper leadership, your role in communicating and modeling the values and guiding principles of our company culture is of vital importance. All members of IT Management should strive to consciously and consistently foster a culture of engagement, trust, and “open door” communication. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE INTEGRITY: When achieving benchmarks and goals, use methods/strategies that are consistent with the Code of Ethics and the Standard of Ethics for Managers and Supervisors. Always leads by example. Appropriately handles employee concerns and follows through to resolution. MEMBER SERVICE: Provides and ensures staff provides an exceptional member experience. ADMINISTRATION: Ensures proper department coverage (writing schedule and break aids if needed). Understands department budget, able to research and explain budget variances. MANAGING PERFORMANCE: Coaches and mentors employees to provide support and guidance. Has regular open and honest conversations with employees to discuss work performance and career development. Identifies learning opportunities to strengthen employee knowledge, skill and ability. COMMUNICATION: Regularly shares information with employees via meetings and one-on-one conversations. Successfully navigates difficult conversations with employees, members, and suppliers. Listens, expresses empathy and adapts to get points across. Addresses issues immediately to ensure a timely resolution and to avoid escalating the situation. Consistently demonstrates business knowledge during interactions with senior management. SELF-MANAGEMENT: Demonstrates sound judgment, taking a partner when necessary. INCLUSION : Encourages different approaches and ideas to work and to accomplish goals. Seeks employee input. Takes the time to get to know or reach out to candidates who show potential that may not come forward on their own. COMPLIANCE AND SAFETY: Takes measures to ensure employee and member information is kept confidential and adheres to IS security policy. Travels globally as needed. This is a full-time management/leadership position (45+ hours per week). Required 5+ years’ of experience managing highly experienced engineers that have been responsible for eCommerce platforms, networks, and databases. Proven experience in managing and overseeing infrastructures and databases that stood on the Google Cloud Platform. Proven experience in managing and overseeing an eCommerce solution that is classified as a ‘Service Provider’. Proven experience in managing and overseeing infrastructures and networks of highly available eCommerce sites, specifically those based on SAP Commerce. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, 24 x 7 x 365 operations - evening, weekend, and holidays; able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams. Ability and willingness to travel globally. HIPAA Training and Supervisors Orientation (within 30 days of hire); Leadership Development 101 (within one year); Costco Pay Policies (within 90 days of promotion). Recommended Familiarity with Atlassian tools including JIRA, Confluence, BitBucket, Bamboo. Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency. This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The eCommerce Services Management team is highly visible and critical to the success of our website business by enabling Costco’s current and future growth plans. This team works closely with external vendors and internal IT teams to establish, drive and ensure that our service level objectives are met and effectively improve service uptime and performance. The Infrastructure Analyst for eCommerce Services Management is responsible for implementing, automating and maintaining the core elements of the eCommerce Services Management program. The Infrastructure Analyst will analyze systems and services ensuring optimum performance, availability and scalability with an emphasis on internal and external API and componentized services hosted in a hybrid environment. The Infrastructure Analyst will be responsible for alerting, evaluating, troubleshooting, resolving and reporting on API services that are hosted in local or remote network-based cloud products. Success in this role will require the individual to effectively work with vendors and internal IT teams to conduct investigations of business problems with automated systems solutions, contributing to the evaluation and design of systems used throughout the IT solution set. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Defines, manages and reports against Service Level Objectives and Indicators to ensure efficiency and reliability across all production systems. Collaborates with vendors to define SLAs and response times are precise and achievable, factoring in all connections required to meet the overall SLO. Works closely with vendor support teams to coordinate resolution to system issues, ensuring vendors meet Costco’s service levels and objectives as defined. Implements system strategies that ensure the scalability and the elasticity of the service infrastructure. Analyzes data from multiple angles that include network, platform, software, API integration and database looking for trends that highlight problems or opportunities Leverages existing reporting and alerting through established monitoring tools to ingest 3rd party vendor data and ensure optimization. This includes ensuring internal monitoring tools integrate with vendor API’s. Develops a comprehensive understanding of the applications and infrastructure within the eCommerce environment and how they impact member experience, site performance, stability, and quality. Evaluates the impact of code on performance, scalability and resiliency of the production infrastructure; coordinates upgrades, patches and configuration changes as necessary. Partners with software engineers and technology leadership to understand operational strategy and then deliver against those expectations. Builds out engagement models to ensure processes are optimized around services management engagement with other teams and vendors. Develops monitoring, alerting and reporting to allow for the identification of issues and trends which will be remediated by implementation of automation to recover from errors without manual intervention. Develops automation for the identification of issues and response to issues identified. Measurement and trending of issue and response will be critical. Implements and optimizes tooling for the Development and Ops teams to improve efficiency, velocity, and stability. Develops, maintains and publishes services layer documentation ensuring it includes inventory, process, configuration and design documents . Required 8+ years’ experience provisioning and supporting complex production environments, preferably in an eCommerce environment. 5+ years’ experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Tivoli, and Dynatrace. 3+ years’ experience focusing on API Management configuration and related interfaces. Deep understanding of integration and API concepts, patterns, and technologies. Strong understanding of commercial rest gateways with a focus on Apigee Experience in analyzing system performance data for performance characteristics, identifying potential future problems. Experience with Cloud and on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services and machine data technologies (Dynatrace, Splunk). Strong understanding of OS fundamentals (AIX/ Linux/ Windows) with proven expertise in solving performance issues. Excellent understanding of scalability processes and technique to manage growth and performance of the systems. Experience with scripting frameworks and languages such as Bash or Powershell. Broad technical knowledge of enterprise compute platforms, virtualization, OS’s (Windows) Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, load balancers, and proxies. Experience with application performance tuning, monitoring, testing and troubleshooting. Ability to collaborate with architecture, database, and application teams regarding all pre-production environments. Ability to explain complex solutions to an audience with a wide variety of technical skills and background. Ability to guide and mentor others through the design, build and implementation phases of system deployments. Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack, including web and mobile front end, caching layers, CDN and memory, file system, and relational databases. Ability to find the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Detail-oriented and possess strong problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong proven leadership/team building and personnel development skills. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Responsible, conscientious and possess a passion for excellence. Strong interpersonal skills, able to work with people at all management levels. Works well under pressure and in a crisis situation. Recommended Exposure to virtual environment management such concepts and tools such as PowerVM and VMWare. Exposure to middleware technologies such as MQ Messaging, Message Broker or equivalent. This position will be responsible for developing detailed business requirements, process flow diagrams, and user journeys, along with other appropriate standard analysis artifacts. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative and creative problem-solver who communicates effectively while working with a diverse group of stakeholders and executive level leadership. The selected candidate will be involved in program/project implementations. This individual will support multiple customers and stakeholders throughout the project life cycle to help realize business benefits and define a set of business requirements and user journeys that will translate into valuable business solutions and technology systems. The candidate will work closely with end users, user experience designers, business unit representatives, development architects/engineers, quality assurance and others in all stages of the project lifecycle including discovery, design, construction, testing, and implementation. This individual should demonstrate the highest levels of customer service, communication, productivity and professionalism. In addition, the candidate will have the ability and aptitude for leadership and self-motivation, possessing strong analytical skills expertise. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Determines business influence and relationship needs. Builds and manages business relationships including business partners, users, vendors, customers, project team members, and management leaders. Interacts with technical team(s) to translate functional specifications into technology solutions. Develops business analysis artifacts (use cases, customer journeys, business models, etc.) to document “as-is” and “to-be” requirements and change management plans as they pertain to specific projects and/or functional areas. Identifies and communicates risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope. Prioritizes requirements effectively based on appropriately identified factors. Organizes and synthesizes large amounts of information provided by stakeholders. Ensures that all requirements and journeys support the delivery of business value, fulfill goals and objectives, and meet stakeholder needs. Leads and participates in Business and User Acceptance sessions for confirmation of requirements. Collaborates with solution architects, process specialists, software developers, and other project stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences. Analyzes and evaluates current user interfaces and proposes usability improvements. Conducts competitive analysis research to better understand prevalent interaction solutions. Creates interactive simulations/prototypes to help project teams, stakeholders, and users explore and understand proposed business solutions. Ensures appropriate stakeholders are involved and obtains required information for capturing and validating requirements, journeys and other artifacts. Manages requirements traceability and future reuse. Prepares artifacts in an understandable and presentable format. Required Minimum 8 years’ Business Analysis and eCommerce experience. Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific user journeys, programs/projects involved. Proficient in requirements gathering, business modeling, user journey modeling/documenting, project scoping, and use case creation. High level proficiency in utilizing development, data, and business process analysis tools/utilities (SDLC, Business Process models, use case modeling, context diagramming, functional decomposition). Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, analytics. Exceptional communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills (many interactions will be with teams where English is not their primary language). Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables. Proven experience in Agile/DevOps methodologies. Strong process knowledge of System Development Life Cycles. Experience with executing project governance including change control and issue/risk management. Working knowledge of Project Management Tools (Confluence, JIRA, Microsoft Project, SmartSheets, etc.) and standard SQA Tools. Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills as well as a positive attitude. Proven leadership skills, demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization. Extreme responsiveness with a strong sense of urgency. Adept at assessing issues with ability to devise workable solutions quickly responding appropriately. Able to work independently. Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans. Flexible, must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction, able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines. Must be able to adjust work hours to accommodate global teams. Ability and willingness to travel globally. 24 x 7 x 365 operations - evening, weekend, and holiday work will be required. Recommended Experience in Ecommerce Solutions (specifically SAP Commerce Platforms). BA in Business Analysis, Business, Information Technology, or equivalent. Professional business analysis certifications, such as CBAP or CCBA. Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions. SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. 2-5 years of retail business knowledge. Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, Mandarin a plus. Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team. Costco’s eCommerce Security team is responsible for designing, implementing, and developing the security stack that secures our eCommerce platform. This team works closely with Costco’s eCommerce business teams to mitigate attacks, limit impact from vulnerabilities, and protect member data. The team is also responsible for ensuring stakeholders within Security Operations have the visibility they need to detect and respond to potential eCommerce attacks. An eCommerce Solution Architect’s responsibilities include assessment of current eCommerce security tooling to identify gaps, designing solutions to address the gaps, setting eCommerce security strategy based on business needs, and developing the eCommerce security roadmap. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Leads the application of Costco’s eCommerce Security roadmap. Develops and recommends strategies for eCommerce Security across all platforms. Analyzes and helps bridge the gap between current state architectures/solutions and target state. Acts as an internal consultant to IT teams for Identity related solutions throughout the systems development lifecycle. Provides solutions that meet both security and operational objectives. Leads internal subject matter in Identity related technology and architecture. Leads evaluation and POCs for Identity products and technology. Develops repeatable patterns and security reference architecture for project architects to leverage. Briefs senior management within the organization and architecture with related issues and solutions. Partners with Enterprise Architects to include Identity goals in Costco’s overall architecture. Designs solutions that integrate with cloud and hybrid cloud architecture. Adapts to meet changing priorities and tasks to accomplish goals/objectives. Performs technical lead responsibilities for small to medium software projects. Mentors Identity Analysts and Engineers. Defines, implements, and validates requirements for the availability, scalability, maintainability, and security of eCommerce solutions. Collaborates and sustains relationships with internal Costco teams. Required Experience in designing and implementing enterprise-wide eCommerce security solutions. Experience in one or more of the following areas: WAF, RASP, Akamai, bot management, DDoS management, and mitigating layer 7 attacks. Experience with installing, configuring, and upgrading/migrating eCommerce security solutions. Comprehensive knowledge of hardware, software, application, and system engineering. Keen interest in providing best practice solutions for overall eCommerce strategy. Knowledge of security concepts (encryption using keys, SSL, HTTPS). Able to work independently and collaboratively in a cross team environment. Strong interpersonal and leadership skills - communication, collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation skills. Detail-oriented and able to demonstrate strong problem-solving skills. Extremely responsive and possess a strong sense of urgency. Recommended Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience. Microsoft, Cloud, and Security Certifications (e.g. Certificate of Cloud Security Knowledge (CCSK), Microsoft Certified Specialist Implementing Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Solutions, CISSP, CISM, etc.) Certifications in Architecture (TOGAF, Microsoft Azure, ISSAP or related). The role of every Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal and regulatory obligations; protecting member, employee and vendor privacy; and ensuring a technologically secure operating environment. Our CyberSecurity Dynamic Defense Engineers protect the integrity of Costco’s network through aggressive detection and monitoring of potentially malicious behavior and through the development and implementation of our SOAR platform. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE W rit es detection logic for various tools. D evelop es , creat es , and wri tes SOAR automations/playbooks with a strong understanding of python. Participates in documenting SOPs, playbooks, identifying and reporting potential gaps in the environment that poses an overall risk to the company; adhering to compliance and privacy standards. Provides consultation and guidance to users aligning to best practices while supporting customer needs. Build s strong relationships with business partners and sister teams across the Information Security organization while promoting diversity and inclusion amongst the team, creating trusting relationships with team members and business partners and being a SME for other engineers on collaborative teams to provide expert knowledge on an ongoing basis. Models Costco’s culture and values while demonstrating the aptitude and capability to learn new tools and performing responsibilities with the highest standards of ethics and integrity. Required Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, load balancers, and proxies. Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Demonstrated experience of “hands on” security knowledge of one or more of the following platforms: Windows, Linux, UNIX, AIX, or iSeries. Experience with Threat Modeling, security assessments, and evaluating mitigating controls. Experience with network-based detective controls like IDS, IPS, SOAR, and various SIEMs Working knowledge of the XSOAR platform, be able to write playbooks for automation Working knowledge of web technologies. Ability to quickly understand complicated data flows in order to identify and validate security requirements. Must be a team player and willing to establish a strong positive working relationship with all areas of the business. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. jobTitle: Engineer - Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Asset and Cloud Intelligence
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Cybersecurity Infrastructure team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member’s and employee’s privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Engineer will be a key member of the Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Asset and Cloud Intelligence team that will support, maintain, and develop tools and projects focused on delivering asset visibility and intelligence to the Information Security and Compliance departments. The Engineer should have in-depth knowledge of system discovery and data management software and tools. They will work with management and vendors for product consideration including the auditing of information system activities. As a Subject Matter Expert, they will provide consultative services, drive innovation in technology, process, and procedure. Additional responsibilities include: maintaining operational excellence for their tools, services, and programs; creating and maintaining documentation related to policies, standards and procedures; leading and mentoring team members with lesser subject matter expertise. The Engineer should have in-depth working experience and knowledge of asset discovery, system integration, data collection, consolidation, manipulation, validation and reporting; solid skills in Windows and Linux environments along with experience with working with enterprise networks; experience with cybersecurity frameworks and best practices. This work will involve working with many groups throughout IT both domestically and internationally. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Assesses existing Cybersecurity Infrastructure platforms and tools. Creates the roadmap for addressing capability gaps, maturity improvements and innovation. Supports security standards and procedures; identifies, develops and implements mechanisms to detect sensitive data and security incidents. Mentors and develops team members. Evaluates and hardens tooling and instrumentation to prevent cybersecurity exploits. Performs duties necessary to assist in establishing practices and system configurations to ensure the safety of information systems assets and to protect information systems from intentional or inadvertent access or destruction. Works with information systems custodians (i.e., department managers, user community and systems administrators) at different levels in the organization to understand their respective security needs and assist with implementing practices and procedures consistent with Costco’s Information Security Policy. Assists with monitoring and auditing of information systems activities and systems to confirm information security policy compliance and provide management with security policy compliance assessments and system monitoring reports. Works with stakeholders to provide security solutions that support their business requirements. Conducts security risk assessments on new products and systems, periodic security risk assessments on existing systems and identifies and/or recommends appropriate security countermeasures and best practices. Coordinates activities or engagements with loss prevention, and interacts with legal and law enforcement. Identifies security gaps that expose Costco to potential exploit and develops short and long term prioritized remediations to address those gaps ensuring management is apprised of the risk in a timely manner. Maintains current knowledge of industry trends and standards. Assumes a leadership role in advocating internally and externally for compliance with security measures to protect Costco’s applications and environments. Required A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or a minimum of 8 years information systems security experience. Expertise in managing IT Asset Management (ITAM) or CMDB systems such as Service Now, Axonius, Etc. Experience with integrating disparate systems for data enrichment such as using PowerBI or APIs. Experience performing complex data management, validation, reporting, and analysis. Experience with discovery protocols and tools such as Ping, NMAP, ARP, SNMP, etc. Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers, and proxies. 3 - 5 years’ experience with deploying, configuring and securing cloud PaaS & IaaS resources such as Azure, GCP and AWS. Experience with at least one scripting/programming language: PowerShell, shell scripting, python, etc. Working knowledge of information systems security standards/practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers, using appropriate language, examples and tone. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Demonstrates a high level of communication skills, verbal and written. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness and quality of work. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business; may include evenings, weekends and holidays as required. Recommended One or more professional certifications such as Security+, Network+, CCNA, GSEC, CISA or CISSP (or equivalent work experience). Thorough experience within both Windows and Linux environments. Experience managing and using Configuration Management systems such as SCCM, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, etc. Strong knowledge of scalable multi-tier enterprise-level applications. Working knowledge of protocols and technologies such as ICMP, HTTP/HTTPS, SSH, SFTP, SNMP and DNS. Thorough understanding of the OSI model, as well as IPv4/IPv6 protocol suite. Working knowledge and experience with data warehouses and data lakes would be beneficial. Experience performing computer forensics. Experience with ITILv2/v3 processes such as Service Support, Service Delivery, or Continual Service Improvement. Experience with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI. Experience in a DevOps or DevSecOps environment. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Experience with wired and wireless network-based passive and active controls such as IDS and IPS. Working knowledge of networking protocols, web technologies, and cloud computing. Ability to interpret information security data and processes to identify potential compliance issues. Ability to quickly understand complicated data flows in order to identify and validate security requirements. Must be a team player and willing to establish a strong positive working relationship with all areas of the business. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including evenings, weekends, and holidays. Recommended One or more professional network and security certifications such as Security+, Network+, CCNA, GSEC, CISA or CISSP (or equivalent work experience). Experience with ITILv2/v3 processes such as Service Support, Service Delivery, or Continual Service Improvement. This Cybersecurity Infrastructure Engineer position will be a key member of the Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Network Security team that will design, develop, and deploy tools, services, programs, and projects involving network security technologies. ROLE Takes assessment of existing Cybersecurity Infrastructure platforms and tools. Creates the roadmap for addressing capability gaps, maturity improvements, and innovation. Mentors and develops team members. Evaluates and hardens tooling and instrumentation to prevent cybersecurity exploits. Performs and/or coordinates regular security assessments of existing or new infrastructure. Performs duties necessary to assist in establishing practices and system configurations to ensure the safety of information systems assets and to protect information systems from intentional or inadvertent access or destruction. Works with information systems custodians (i.e., department managers, user community and systems administrators) at different levels in the organization to understand their respective security needs and assist with implementing practices and procedures consistent with Costco’s Information Security Policy. Coordinates activities or engagements with loss prevention, interact with legal and law enforcement as required. Identifies security gaps that expose Costco to potential exploit and develops short and long term prioritized remediations to address those gaps ensuring management is apprised of the risk in a timely manner. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers using appropriate language, examples, and tone. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The International Systems Engineer provides senior expertise regarding the overall international IT ecosystem inclusive of web, application, middleware, and database layers and their interactions. The Engineer works with architects and project managers to understand functional requirements and contributes to the development of the overall architecture. This position will meet regularly with other areas of IS to determine technology requirements, offer advice, collaborate on designs, perform implementations, and deliver project based artifacts. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Understands and adheres to Costco’s project methodology and framework. Handles complex issues and ensures timely recovery from outages, performs root cause analysis, and implements preventative measures. Acts as a team lead and mentors others. Follows enterprise standards for security and best practices. Seeks opportunities to learn, automate, document, share, educate, and improve processes where appropriate. Interfaces with and provides technical leadership to others in the IT division and business to address ongoing business needs. Documents the application infrastructure and teaches/shares with others as necessary. Solution Planning: Works with suppliers, business, application development teams, and other technical teams to meet the needs of the project. Works with architects and Solution Analysts to develop, implement, and support new capabilities and designs. Assesses all project information to understand the scope, the current IT and business environment, objectives, and priorities. Defines and documents the proposed, high-level solution, including the use of Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) packages. Analyzes technical risks and advises on risk mitigation strategies. Identifies teams/resources needed based on the proposed solution. Works with the Project Manager and Business Analyst to develop a high-level project schedule, resource plan for the project, and project costs. Solution Delivery: Assists/provides project managers with work breakdown of tasks and effort estimates. Delivers project based work and artifacts to agreed upon target dates. Works with project managers and engineers to report and remove roadblocks. Oversees the technical content (architecture and design), integrity, and quality of solution. Oversees the delivery of the solution as specified (by requirements and architecture). Prepares for the development of the application by evaluating and selecting the development methodologies and tools. Analyzes available assets (frameworks, reference architectures, etc) to bridge the gap between the as-is architecture and the to-be architecture. Evaluates non-functional requirements for testability and technical acceptance criteria. Establishes high-level models that guide solution architecture design, sub-architecture, or deployment and reviews with all interested parties. Adheres to IT standards. Defines and documents the actions needed to close architecture gaps in support of business objectives. Participates in reviews of the designs, prototypes, and other technical deliverables to ensure they fulfill requirements and meet standards. Refines architectural decisions, at a project level, related to the infrastructure, data architecture, etc. Develops conceptual data models and performs data source gap analysis. Identifies services to be developed and integrated into IT solutions. Ensures the end-to-end service architectural roadmap to address the standard service and customization options. Defines and implements plans to address the service's integration points with other services. Required 3+ years’ Identity Access Management and PKI patterns, concepts, best practices, design, installation, and scripting. 3+ years’ ESB patterns, concepts, best practices, design, and installation. 3+ years’ Cloud technology Integration best practices, design patterns, and installation. 3+ years’ Data Integration Services patterns, Migration, Bi-Directional sync, Correlation, and Aggregation best practices. 3+ years’ Middleware tools WAS, JBoss (EAP), IBM MQ/IIB, RPC, and API patterns, concepts, and best practices (i.e. B2B/EDI, API, Mobile application/backend, IoT and Cloud). Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to concisely and effectively communicate across teams, stakeholders and Executive Sponsors. Experience in designing and deploying integrated solutions. Experience in developing Technical Integration Designs and Macro Development Designs. Recommended Bachelor’s Degree in International Business, CS, or MIS. Knowledge of scripting languages Python, Ruby, JSON, Perl, and Bash. Proficient in service oriented architecture (SOA), messaging, object-oriented programming concepts, and enterprise service bus. Ability to quickly understand current environments and to use that information to build stable, responsive, and secure solutions. The professional will address any issues related to security and performance. They will partner with other IT professionals for software and hardware installations, specification, testing and service transition. The architect will have to identify the potential technology innovations and engage with businesses. The architect needs to guide in execution of Incident, Change, Release, Problem, Performance, and Availability Management. Creates transitional architecture views as part of solution design. Adheres to IT standards and policies. Defines and documents the actions needed to close architecture gaps in support of business objectives. Knowledge of IT Application architecture, Design methodologies across multiple platforms. Excellent verbal and written communication skills (facilitation, negotiation, conflict resolution) at all levels. Enterprise Architects work on behalf of the OCIO to develop IT strategies through which to enable business strategy; develop enterprise level target architectures and transition plans through which to enable IT and business strategies; align functional, technical and solution architectures with established enterprise target architectures; monitor progress towards achieving IT strategies and enterprise target architectures; and manage IT strategy and enterprise target architecture change as needed to support evolving IT and business strategy. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Captures and understands business goals and strategies. Captures and understands business operating models (functions, locations, capabilities and associated processes, value chains, organizational model, etc.). Captures and understands how a given business operating model is supported by information system solutions and services. Analyzes industry, technology and market trends to determine their potential impacts on the enterprise. Analyzes current business and IT environments and aligns business and technology resources to achieve strategic outcomes and/or improve organizational performance. Develops IT strategies through which to enable business strategy. Develops enterprise target architectures and transition plans through which to enable IT and business strategies. Aligns functional, technical and solution architectures with established enterprise target architectures. Monitors progress towards achieving IT strategies and enterprise target architectures. Manages IT strategy and enterprise target architecture change as needed to support evolving IT and business strategy. Communicates and evangelizes IT strategies, target enterprise architectures, and transition plans. Coaches and mentors peers and associates in Costco’s architecture framework. Measures and matures Costco’s EA practice. Required 10+ years’ recent experience defining enterprise architectures, architecting complex enterprise solutions and/or developing complex technical architectures. Interpersonal skills, including collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation. Written, verbal, and customer-facing presentation skills. Experience with architecture frameworks, methods, and tools. Graphical modeling skills. Analytical skills. Planning and organizational skills. Retail Channel knowledge (Brick & Mortar, Digital). Applied broad knowledge of technical domains (application, information, integration, and infrastructure). Applied broad knowledge of business functional domains. Ability to assess risks and apply risk profiles to EA alternatives. Ability to estimate the financial impact of EA alternatives. Understands the political climate of an enterprise and how to navigate the politics. Tenacity in the face of adversity. Recommended TOGAF Certification. Degree in Computer Science or related field. Knowledge of Costco’s business model and retail channel operations. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to manage the completion of projects that involve databases, backend services, and OO/UI development. This position will require an individual to design, build, enhance, and implement solutions in a fast-paced Agile environment participating in scrum ceremonies and working closely with a highly motivated team. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Supports Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability, and security into the design framework. Performs development, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application. Increases proficiency and understanding of relational and non-relational databases, distributed application architectures, user interfaces and user experience, quality assurance, security concerns, and business value creation. Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions. Provides the team with the development strategy, solution recommendations, and estimates for a given product/application. Participates in scrum ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospective, showcases/demos, stand-ups, backlog refinement, etc.). Creates and executes unit tests which validate the code changes made to support the implementation of a user story. Uses test-driven development (TDD) practices to assist with the detection/recognition of software defects early in the development process. Identifies deficiencies within a product/application’s code-base and identifies opportunities to improve overall code quality. Works with team members to move user stories from the development backlog into testing and provides clarification when needed. Estimates, plans, and manages all implementation tasks and reports on development progress. Demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging technologies to support the development of new solutions. Collaborates with team members (e.g. Systems Architects, Systems Analysts) to define project specifications and release documentation for all phases of the product development cycle from product definition to design through implementation. Acts as a technical lead in the Full Stack Engineering space and delivers data and analytics products/applications/portals/APIs. Conducts peer code reviews for the software changes made by other engineers within a team. Required 5-10 years’ experience in data management and development. Proficient working knowledge of code versioning tools such as Git, SVN, etc. Familiarity with continuous integration. Strong understanding of the software development process. Strong knowledge of object oriented concepts. Strong knowledge and experience working with databases. Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to communicate to both technical and Business audiences. Demonstrated ability to execute against iteration plans and deliver assignments within scope, schedule, and budget. Ability to work with all management levels. High integrity, accountability, and a positive attitude; willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Team player; good interpersonal and organizational skills. Creative, likes challenges. Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively in a fast-paced working environment. Extremely responsive; able to work under pressure in a crisis with a strong sense of urgency. Responsible, conscientious, self-motivated, and able to work with limited supervision. Detail-oriented and possesses strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze for potential future issues. Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, Engineering, or related field or equivalent experience. Minimum of 5 years’ experience in: Integrating an application with other applications using web services. Working with UI frameworks/libraries such as Angular and React. Working knowledge of databases (DB2, SQL Server, Oracle etc.). Programming experience with related technology such as XML, Java, various JavaScript frameworks, and SQL queries. Cloud Development/Computing (preferably Azure) Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. The Full Stack Engineer will perform development work across the IS Sustainability stack (both front-end/back-end expertise). This is a new team at Costco and will be fast paced, highly visible, supporting the business goals by being an industry leader in this space. The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to manage the completion of projects that involve databases, backend services, and OO/UI development. This position will require an individual to design, build, enhance, and implement solutions in a fast-paced Agile environment participating in scrum ceremonies and working closely with a highly motivated team. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Supports Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework. Performs development, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application. Increases proficiency and understanding of relational and non-relational databases, distributed application architectures, user interfaces and user experience, quality assurance, security concerns, and business value creation. Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions. Provides the team with the development strategy, solution recommendations, and estimates for a given product/application. Participates in scrum ceremonies (sprint planning, retrospective, demos, stand-ups, backlog refinement, etc.). Creates and executes unit tests which validate the code changes made to support the implementation of a user story. Uses test-driven development (TDD) practices to assist with the detection/recognition of software defects early in the development process. Identifies deficiencies within a product/application’s code-base and opportunities to improve overall code quality. Works with team members to move user stories from the development backlog into testing and provides clarification when needed. Estimates, plans, and manages all implementation tasks and reports on development progress. Collaborates with team members (e.g., Systems Architects, Systems Analysts) to define project specifications and release documentation for all phases of the product development cycle from product definition to design, through implementation. Conducts peer code reviews for the software changes made by other engineers within a team. Adheres to team and departmental development standards. Mentors less experienced team members. Participates in team planning and activities for improving skills, knowledge, and quality of work. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and company policies. Customer-centric focus and dedicated to business partnership while meeting the needs of the business leveraging out of the box functionality without a high degree of customization. Required 5+ years experience or demonstrated equivalence in Full Stack Development 3+ years experience or demonstrated equivalence in performing Web and UI development. Application development in C#, Java, and JavaScript. Must possess a strong understanding of the software development process. Strong knowledge of object oriented concepts and experience working with databases. Strong verbal and written communication skills and be able to communicate to both technical and Business audiences. Willing to learn third party applications. Demonstrated ability to execute against iteration plans and deliver assignments within scope, schedule, and budget. Ability to work with all management levels. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Team player, good interpersonal, organizational and communication skills. Creative, likes challenges. Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively in a fast-paced working environment. Responsible, conscientious, organized, self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Strong problem-solving skills and have the ability to analyze potential future issues. Ability to effectively teach and mentor less experienced team members. Performs tasks with a high degree of accuracy and timeliness. Extremely responsive and able to work under pressure. Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, and on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended Experience in development of scalable web services in n-tier architecture using C#, Microsoft.Net frameworks. Experience working with complex network topologies, including firewalls, API Gateways, load balancers. Experience developing Unified UI Experience and understanding of Costco’s business model and legacy systems. Ability to listen to and understand business needs. Analytical thinker possessing strong problem solving and decision making skills. Proven experience working within a complex software development environment. Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific programs/projects involved. Expertise in utilizing standard documentation tools/utilities.
