jobTitle: Full Stack Engineer (Java) - Ecom Account and Checkout
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Costco is looking for a dedicated and highly skilled Full Stack Engineer with an emphasis on the Frontend Web technologies to join its ECom Account and Checkout team. This Frontend Full Stack Engineer will perform development work including debugging and optimization of JSP based Web application functionality such as Shopping Cart, Checkout flow , Payment, Account setup and Customer Account maintenance, and other functionality based on JSP, WebSphere Commerce, WAS on the frontend connecting to MQs, Backend services and Database. The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to manage the completion of projects that involve OO/UI development. This position will require an individual to design, build, debug, optimize and implement solutions in a fast paced Agile environment participating and working closely with a highly motivated team serving millions of customers on a daily basis. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Design, build, debug, optimize and implement solutions in Java, JSP, HTML, CSS, DB2, MQ series. The development of high quality, efficient and fast code is an essential part of the position. Able to work with and support Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework. Performs development, debugging, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application. Uses APM/monitoring tools such as Dynatrace/Splunk and browser tools to perform request purepath/waterfall analysis to identify bottlenecks and suggest improvements. Increases team proficiency and understanding of distributed application architectures, user interfaces and user experience, quality assurance, security concerns, and business value creation. Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions. Develops and documents standards and best practices, and mentor junior engineers Provides the team with solution recommendations, and estimates for a given product/application. Identifies deficiencies within a product / application’s code base and identifies opportunities to improve overall code quality. Demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging technologies to support the development of new solutions. Collaborates with team members (e.g., Systems Architects, Systems Analysts) to define project specifications and release documentation for all phases of the product development cycle from product definition to design, through implementation. Conducts peer code reviews for the software changes made by other engineers within a team. Understands the full technology stack and underlying applications, services, and databases in order to ensure optimal performance. Required Minimum 3 years’ experience in performing Web and UI development using Java, JavaScript, SQL/DB2 Experience building and developing business applications. Must possess a strong understanding of the software development process. Strong knowledge of object oriented concepts. Strong knowledge and experience working with Web Technologies. Strong verbal and written communication skills and be able to communicate to both technical and Business audiences. Experience describing the solutions and generating the architecture (Logical, Physical) artifacts. Demonstrated ability to execute against iteration plans and deliver assignments within scope, schedule, and budget. Ability to work with all management levels. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Team player, good interpersonal, organizational and communication skills. Creative, likes challenges. Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively in a fast-paced working environment. Must be extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency. Responsible, conscientious, organized, self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Must be detail-oriented and possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze for potential future issues. Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, on-call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended 5-7 years’ experience in Web Technologies: Developing web applications or services using JSP, JQuery, JavaScript, WebSphere Commerce or Java frameworks. Distributed cache technologies such as Redis. Search technologies such as Lucidworks, Apache Solr. Queuing technologies such as IBM MQ. MSMQ. 3 years’ experience in: Integrating an application with other applications using SOA/REST web services. In application development in Java, JavaScript, .Net. With a working knowledge of databases (DB2, SQL Server etc.). Programming experience with related technology such as XML, Java, JavaScript frameworks, SQL queries, and database schema design. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

Experience writing high-performance production-quality code, including building REST APIs. Strong verbal and written communication skills, and experience collaborating with others. High degree of integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to deliver under pressure. Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, on-call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Working knowledge of on-prem and cloud databases (Cosmos, SQL, DB2, etc.). Familiarity with Costco’s membership business processes. Demonstrates technical leadership to manage and provide multiple technical solutions; performs code reviews; establishes and enforces coding guidelines and best practices. Initiates and facilitates team meetings to socialize technical ideas, encourages a culture of technical excellence within the organization , and identifies opportunities for adopting innovation. Provides coaching and mentoring to team members, disseminating information through documentation, workshops, etc. to drive operational efficiencies and technical growth within the team. Understands and escalates technical challenges with options and recommendations. Required Bachelor’s degree, or the equivalent, in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5+ years of experience with design and development of client/server and/or web based applications. 4+ years of experience with core Java, Java EE technologies (Servlet and JSP). 4+ years of experience working with relational databases (preferably MS-SQL Server and T-SQL). Good understanding and experience with SOAP and/or REST based Web services. Demonstrated track record of driving high-quality software design/implementation to production. A quick learner with the ability to learn and incorporate new technologies and concepts. Self-motivated, dedicated, and driven to succeed. Able to easily shift focus with changing priorities. Excellent debugging, troubleshooting, and problem solving skills. Excellent communication, collaboration, analytical, and problem solving skills. Ability to handle concurrent projects, multiple competing priorities, and meets deadlines. Ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with team members. Our ideal candidate enjoys challenges, appreciates being able to apply creative thinking to solve complex business problems and wants to be part of a small team that is goal focused and results oriented. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE This is a fantastic opportunity to work and collaborate closely with software engineering, operations teams As a senior developer you are responsible for ensuring products and services are highly available, reliable, secure and scalable. The ideal candidates are fluent in software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, fault-tolerant systems. Responsible for design and development of complex next generation Java-based external and in-house travel booking applications. Drive improvements to processes and design enhancements to automation to continuously improve production environments. Interface with other Dev, QA, OPS teams to identify root cause analysis and Identify performance issues and optimize solutions to prevent future degradations and outages. Efficiently work within the defined development processes and SDLC. Take part in the design discussions and update data models. Make changes to the framework files on a need-basis. Required 3 + years of current commercial experience developing with core Java technologies and libraries. 3 + years of current commercial experience with design and development of web based applications. 2 + years of experience with Java EE technologies (Servlet & JSP). 2 + years of experience with JDBC or equivalent data-tier framework, database design & development. Microservice-related technologies such as API Gateways, Caching, Data storage, and Message Brokers. Strong experience with monitoring and logging tools such as Splunk. 2 + years of experience with SDLC frameworks & IT best practices. Recommended Highly technical hands-on role which will help enhance team skills. Able to easily shift focus with changing priorities. Must be able to work independently and be forward thinking. Team oriented and capable of working in a small group. Must be motivated and a quick learner capable of multi-tasking. Familiarity or experience with the travel industry a plus. Please identify your current location (City and State) on your resume. jobTitle: Full Stack Software Engineer - Costco Travel
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale , the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers” . The Costco team is looking for a dedicated and highly skilled Full Stack Engineer with an emphasis on the Frontend Web technologies to join its ECom Account and Checkout team. This Frontend Full Stack Engineer will perform development work including debugging and optimization of JSP based Web application functionality such as Shopping Cart, Checkout flow, Payment, Account setup and Customer Account maintenance, and other functionality based on JSP, WebSphere Commerce, WAS on the frontend connecting to MQs, Backend services and Database. The ideal candidate will demonstrate the ability to manage the completion of projects that involve OO/UI development. This position will require an individual to design, build, debug, optimize and implement solutions in a fast paced Agile environment participating and working closely with a highly motivated team serving millions of customers on a daily basis . If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world , simply apply and let your career be reim agined. ROLE Designs, builds, debugs, optimizes and implements solutions in Java, JSP, HTML, CSS, DB2, MQ series. The development of high quality, efficient and fast code is an essential part of the position. Works with and supports Systems Architects with the design of the overall architecture of a specific product/application, applying principles that promote availability, reusability, interoperability and security into the design framework. Performs development, debugging, optimization, and automation activities to support the implementation of a product/application. Uses APM/monitoring tools such as Dynatrace/Splunk and browser tools to perform request purepath/waterfall analysis to identify bottlenecks and suggest improvements. Increases team proficiency and understanding of distributed application architectures, user interfaces and user experience, quality assurance, security concerns, and business value creation. Adopts engineering best practices to deliver higher quality and scalable solutions. Develops and documents standards and best practices, and mentor junior engineers. Provides the team with solution recommendations and estimates for a given product/application. Identifies deficiencies within a product/application’s code base and identifies opportunities to improve overall code quality. Demonstrates a strong understanding of emerging technologies to support the development of new solutions. Collaborates with team members (e.g., Systems Architects, Systems Analysts) to define project specifications and release documentation for all phases of the product development cycle from product definition to design, through implementation. Conducts peer code reviews for the software changes made by other engineers within a team. Understands the full technology stack and underlying applications, services, and databases in order to ensure optimal performance. Required Minimum 3 years’ experience in performing Web and UI development using Java, JavaScript, SQL/DB2. Experience building and developing business applications. Must possess a strong understanding of the software development process. Strong knowledge of object oriented concepts. Strong knowledge and experience working with Web Technologies. Strong verbal and written communication skills and be able to communicate to both technical and Business audiences. Experience describing the solutions and generating the architecture (Logical, Physical) artifacts. Demonstrated ability to execute against iteration plans and deliver assignments within scope, schedule, and budget. Ability to work with all management levels. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Team player, good interpersonal, organizational and communication skills. Creative, likes challenges. Strong organizational and time management skills with ability to multitask and prioritize work effectively in a fast-paced working environment. Must be extremely responsive, able to work under pressure in crisis with a strong sense of urgency. Responsible, conscientious, organized, self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Must be detail-oriented and possess strong problem-solving skills and ability to analyze potential future issues. Able to support off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, on-call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended 5-7 years’ experience in Web Technologies: Developing web applications or services using JSP, JQuery, JavaScript, WebSphere Commerce or Java frameworks. Distributed cache technologies such as Redis. Search technologies such as Lucidworks, Apache Solr. Queuing technologies such as IBM MQ. MSMQ. 3 years’ experience in: Integrating an application with other applications using SOA/REST web services. In application development in Java, JavaScript, .Net. With a working knowledge of databases (DB2, SQL Server etc.). Programming experience with related technology such as XML, Java, JavaScript frameworks, SQL queries, and database schema design. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits — medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, commuter benefits, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan, SmartDollar financial wellness program, to eligible employees.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The SAP HCM Time Functional Analyst works in the Functional Tower of the SAP Competency Center to develop and maintain the SAP and related systems configuration both in SAP core configuration, transports, development and reporting, and must have strong experience in SAP Time and Quota configuration and processing. The candidate will maintain the configuration and source code in a manner consistent with company policies. Work collaboratively to deliver exceptional operational support. Assist business staff in developing, implementing, and monitoring policies, procedures, and controls to ensure data accuracy, security, and legal and regulatory compliance. SAP Functional Analyst will comply with all the change control procedures, work instructions and standard operating procedures in support of existing functionality, requested enhancements and the development of new functionality. Contributes to the maintenance of these procedures including continuous improvement to maintain SAP as a SOX compliant solution. SAP Functional Analyst will collaborate, train and mentor other Competency Center staff on the Payroll and Time team. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Configures SAP HCM system including Payroll, Time, Benefits, Organization Management, Personnel Administration and ESS with a focus on Time and Quota configuration. Supports I/S Business Analysts with design, development and solution management. Gathers and participates in requirement gathering sessions with users and sponsors to define and document functional specifications, including: configuration, enhancements, custom programs, reports and forms. Authors and communicates business process designs, business systems designs and system test plans. Performs technical walk-through with development teams. Identifies gaps in business process mappings. Presents, discusses and demos SAP Best Practices. Works on Upgrade projects planning and execution. Supports the development team members during the detailed design and coding phase. Works with Quality Assurance team to conduct functional testing of implemented applications. Authors scripts and performs Unit, Regression and Integration testing. Adheres to team and departmental development standards. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Demonstrates a high level of communication skills, verbal and written. Mentors less experienced team members on SAP configuration concepts and tool suite. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness and quality of work. Oversees for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Required 3+ years’ experience configuring SAP in a professional environment on SAP ERP 6.0 HCM or higher with strong level of experience on Time and Quota configuration and processing. 3+ years’ experience supporting and troubleshooting Time and Quota processes and issues. Good understanding of SAP Payroll. Strong knowledge of related business and implementation processes with SAP HCM. Good understanding of integration between SAP modules. Ability to be proactive and can assume full responsibility of module development activities. Self-motivated, Flexible, Openness to learn new things, Strong focus on customer needs. Must have the ability to work with limited supervision and exhibit an excellent sense of urgency. Collaborate with analysts, designers, and system owners to implement SAP system installation, modification and enhancements. Strong conceptual, analytical, problem-solving, troubleshooting and resolution skills. Ability to prioritize, monitor and manage the progress of tasks. Good understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures and standards. Good decision-making skills. Must be available to work nights and weekends, and perform on-call support as needed. Recommended Experience with full life-cycle implementation projects. Experience in successful project implementation and follow-up. Very strong understanding of HR and Payroll best practices for SAP. Deep knowledge of enterprise-level applications including ERP. ABAP for HR/Payroll and debug experience a plus. Team leadership and role-model. Canada localization experience is a plus. Costco’s Identity and Access Management is responsible for the design and implementation of Identity solutions that align with business goals and objectives. This is a Senior Technical role that is responsible for the design, implementation and operational stability of identity systems in the Provisioning domain. This role will be responsible for managing expectations with application stakeholders, designing, implementing, and troubleshooting solutions related to the integration with Identity Management Systems. This role will also be responsible for various aspects of infrastructure management including maintenance, performance and capacity planning, security, and support. You will need to understand and interpret global technical and business requirements. This includes participation in the discovery, documentation, validation/refinement of solutions, deployments, and hypercare. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Understands and follows least privilege access principles while adhering to best practices in Identity Lifecycle Management. Triages issues under pressure and provides technical direction to peers. Plans, implements and analyzes provisioning architectures in a Global Enterprise environment. Provides leadership to large scale enterprise IT projects and applies structured lifecycles (Plan, Design, and Implement) that meet business units overall needs. Participates in on-call rotation for support of Production Identity Management infrastructure, coverage 24x7x365. Required 4+ years’ experience supporting Identity Provisioning Environment(s) and strong understanding of IdM protocols and standards. 4+ years’ Linux \ AIX experience. 4+ years’ hands-on technical experience planning, designing and implementing IAM technologies and services with the ability to think outside the box 4+ years’ experience troubleshooting Provisioning solutions and integrated applications. Experience with Identity Management Provisioning systems, including RBAC and Policy management. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proven ability to manage priorities and timelines. Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail-oriented. Recommended Strong knowledge in scripting languages (json, bash, javascript, shell, etc.). Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member’s and employee’s privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Incident Response Ops Engineer provides threat information to help identify threat actors and methods; to enable IT solutions to build effective controls against these threats; provide situation awareness to incident response; run threat assessments for high risk events (zero-days); support proactive incident hunting in Costco Wholesale systems; advises on matters related to policies, standards and procedures; and mentors team members with lesser subject matter expertise. Incident Response Ops Engineer develops, leads and monitors the Threat Intelligence Program. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Supports and builds Incident Response team tools. Identifies and assesses internal and external cybersecurity risks that threaten the security of Costco business operations. Develops and formalizes effective threat identification and assessment processes, including maintaining playbooks for obtaining, monitoring, assessing, classifying severity, and responding to evolving threats and vulnerabilities. Develops, maintains, and updates a repository of cybersecurity threat information that may be used in conducting risk assessments and reports on cyber risk trends. Conducts research and evaluates intelligence data, with specific emphasis on tactics, techniques, and procedures. Turns threat information into actionable intelligence by integrating related Indicators of Compromise (IOC) into SIEM operations and incident response strategies. Correlates threat data from various sources and analyzes network events to establish the identity and modus operandi of malicious users active in or posing potential threats to Costco Wholesale. Develops and documents Threat Intelligence procedures into Playbooks. Ensures that Threat Intelligence documentation is comprehensive and accurate. Works closely with various international Information Technology teams, state agencies and 3rd party vendors to develop a fuller understanding of the intent, objectives, and activity of cyber threat actors. Identifies, develops, and implements mechanisms to detect security incidents and report on key metrics. Identifies and improves security incident detection and monitoring capabilities. Provides management and the IR team with a contextual snapshot of the Incident Response team challenges for multiple uses by the team and management. Participates in the assessment, analysis and design of solutions for the Threat Intelligence Program. Provides leadership to develop the Threat Intelligence Program as the subject matter expertise. Provides mentoring and training on tools and processes to the Threat Intelligence Team and partners. Required High degree of ethics/confidentiality required and may be required to pass security screening. Ability to provide accurate analysis that minimizes bias and error. Ability to develop processes and tools to effectively share actionable intelligence information. Rule correlation evaluation and development experience highly recommended but not required. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Ability to work under pressure in a highly team focused environment is required. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Willingness to work outside of regular business hours as required, which can include evenings, weekends and holidays. Recommended A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a minimum of 6 years’ information security experience with a focus on software and tool development. One or more professional security certifications such as CISSP (or equivalent). Experience with scripting languages such as Python. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The Infrastructure Analyst provides hardware analysis and other tasks necessary for the design, integration, automation, and maintenance of client hardware systems. The analyst proactively addresses the evolving needs of the business and designs client hardware solutions that meet functional and non-functional requirements and enables architectural strategies. This role assists with the development of roadmap and lifecycle strategies to ensure the continuity and support of client hardware systems and travels occasionally. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs and develops client-based technology solutions to meet business use cases and needs. Evaluates and test new client hardware and operating systems. Partners with Operations, IT, and third-party suppliers to understand business problems and help solve them. Researches, analyzes, and recommends changes required for growth and support of Costco’s overall modernization directives and strategies. Recommends and implements security configurations for device roles while balancing established security standards. Develops, integrates, and supports client automation tools that increase productivity and efficiencies for deployment and support teams. Coordinates cross-departmental projects with several project team members. Provides guidance on issues escalated from support and deployment teams. Provides concise and effective status reports on initiatives and projects to all applicable stakeholders. Stays current and informed with technology trends and innovations with a focus on the Retail industry. Understands and adhere to Costco’s Mission Statement and Code of Ethics. Required Demonstrated technical leadership in the following IT function areas: PC/Servers/Thin Clients; hardware, Windows and Chrome operating systems Mobile Device Platforms; Android, iOS, Windows Mobile Proven leadership skills and ability to mentor, train, and motivate team members. Ability to see the big picture and identify interdependencies with systems, applications, and use cases. Experience writing Business Case, RFP or Scope of Work documents or equivalent proposals. Ability to effectively perform testing (unit, system, and integration testing) of device hardware and applications. Excellent verbal and written communication skills with experience creating and giving presentations. Self-motivated and able to work independently with little supervision. Detail oriented and strong problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential problems. Extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Excellent customer service skills. Willing to travel. Able to support off hours work as required including evenings, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended: A minimum of two years’ experience scripting in PowerShell. Understanding of wireless networking WLAN 802.11 a/b/g/n/x access points and wireless bridge technology. Understanding of IT security requirements, policies, and tools. Understanding of Costco’s use case scenarios and core business environment related to Depot, Warehouse, Manufacturing Operations and Costco Logistics. Printing Platforms; laser, pallet tag, wired, wireless. Innovative, creative, and intellectually inquisitive nature with the ability to be open-minded to varying opinions. Responsible, conscientious and possess a passion for excellence. Proven experience with PKI, with a strong understanding of device and user certificates and domain trusts, etc. Strong experience leveraging REST API scripting for task automation. Experience with MDM (Mobile Device Management) Tools (Avalanche, AirWatch VMware UEM). jobTitle: Infrastructure Analyst - Products and Platforms Team
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Costco`s Ecommerce team is responsible for delivering the best experience and lasting value to our customers; website (frontend) performance is crucial . Our team focuses on enhancing performance, security, availability, and resiliency of our website. The Infrastructure Analyst for the products and platforms team is responsible for end to end performance of our website, including CDN (Akamai); and ensuring that our website and services meet the SLOs and SLIs. Additionally, this role is responsible for analyzing and resolving issues; and recommending and implementing improvements, Service Level Objectives for site performance, viability, and health. This is a highly collaborative position working with other areas of IS and driving the scorecard to continuously improve as we enhance our website and add more capabilities. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works with Solutions Architects, System Architects, and Developers to analyze the performance of our website component webpages and drives actions to improve performance. Plans for capacity; taking scalability and reliability of our website into consideration. Ensures that the performance test suites cover the crucial mix of performance scenarios to represent real world scenarios. Troubleshoots performance issues; and develops automated solutions to increase efficiency in performance testing efforts. Supports Akamai security and performance solutions to achieve service level objectives for the web commerce platform. Manages, maintains, troubleshoots, and supports Akamai solutions successful experience in designing, installing, and supporting networks in multiple environments. Tunes webpages and assets using edge caching strategies for optimum end user experience. Establishes and monitors SLOs and SLIs for website and application operations. Automates repeatable operational processes and procedures. Remediates all Security Vulnerabilities related to web and application software. Monitors Change, Incident, and Problem management including Root Cause Analysis. Improves and documents operational and troubleshooting procedures. Provides technical guidance to other team members. Assists in the design and deployment of web infrastructures and protection strategies. Leads implementation of the solutions. Acts as a technical escalation point for Operations and Systems Engineers. Implements network infrastructure and security policies. Understands requirements, leverages best practices, and offers consulting services that meet project needs. Collaborates with other architects and engineers to evaluate web architecture; develops and delivers long-term security strategies and cloud solutions. Works with security experts to solve technical problems; and communicates effectively with all audiences. Participates in training and projects contributing to best practices, maximizing efficiency, and improving methodology and service quality. Required 5+ years’ experience provisioning and supporting complex pre-production or production environments, preferably in a large scale eCommerce environment. 3+ years’ experience with hands on Akamai CDN, Global Traffic Management, and WAF configuration, solutions, and architecture. 3+ Experience in Cloud platform (Azure). Experience with the implementation and management of procedures in technical operations. Knowledge of Front-end Web Application Assets (Javascript, static content, JSON, XML, HTML, REST API’s, etc.). Knowledge of Back-end Web Application Platform (JSP, DB2, MQ, WebSphere Commerce, Java, etc.). Good understanding of OOP, scripting, and automation knowledge (Python,Javascript, Java, etc.). Strong experience in security domains including identity and application security, process and concepts, security event management, or security compliance. Solid understanding of Agile workflows and the SDLC (, sprints, Lower Environments, User Acceptance Testing, Cross-Functional Teams, Product Owners, etc…). Experience with configuration management tools such as, Terraform, Puppet, Ansible. Experience with Application Performance Monitoring (APM) Tools such as, Dynatrace, Splunk. Experience with APIs and integrating software, SOA, and integration framework. Extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Ability to work under pressure and in a crisis situation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong proven leadership/team building, and personnel development skills. Strong interpersonal skills; able to work with people at all management levels. Excellent customer service skills. Responsible, conscientious, and possess a passion for excellence. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. Costco Wholesale is looking for an Infrastructure Analyst - Virtualization, who wants the opportunity to design and implement highly-scalable virtual solutions within a large enterprise environment; and drive Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) initiatives. The Infrastructure Analyst - Virtualization is responsible for the implementation, and operational readiness of enterprise x86 virtual server platforms across the organization, ensuring high levels of data quality, availability, and security. Individuals in this role are responsible for the implementation of policies and procedures to ensure virtual servers adhere with company goals, industry best practices, and regulatory requirements. The successful candidate will be highly motivated and self-directed, and enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative team environment. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs VMware-based hypervisor virtualization solutions based on best practices for scale up and out. Works with suppliers to understand the applications, strategies, and roadmaps for current, updated, and emerging technologies. Administers VMware-based virtual server infrastructure consisting of vCenters, ESXi hosts and clusters, and datastores. Includes provisioning, monitoring, upgrades, and P2V or V2V migrations. Drives automation initiatives and creates workflows for VM provisioning, configuration, environment alerting, and self-healing. Provides technical design review for new server systems, applications, infrastructure, and hardware. Identifies and reports Key Performance Indicators, focusing on capacity planning and performance analysis. Provides proactive maintenance and administration of virtualization server hardware and hypervisor, including patching and driver/firmware updates. Provides Tier-3 support for incident resolution related to virtual server infrastructure. Tests and implements new tools to better manage virtual server infrastructure. Cross-functional collaboration to ensure availability, reliability, and scalability of corporate servers to meet business demands. Implements policies, procedures, and technologies to ensure server security. Manages and maintains Intel-based systems and systems software. Provides 24x7x365 on-call support, weekends and/or holidays, as necessary. Required Current administrative experience in VMware vSphere. Current hands-on experience with hardware and software troubleshooting. Understanding of network stack and fundamentals. Understanding of Fibre Channel SAN and NFS based storage arrays. Comfortable making scripted changes across a large enterprise environment. Strong communication and interpersonal skills with a customer-service focus. Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities. Strong technical documentation and writing skills. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including 24x7x365 on-call support, weekends, and holidays. This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Costco Innovation team is focused on finding and developing new technologies to support our continued success in the future. A successful Innovation Engineer will think outside the box using strong development, engineering, and creative skills to deliver end-to-end proofs of concept, prototypes, production software, and device solutions. Additionally this role will partner with key Costco teams to leverage their experience and knowledge to ideate, define, and deliver technological solutions for use within all areas of our business. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs and delivers rapid end-to-end proof of concepts, prototypes, and production software and device solutions. Develops solutions independently and together with localized and distributed teams, using modern development and agile methodologies. Demonstrates Technology Innovation best practices and thought leadership. Leverages the latest technology innovations to constantly invent and simplify -- raise the bar. Follows Enterprise standards for security and best practices. Understands and adheres to Costco’s project methodology and framework. Seeks opportunities to learn, automate, document, share, educate, and improve processes where appropriate. Interfaces with and provides technical leadership to others in the IT division and business to address ongoing business needs. Documents the application infrastructure and teaches/mentors as necessary. Acts as a team lead and mentors others in team leadership. Works with third parties, business, and internal Costco IT teams to meet the needs of the projects and initiatives. Defines and documents proposed solutions, contextualized technologies, and prototypes. Delivers initiative-based work and artifacts to agreed upon target dates. Works with leadership/delivery leads and engineers to report and remove roadblocks. Oversees the technical content (architecture and design), integrity, and quality of the solution. Analyzes available assets (frameworks, reference architectures, etc.) to bridge the gap between the as-is architecture and the to-be architecture. Establishes high-level models that guide solution architecture design, sub-architecture or deployment and reviews with all interested parties. Participates in reviews of the designs, prototypes, and other technical deliverables to ensure they fulfill requirements and meet standards. Required Bachelor's degree in data analytics, information technology, information security/assurance,computer science, engineering or related field of study or any combination or relevant equivalent experience, education, and training. A minimum of 5 years’ experience in engineering/development roles. High-level Component model development. Creative, strategic thinker with an inquisitive mind towards new technologies and opportunities. Strong verbal, written, and presentation communication skills with the ability to concisely and effectively communicate across teams. Team player; friendly, communicative, open, honest, thoughtful, and committed. Must work cooperatively with others, share ideas, and collaborate, and ultimately put team goals first Must possess a demonstrated ability to work independently and with limited supervision including: Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail, and excellent time-management skills. Recommended Strong knowledge of retail core business models, drivers, and philosophies. 5 years’ of experience using modern or high-level programming languages. 3 years’ of experience in cloud environments, preferably AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure. Experience with modern development and build strategies such as, microservices, containers, lambdas, continuous integration and delivery, unit testing, static analysis, automated integration tests, refactoring, etc. Experience working on technology innovation projects with high degrees of ambiguity. iOS, Android, and web application development experience. Experience with IOT, microcontrollers, and/or embedded systems. Security and privacy experience. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Position Summary: Assists Costco location management and employees with various tasks relating to accommodation, return to work, leave, and short term/long term disability programs and workers’ compensation claims. Interacts with US locations and employees to collect, document, and process information relating to leaves, return to work and accommodations; and to answer questions and assist with workers’ compensation issues. Assists with training and projects related to workers’ compensation, leaves, return to work, short term/long term disability programs, and accommodations. Responsibilities: Uses independent judgment and discretion to interpret and apply Costco policy and procedure. Engages in extensive telephone communications with locations and suppliers regarding policy. Provides information to Third Party Administrators (TPA) on workers’ compensation claims; and authorizes action as appropriate. Assists locations, TPA, and other suppliers to return employees who are out on leave, to work. Creates documentation for quality control and legal compliance in disability programs. Reports Return to Work and Accommodation Activity monthly. Presents and facilitates LOA policies and Leave Administration programs. Communicates information about workers’ compensation and disability programs accurately and consistently. Understands suppliers’ standards and expectations; and provides recommendations for change or improvement. Works within a team environment to accomplish departmental goals. Travels about 3-4 times a year as needed. Regular and reliable workplace attendance at your assigned location. ●   Ability to operate: Computer, phone, copier, printer, fax Qualifications: Education level: High School Diploma or GED required, College degree (preferred) Experience: 2 years’ of recent work experience managing workers’ compensation claims for a TPA or self-administered employer or 2 years’ of recent work experience at a management level administering an ADA or FMLA program including return to work Skills: Proven verbal and written communication skills; ability to adjust communication to particular situations and all levels of senior management, management, employees, and outside suppliers, including physicians and attorneys. Ability to manage conflict and strong negotiating skills. Strong organizational/time management skills, multitasking abilities, and attention to detail. Ability to maintain confidentiality; successful past performance in dealing with confidential and sensitive issues. Ability to articulate ideas and policies in an easy to understand manner telephonically and in person. Positive-professional demeanor, dependable, and self-motivated; ability to remain calm in stressful situations. Expertise in creating Word documents, form letters, tables, worksheets, and Power Point presentations. Excellent evaluation and information collection skills. Ability to maintain thoroughness and accuracy while meeting deadlines. Strong written communications skills, with the ability to think and write analytically. Must be able to work at the Home Office as listed on the job posting.

Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The International SAP Functional Analyst will work to configure and maintain Costco's SAP Retail implementation and its related systems. This person will assist business staff in the identification, development, implementation, and monitoring of SAP solutions, including the creation of Functional Specifications and reporting capabilities. The role will also create policies, procedures, and controls to ensure data accuracy, information security and adherence to legal and regulatory compliance. The Analyst must ensure conformance to established system change control procedures and document any standard operating procedures in support of existing functionality, requested changes, and development of new functionality. The role will ensure the maintenance of configuration artifacts and source code in a manner consistent with company policies. The Analyst will also work collaboratively with others in the organization to deliver exceptional operational support on an ongoing basis. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Configures and supports the International SAP systems in production and non-production. Creates functional and technical design documents in collaboration with Engineer and Solution Architect. Supports IT business analysts with design, development, and solution management. Partners with International Regions to help define support and staffing models as well as support standards. Leads or participates in functional and business requirements gathering sessions. Defines and writes functional specifications and/or user stories for configuration, user exits, and custom programs. Authors and communicates business process designs and business systems designs. Collaborates with Quality Assurance (QA) on configuration, data requirements and test plans to satisfy functional unit tests, regression tests and system integration tests. Presents, discusses and demonstrates SAP Best Practices. Performs analysis on error incidents including Intermediate Document (IDoc) rejects and system errors. Collaborates with SAP and non-SAP technical teams for technical specifications and development of customized objects. Provides support of SAP applications, including integration points with other SAP modules and non-SAP applications to ensure business processes are maintained in a non-disruptive manner. Adheres to team and departmental development standards. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Demonstrates excellent communication skills. Mentors less experienced team members on SAP concepts and tool suite. Participates in team planning and activities for improving skills, knowledge, and quality of work. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and company policies. Available to work nights and weekends and perform 24x7 on-call support as scheduled, including up to 25% International Travel. Required 5+ years’ experience configuring SAP in a professional environment on SAP in a retail environment. Knowledge of related business and implementation processes with SAP FI, MM, CAR, CRM. Experience and knowledge of SAP Solution Manager/focus build. Experience with at least 2 full life-cycle implementation projects. Understanding of integration between SAP modules and non-SAP systems. Customer-centric focus and dedicated to business partnership while meeting the needs of the business leveraging out of the box functionality without a high degree of customization. Ability to effectively teach and mentor less experienced team members about the SAP system. Strong conceptual, analytical, problem-solving, troubleshooting, and resolution skills. Ability to perform tasks with a high degree of accuracy and timeliness with little supervision. Must be detail-oriented and capable of working in an environment with changing priorities. Recommended General understanding of supply chain processes and principles. General understanding and knowledge on other SAP modules like FI, FI-CA, MM, SD, SCM, BW, BOBJ, Lumira, MDG, CRM, SAP Convergent Charging and PMR. Knowledgeable about middleware and communication technologies such as PI/PO, MQ, ETL, DataPower, WAS, FTP, etc. Experience with SAP S/4HANA or S4 Retail. Understanding of testing and automation tools, e.g., HP ALM, Ranorex, Jira. Experience and understanding of Costco’s business model. Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail, excellent time management and organizational skills. Ability to work both independently and within a close team environment. Analytical thinker possessing strong problem solving and decision making skills. Proven experience working on a Scrum and/or Agile team. Proven experience with creating documentation for communication with varied audiences. Proven experience working within a complex software development environment. Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific programs/projects involved.. Expertise in utilizing standard documentation tools/utilities. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume Last two performance reviews Attendance records for current year (Do not include absences covered by paid sick/personal time, FMLA or other protected absences.) Costco is looking for an experienced iOS Developer to join its Membership development team, responsible for the Employee and public-facing Costco app. The Developer must be proficient in all aspects of the application’s lifecycle from concept to delivery. ROLE Delivers across the entire app life cycle – concept, design, build, deploy, test, release, and support. Solid knowledge of mobile user interface development. Good problem solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills. Working knowledge of RESTful services. Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including ability to work with all management levels. The QA Analyst is responsible for adhering to standardized QA policies, processes, documentation standards, creating test cases, assisting with automating test scripts, overseeing and/or participating in all aspects of project testing, overseeing IT QA test environments, providing technical guidance to other QA team members, and ensuring schedule adherence for assigned projects and initiatives. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Participates in requirements and user case/user story reviews. Provides accurate estimates for QA effort, QA schedules, and QA resource requirements. Creates and gains project approval on project test plans. Creates and/or oversees the creation and approval of project test cases. Creates and/or oversees the generating of all QA-related documentation. Ensures adherence to standardized QA policies, processes, and documentation standards. Executes test cases, defect management, and adherence to test schedule. Assists with coordinating onshore and offshore testing. Oversees UAT support and testing production defect fixes. Contributes expertise in source code, version management, and code deployment standards; utilizes this knowledge to ensure that QA processes and procedures for test environments are followed and the integrity of the various environments is not compromised. Attends daily standup meetings and provides testing status. Provides weekly QA project status reports. Attends bi-weekly sprint completion meetings and demo to stakeholders. Helps to mentor and develop other members of the IT QA team. Required Minimum 5 years’ software quality assurance experience. Minimum 5 years’ experience testing in one or more of the following environments: cloud based testing, UI testing, functional testing, and n-tier client/server. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience using HP, IBM, or other industry standard SQA tools. Minimum 2 years’ experience with Oracle, MS SQL Server, or DB2 and the ability to write SQL queries and table joins. Experience testing in an iSeries/AS400 environment. Strong knowledge of Agile, SDLC, and SQA methodology. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent test resource planning and test scheduling skills. Ability to produce and mentor others in creation of effective software test plans and test cases. Ability to write quality defects and work directly with developers to resolve the defects. Ability to communicate and work closely with other teams. Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and excellent collaboration skills. Able to support off hours work as required including evenings, weekends, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a scheduled basis. Recommended Degree in computer science or related technical field preferred. 2 years’ SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. Good understanding of data warehouse concepts. Experience working in an SAP environment preferred. Understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. Experience with multiple Costco business areas/systems. Assist with automating and/or executing automated test case. Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The QA Analyst is responsible for adhering to standardized QA policies, processes, documentation standards, creating test cases, assisting with automating test scripts, overseeing and/or participating in all aspects of project testing, overseeing IT QA test environments, providing technical guidance to other QA team members, and ensuring schedule adherence for assigned projects and initiatives. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Participates in requirements and user case/user story reviews. Provides accurate estimates for QA effort, QA schedules, and QA resource requirements. Creates and gains project approval on project test plans. Creates and/or oversees the creation and approval of project test cases. Creates and/or oversees the generating of all QA-related documentation. Ensures adherence to standardized QA policies, processes, and documentation standards. Executes test cases, defect management, and adherence to test schedule. Assists with coordinating onshore and offshore testing. Oversees UAT support and testing production defect fixes. Contributes expertise in source code, version management, and code deployment standards; utilizes this knowledge to ensure that QA processes and procedures for test environments are followed and the integrity of the various environments is not compromised. Attends daily standup meetings and provides testing status. Provides weekly QA project status reports. Attends bi-weekly sprint completion meetings and demo to stakeholders. Helps to mentor and develop other members of the IT QA team. Required Minimum 5 years’ software quality assurance experience. Minimum 5 years’ experience testing in one or more of the following environments: cloud based testing, UI testing, functional testing, and n-tier client/server. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience using HP, IBM, or other industry standard SQA tools. Minimum 2 years’ experience with Oracle, MS SQL Server, or DB2 and the ability to write SQL queries and table joins. Experience testing in an iSeries/AS400 environment. Strong knowledge of Agile, SDLC, and SQA methodology. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent test resource planning and test scheduling skills. Ability to produce and mentor others in creation of effective software test plans and test cases. Ability to write quality defects and work directly with developers to resolve the defects. Ability to communicate and work closely with other teams. Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and excellent collaboration skills. Able to support off hours work as required including evenings, weekends, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a scheduled basis. Recommended Degree in computer science or related technical field preferred. 2 years’ SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. Good understanding of data warehouse concepts. Experience working in an SAP environment preferred. Understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. Experience with multiple Costco business areas/systems. Assist with automating and/or executing automated test case. Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The role of every Cybersecurity team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical, and regulatory obligations; protecting members’ and employees’ privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Cybersecurity Operations Analyst is the liaison between the business, stakeholders, supporting teams, and external vendors. The Analyst will support security testing of web applications, client server applications, web services, cloud-based solutions, APIs, operating systems, databases, and network fabric devices (i.e. switches, routers, firewalls, load balancers, WAPs, etc.). In addition, the Analyst works across a variety of projects; partners with third-party vendors on scoping and remediation recommendations; coordinates the setup of testing hosts and resources; consults with the business team to discuss remediation options and finding details. The Cybersecurity Operations Analyst also provides consultative services; creates and maintains documentation related to policies, standards, and procedures. The Analyst advocates security testing procedures and information security best practices to IT and business partners If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Facilitates penetration test engagements using a penetration testing methodology and framework. Works with information systems custodians (i.e., department managers, user community, and systems administrators) at different levels in the organization to define, scope, and support testing goals and objectives for penetration test engagements against Costco systems. Facilitates and oversees vendor access to the Costco environment in support of penetration test engagements including coordination with Costco IT partners for access to networks, applications, and rights management. Works with the team to ensure weekly reporting and metrics for stakeholders are provided. Utilizes and improves templates for reporting; organizes penetration test reports for stakeholders and executive leadership. Performs cross-functional, post-finding reviews and assists with remediation recommendations for stakeholders. Tracks and verifies remediation activities through re-testing and ad-hoc reporting. Coordinates activities or engagements with incident response and loss prevention; interacts with legal and law enforcement as required. Required Minimum 3 years’ of experience in Information Systems Security. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Working knowledge of information systems security standards and practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Familiarity with: Network security levels (public, DMZ, Internal, PCI). Protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, SSL/TLS. HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WML. Cloud computing infrastructure and services. Various types of Penetration Testing such as web applications, network, and infrastructure testing. Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers. Ability to interpret information security data and processes to identify potential compliance issues (SOX, HIPAA, PCI). Ability to quickly understand security systems in order to identify and validate security requirements using logical, risk based prioritization methods. Ability to handle highly confidential information in a strictly professional manner. Ability to adapt to changing priorities. Willingness to work outside of regular business hours as required which can include evenings, weekends, and holidays. Recommended A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science. One or more professional security certifications such as CISA, CEH, GIAC, GSEC, OSCP or CISSP (or equivalent experience). Working knowledge with network security levels (public, DMZ, Internal, PCI). Demonstrated experience of “hands on” security knowledge of the following platforms: Windows in a large Active Directory environment, Ubuntu/Redhat, and other Linux distributions, AIX, and other Unix variants preferred. Web technologies such as WebSphere, IIS, Apache, etc. Scripting knowledge including Perl, Python, PowerShell, etc. Working knowledge of protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, SSL/TLS. Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WML. Working knowledge of cloud computing infrastructure and services. Working knowledge of various types of Penetration Testing such as web applications, network, and infrastructure testing. Experience developing and reporting enterprise level metrics. Experience with Power BI. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

jobTitle: IT Operations Analyst - eCommerce Production Operations
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Ecommerce Production Operations Team works closely with our business and IT partners to drive the most effective response, recovery, and remediation to ensure the Costco website is highly available, scalable, and secure to meet the current and future needs of our members and our eCommerce business units. This team is responsible for supporting a website which is highly visible and critical to the success of our eCommerce platform to meet current and future sales growth expectations. The IT Operations Analyst is dedicated to the coordination, escalation, communication, and resolution of high priority eCommerce production operations incidents, as well as trend identification, metric definition, and the related efforts to decrease service disruption. Additionally, IT Operations Analysts will define processes and metrics to refine current and define future state eBusiness operations support processes. They own the successful end-to-end tracking and resolution of incidents which includes coordinating and driving live action incident calls, managing resolution action plans, measuring and improving service targets, and escalating incidents as required when resolution targets are missed. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Defines, captures, and validates IT requirements and other artifacts, ensuring appropriate stakeholders are involved. Analyzes internal IT customer needs and priorities while initiating operational support and delivery efforts. Documents and manages risks, issues, assumptions, and constraints impacting operational support efforts. Develops and coordinates legal/compliance, operational controls, and associated metrics to measure success. Develops and implements standards, processes, and procedures for new technology solutions; ensures newer solutions will not negatively impact current service commitments. Participates in periodic audits for solutions, planning, and delivery functions. Ensures incidents that are not immediately resolved, are appropriately escalated according to defined service level agreements (SLAs). Develops key team deliverables and dashboards. Drives to key performance indicators (KPIs); improving metrics and services to our members and stakeholders. Identifies and reports incident and problem trends and progress. Ensures timely, clear communication regarding high priority issues with the appropriate stakeholders. Works closely with the incident owner to ensure incident escalation processes are in-line with the overall incident management processes. Collaborates with appropriate business and I.T. stakeholders to determine root cause and problem identification and, when necessary, enhancement identification for future development work. Supports eCommerce production operation releases for both pre- and post-release activities. Manages and tracks supplier performance; and leverages approved contractual terms for accountability. Develops and conducts presentations as needed. Required 3+ years’ experience leading and managing high priority incident calls to resolution. Strong understanding of eCommerce technologies and metrics. Excellent call management and organizational skills with an emphasis on strong follow through. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to create accurate, concise correspondence. Strong proven interpersonal skills and able to work well with people at all levels. Ability to conduct monthly meetings with stakeholders to drive increased availability in identified trends. Detail-oriented and strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Intellectually inquisitive nature with the ability to be open minded to varying opinions. Responsible, conscientious, and possess a passion for excellence - positive “can do” attitude. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive in respect to service quality and ways in which it can be improved. Good understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures, and standards. Good working knowledge of Incident, Problem, Change, and Knowledge Management practices. Knowledge of the IT strategies, customers, and services provided. Knowledge of Costco’s core business environment related to eCommerce, Merchandising, Warehouse Operations, and company philosophies. Knowledge of service analysis and other tools: CARTS+, Google Apps, Smartsheets. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including evenings, weekends, and holidays; available for on-call coverage 24X7, to support off-hours work as required. Recommended Familiarity with ServiceNow. Experience with statistical analysis and reporting. Familiarity with multiple Costco business areas from an I.T. perspective. Knowledge of the Service Desk or Call Center business processes. IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) V3 Foundation certification or better. Prior experience with the IT Service Management software. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.
