jobTitle: IT Operations Analyst - LTL Support and Operations
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The IT Operations Analyst is dedicated to the coordination, escalation, communication, and resolution of high priority eCommerce LTL incidents, as well as trend identification, metric definition, and the related efforts to decrease service disruption. Additionally, IT Operations Analysts will define processes and metrics to refine current and define future state eBusiness operations support processes. They own the successful end-to-end tracking and resolution of incidents which includes managing resolution action plans, measuring service targets, and escalating incidents as required when resolution targets are missed. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Defines, captures, and validates IT requirements and other artifacts, ensuring appropriate stakeholders are involved. Analyzes internal IT customer needs and priorities and initiates delivery efforts. Documents and manages risks, issues, assumptions, and constraints impacting delivery efforts. Develops and coordinates legal/compliance, operational controls, and associated metrics to measure success. Develops and implements standards, processes, and procedures for new technology solutions; ensures newer solutions will not negatively impact current service commitments. Participates in periodic audits for solutions, planning, and delivery functions. Ensures incidents that are not immediately resolved are appropriately escalated according to defined service level agreements (SLAs). Develops key team deliverables and dashboards. Develops key performance indicators (KPIs) evaluating the service for effectiveness and efficiency. Identifies and reports incident and problem trends and progress. Ensures timely, clear communication regarding high priority issues with the appropriate stakeholders. Works closely with the incident owner to ensure incident escalation processes are in-line with the overall incident management processes. Collaborates with appropriate business and I.T. stakeholders to determine root cause and problem identification and, when necessary, enhancement identification for future development work. Supports eCommerce LTL releases for both pre- and post-release activities. Manages and tracks supplier performance; and leverages approved contractual terms for accountability. Regular and reliable workplace attendance at your assigned location. Ability to operate vehicles, equipment or machinery. Computer, phone, printer, copier, fax Required Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to create accurate, concise correspondence. Develops and conducts presentations. Strong proven interpersonal skills and able to work well with people at all levels. Ability to conduct monthly meetings with stakeholders to drive increased availability in identified trends. Detail-oriented and strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Organized and thorough, with a dedication for follow through. Intellectually inquisitive nature with the ability to be open minded to varying opinions. Responsible, conscientious, and possess a passion for excellence - positive “can do” attitude. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive in respect to service quality and ways in which it can be improved. Good understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures, and standards. Good working knowledge of Incident, Problem, Change, and Knowledge Management practices. Knowledge of the IT strategies, customers, and services provided. Knowledge of Costco’s core business environment related to eCommerce, Merchandising, Warehouse Operations, and company philosophies. Knowledge of service analysis and other tools: CARTS+, Google Apps, Smartsheets. Available for on-call coverage 24X7, to support off-hours work as required, including weekends and holidays, and staffing coverage. Recommended Familiarity with ServiceNow. Experience with statistical analysis and reporting. Familiarity with multiple Costco business areas from an I.T. perspective. Knowledge of the Service Desk or Call Center business processes. IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) V3 Foundation certification or better. Prior experience with the IT Service Management software. jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Product Owner will partner with the product management and stakeholders to translate product strategy and problem solving into a detailed, prioritized backlog of user stories and set of requirements that translate into system solutions & process. The Product Owner will collaborate with an Agile delivery team to implement, measure, and learn from the improvements they have made. The Product Owner manages execution of the value stream product features and delivery roadmap for Costco Ecommerce projects that are aligned to KPIs that measure the objectives of both eCommerce IT Division and line of business stakeholders. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Supports business strategy by forming a backlog of features and user stories for use by the agile delivery team. Articulates requirements for each user story with detailed acceptance criteria. Ensures that all requirements support the business need, fulfill goals and objectives, and meet stakeholder needs. Defines and communicates requirements, risks and issues that may require changes to plans or scope. Prioritizes and sequences requirements/user stories based on stakeholder and Product Manager input to maximize value and customer satisfaction and defines. Uses data and insights from multiple sources that benefits the business and our members. Assists the development team with the translation of business requirements into functional or non-functional specifications. Pursues incremental delivery by looking for ways to meet business goals and end users through frequent, measurable enhancements. Works collaboratively and uses best practices with the delivery team to support backlog refinement, sprint planning and long term release planning. Monitors and improves product health. Ensures completed stories meet acceptance criteria by reviewing test plans, the output of automated testing or, where necessary, contributing to manual testing efforts. Prioritizes and collaborates in resolution of issues and defects. Seeks and improves processes across the delivery team by using retrospectives to inspect and adapt. Communicates with team members, stakeholders and all levels of management. Required 5+ years’ experience as a Product Owner. Proven experience working on an agile and/or waterfall team. Proven experience with creating documentation for communication with varied audiences. Proven experience working within a complex software development environment & projects. Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific programs/projects involved. Proficient in User Story creation. Expertise in utilizing standard documentation tools/utilities. Strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills. Possesses product knowledge and process improvement skills with a demonstrated ability to effectively propose solutions. Recommended Agile Product Owner Certification Product Owner and/or Business Analyst experience in IT eCommerce. 3+ years’ working in SAFe methodology Deadline oriented and capable of self-management. Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail, excellent time management and organizational skills. Ability to work both independently and within a close team environment. Ability to listen to and understand business needs. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. The Product Owner will partner with Product Management, business partners and stakeholders to translate product strategy and problem solving into a detailed, prioritized backlog of user stories. The Product Owner will collaborate with the delivery team(s) to implement, measure, and learn from the improvements they have made. The Product Owner manages execution of the product features and delivery roadmap for International programs that are aligned to KPI's that measure the objectives of both Costco’s IT Division/International IT and line of business stakeholders. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Supports business strategy by forming a backlog of features and user stories for use by the delivery team(s). Articulates requirements for each user story with detailed acceptance criteria into consumable artifacts. Uses data and insights effectively from multiple sources that benefits the business and the members. Pursues incremental delivery constantly by looking for ways to meet business goals and learn from members and end users through frequent, measurable enhancements. Works collaboratively and uses best practices with the delivery team(s) to support backlog refinement, planning, and long term release planning. Monitors and improves product health. Ensures completed stories meet acceptance criteria by reviewing test plans, the output of automated testing or, where necessary, contributing to manual testing efforts. Prioritize and collaborate in resolution of issues and defects. Seeks and improves processes across the entire product team(s). Seeks and improves processes across the delivery team(s) by using retrospectives to inspect and adapt. Communicates effectively with team members, stakeholders and all levels of management. Works with stakeholders to identify solutions that support their business requirements. Required 2+ years’ worked as a Product Owner. Technical background experience. Working knowledge of SAP systems. Must be able to communicate effectively at all levels within the organization both written and verbal. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including evening, weekend, and holiday work with up to 25% international travel. Exceptional attention to detail and outstanding organization and research skills. Strong analytical, research, and problem solving skills. Performs tasks with a high degree of accuracy and timeliness. Extremely responsive and able to work under pressure. Ability to multitask in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Detail-oriented and capable of working in an environment with changing priorities. Proven record of taking initiative, being self-motivated and a team player, as reflected in past reviews. Recommended Deadline oriented and capable of self-management. Experience and understanding of Costco’s business model. Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail, excellent time management and organizational skills. Ability to work both independently and within a close team environment. As a member of the IT Management Team, you are responsible for managing, developing, and leading a team of employees. Your role includes leading the specific functional responsibilities of your team, which involves overseeing team performance and deliverables. However, your role as a leader within our organization requires more than the management of resources and day-to-day operations. As a steward of the company, you are charged with the development and execution of your team’s strategic vision and plan and ensuring that your team’s actions align with the larger goals of the company and the IT Division. The eCommerce Development Manager will lead a team of software developers to support the existing functionalities and enhance the capabilities of Costco's business-to-consumer and business-to-business websites to help the business realize their goals of reaching $20B in sales. As the primary conduit between your employees and upper leadership, your role in communicating and modeling the values and guiding principles of our company culture is of vital importance. All members of IT Management should strive to consciously and consistently foster a culture of engagement, trust, and “open door” communication. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE INTEGRITY: When achieving benchmarks and goals, use methods/strategies that are consistent with the Code of Ethics and the Standard of Ethics for Managers and Supervisors. Always leads by example. Appropriately handles employee concerns and follows through to resolution. MEMBER SERVICE: Provides and ensures staff provides an exceptional member experience. ADMINISTRATION: Ensures proper department coverage (writing schedule and break aids if needed). Understands department budget, able to research and explain budget variances. MANAGING PERFORMANCE: Coaches and mentors employees to provide support and guidance. Has regular open and honest conversations with employees to discuss work performance and career development. Identifies learning opportunities to strengthen employee knowledge, skill and ability. COMMUNICATION: Regularly shares information with employees via meetings and one-on-one conversations. Successfully navigates difficult conversations with employees, members, and suppliers. Listens, expresses empathy and adapts to get points across. Addresses issues immediately to ensure a timely resolution and to avoid escalating the situation. Consistently demonstrates business knowledge during interactions with senior management. SELF-MANAGEMENT: Demonstrates sound judgment, taking a partner when necessary. INCLUSION : Encourages different approaches and ideas to work and to accomplish goals. Seeks employee input. Takes the time to get to know or reach out to candidates who show potential that may not come forward on their own. COMPLIANCE AND SAFETY: Takes measures to ensure employee and member information is kept confidential and adheres to IS security policy. Provides leadership to the team and facilitates resolution of production system outages. Ensures non-production systems are up and running and available for projects. Manages the team work assignments and ensures completion. This is a full-time management/leadership position (45+ hours per week). Required At least 5 years’ experience managing a medium to large development team. Strong communication skills, both oral and written. Strong leadership and team-building skills. Experience working within a formal software development lifecycle including Agile. Innovative, creative, and possesses a passion for excellence. Strong interpersonal skills; able to work with people at all management levels. Detail oriented and possesses strong problem-solving skills. Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building strategic and tactical plans. Ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Ability to work under pressure and in a crisis situation. Able to support off hours work as required including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities. Extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. HIPAA Training and Supervisors Orientation (within 30 days of hire); Leadership Development 101 (within one year); Costco Pay Policies (within 90 days of promotion). Recommended Experience managing an eCommerce team would be a plus. Experience working on an Enterprise mobile Application would be a plus. Knowledge of Websphere Commerce systems is a plus. Experience with Java development stack in a distributed application development environment preferred. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Recommended 4 + years’ experience in traditional and Next-Gen / UTM Firewall features: IPS, ZBF, ACLs, NAT, IPSec VPN and GRE tunnels. 3+ years’ experience with Fortinet, InfoBlox, F5, Cisco, Juniper. 2+ years’ experience with Network monitoring tools, such as LiveAction, Netscout, Splunk. Proficient with packet capture tools and network protocol analysis. Experience with DNS, DHCP, and IP management tools. Experience with Unix, Linux, Windows server administration, and virtualization. Experience building/supporting highly available, scalable cloud based platforms and infrastructure for cloud native systems. Established understanding of Load Balancers and traffic shaping protocols and tools. Established proficiency of LAN Switching and WLAN 802.11ax controller based and Wireless Bridge technology. Knowledgeable with multi factor authentication and authorization processes and protocols. TACACS+, Radius, ISE, LDAP, AD, authentication services, as well as SAML token/certificate based client authentication. Experience with SD-WAN technologies. Familiarity with scripting and APIs as they relate to Network Automation. CCNP, Fortinet NSE5, F5-CTS. This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The IS Compliance Engineer is a key member of the Information Security Compliance team, reporting to the Manager of Security Compliance. This position is focused on PCI DSS, working across Costco Wholesale globally to ensure and deliver upon our annual PCI assessments and improve our security compliance posture overall. The Compliance Engineer will work closely with Information Security leadership and management team members to build and maintain a strong security compliance program, while ensuring ongoing delivery on our PCI compliance obligations. The role requires a mix of business and technical acumen with strong people skills, with the ability to build trusted relationships and influence decisions around security risk and compliance management with the business. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Serves as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert for PCI DSS compliance to the business. Understands and documents complex branded payment acceptance or card servicing processes. Applies established PCI DSS scoping criteria. Obtains and reviews evidence of compliance to support technical or complex PCI DSS requirements. Supports the completion of multiple annual PCI DSS Reports on Compliance. Drives necessary system and process updates; works in tandem with business and technology teams to maintain ongoing compliance and ensures new PCI requirements are embedded upfront to enable compliance by design. Scopes, interprets, and prioritizes both application and network vulnerability test results. Manages and communicates key compliance milestones for critical systems and complex processes. Facilitates interaction between the business and Costco’s Qualified Security Assessor (QSA). Consults on complex PCI DSS compliance considerations. Stays current with new and evolving security topics and technologies via formal training and self-directed education. Shares knowledge and experiences with less experienced staff to help grow the team talent bench through training and mentoring. Required 7+ years’ IT or technical compliance experience; PCI experience supporting Level 1 organizations or as an ISA/QSA preferred Strong understanding of all requirements of current PCI DSS, other significant PCI SSC guidance, and card security requirements from major card brands Technical security and architecture knowledge with the ability to recognize, analyze and troubleshoot issues, and articulate those to both technical and non-technical audiences Ability to scope, interpret and prioritize application and network vulnerability test results Strong communication and relationship skills, especially the ability to understand and articulate advanced technical topics and build consensus among partners and management. Demonstrates a positive attitude, is self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Able to work well under stress and handle crisis situations professionally. Recommended Past or current certifications in one of the following areas: Security+, CISSP, ISA, QSA. Ability to propose creative solutions to successfully remediate identified compliance issues. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The role of each Information Security team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale, including meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. Penetration testers provide consultative services, working with internal business team members to conduct service engagements for security testing. Penetration testers perform reviews of system architecture documentation; create scopes of work for engagements, conduct security testing engagements on scoped assets, systems, processes, and/or employees; mentor team members. This position will be filled onsite in Issaquah, WA or Dallas, TX. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works with Compliance, Internal Audit, and Business teams to identify, test and analyze risks. Works with stakeholders to provide security engagements to test their systems and business requirements. Assumes a leadership role in advocating internally and externally for compliance to security measures to protect cloud-based applications and environments. Documents security findings from penetration testing engagements and reports the risks of those findings to the business owner and management. Finds vulnerabilities in various spaces such as web applications, native applications, database systems, authentication flows, distributed systems and designs, and protocols. Pulls from a flexible knowledgebase of topics such as OWASP, memory corruption, privilege escalation, networking, and etc. to find both common and uncommon issues. Researches and remains up to date with emerging threats and Threat Emulation methodologies. Clearly communicates Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers, using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Works collaboratively to solve problems with groups, find win/win solutions and celebrate successes. Works with Incident Response team as necessary to consult on discovered security incidents by informing appropriate custodians, determining root cause, and actions (if necessary) required to re-establish respective information system security. Leads comprehensive assessments of features and large-scale applications and environments. This includes mapping out the surface area and assessing prioritization based on time, resource, and general importance tradeoffs. Navigates through an ecosystem of multiple domains, technologies, protocols, and stakeholders. Creates new tools to support pen tests efforts. Provides subject matter expertise support in the detection, analysis, and mitigation of malware, trends in malware development and capabilities, and proficiency with malware analysis capabilities. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness and quality of work. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Required 1+ year experience with assessing APT threats, Penetration Testing, Vulnerability Management, attack methodologies, forensics analysis techniques, malware analysis, attack surface comprehension, Cyber Threat Emulation operations, Cyber Advanced Threat Emulation Team operations and research, identification, and verification of new APT TTPs. Proven operational experience in penetration testing or cyber threat emulation. Experience and security knowledge around native applications, web applications, distributed and database systems. Proficiency in scripting in one or more languages (e.g. C/C++, Ruby, dotnet, js, python, sql, Powershell, others). Exposure or experience with tools such as; Kali Linux, Metasploit, Burp suite, Cobalt Strike, Tenable Nessus, Web Inspect, IDA PRO. Ability to ramp up and understand new designs, systems, and technology. Understands security issues for large scale cloud services and network infrastructures. Understands software development processes and hybrid-cloud based infrastructure. Thorough experience with Windows, Linux and cloud environment testing. Experience developing custom exploits and exploitation tools in support of authorized penetration tests or cyber threat emulation exercises. Expertise in policies, industry trends, and techniques related to penetration testing. Subject matter expertise in Advanced Persistent Threat or Emerging Threats. Grasps both the technical and non-technical details such as to enumerate inappropriate or abusable security expectations. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Strong proficiency in pen test report writing. Ability to handle highly confidential information in a strictly professional manner. High enthusiasm, integrity, ingenuity, results-orientation, self-motivation, and resourcefulness in a fast-paced environment. Depending on the pen test requirements, 1 or more team members may be required to work outside of regular business hours for the duration of the engagement. Recommended A relevant degree. One or more certifications for penetration testing: GCIA, GCED, GCFE, GCTI, GNFA, GCIH, CND, ECSA, OSCP, OSEE, OSCE, GCFA, GREM, CHFI, CEH, GPEN, GWAPT, GISF, GXPN. Red Teaming including, leading a targeted operation (planning, scoping, approval, reconnaissance & discovery, execution of attacks, pivoting, persistence, and remediation). Some pen test engagements may need 1 or more team members to travel post-COVID. Performance Test Analysts are to contribute to the delivery of the Costco's performance testing model in an iterative and agile fashion. The performance testing model includes 5 major deliverables: assessing a performance request, planning, scripting, executing, and reporting. The performance testing team is a shared service which supports Costco multiple product lines. The primary objective of the team is to assist with delivering applications, solutions, and/or platforms that meet and/or exceed IT and Business performance SLAs. As a shared service, Performance Test Analysts must collaborate across organizations to establish the correct performance metrics and benchmarks for the systems under test that may be on premises, in the Cloud and/or hybrid. Ultimately, the team is committed to contributing to the business and company’s continued growth and success. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Creates, develops, and maintains reliable, reusable, and efficient performance test scripts and scenarios that meet objectives identified in the performance test plan. Develops and communicates accurate estimates for performance resources and testing schedules. Analyzes relevant business content and participates in requirements & use case reviews along with the project team to understand requirements for performance testing. Collaborates with resources across IT and the Business to define and create performance test objectives, test environments, and test data requirements. Analyzes business metrics and assembles workload and transaction information for performance testing. Executes performance test activities during the various phases of a project life cycle. Analyzes and documents performance metrics from automated performance test tools, monitoring and network tools, and back end systems that are in-scope for the project Analyzes, logs, and tracks performance defects; ensures defects are addressed and tests code changes identified during the performance testing phase. Analyzes and presents performance metrics and results from performance test execution. Creates and maintains performance testing and related quality assurance documentation. Develops and ensures adherence to standardized performance testing policies, processes, and documentation standards. Supports the code review process to ensure deliverables meet performance standards. Oversees source code, version management, and code deployment standards. Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions. Prepares and reports on weekly Performance QA status. Adhere to Costco work from home policies. Required 3+ years’ of progressive, hands-on software quality assurance experience. 2+ years’ of hands-on, progressive experience in performance testing. 1+ years’ of programming in an object-oriented programming language. Demonstrable experience in JAVA/C#/C/C++ or equivalent. Experience with Performance Testing or automation tools. Knowledge of performance test methodologies and strategies. Skilled in translating the development and testing requirements within the project into performance test scripts and scenarios. Able to customize automated test scripts through the use of programming languages. Skills and experience with collaborating with subject matter experts and technical groups (architects, system designers, operations, etc.) to resolve problems encountered during performance testing. Proficient in the creation of complex documents that communicate technical concepts in a clear, concise, and complete manner to Costco’s business community and stakeholders. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Strong understanding of Waterfall and Agile SDLC is preferred. Strong understanding of On-premises, Cloud, and Hybrid environments. Good understanding of caching and load balancing models. Responsible, conscientious, and the proven ability to deliver under minimal supervision. Recommended 4-year degree in computer science or a related technical field or equivalent work experience. Experience with using monitoring tools like - SCOM/Dynatrace /Splunk. Experience with any of MS SQL/ORACLE/DB2. Experience with MicroFocus Loadrunner or similar Load Testing Tool, including scripting, building and executing scenarios, collecting and analyzing performance metrics. Experience with maintaining, and executing scripts using multiple protocols and being able to quickly learn new protocols. Experience with programming in JAVA/C# or similar languages are preferred. Experience with mobile performance testing and/or QA automated testing Experience with performance testing PowerBI reports. Experience with Microsoft Azure Fundamentals. Experience with SAFe Agile Framework. Experience with MicroFocus WebDev. Experience with F5 (load balancer) and Akamai (for caching). Experience with ERP Applications like SAP. Experience working with Visual Studio Team Test and Team Foundation Server or HP ALM is preferred. Demonstrable experience with web services development and testing is preferred. Proficiency with XML, SOAP, and WSDL is preferred. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The Data Hub platform engineer will be responsible for process, technical leadership, design oversight and implementation of master data platforms. Platform Engineers translate high level platform design into low level technical design and are responsible for implementing, administering, supporting and patching their corresponding platforms. Platform Engineers work closely with Solution Architects to enable the capabilities defined on roadmaps and blueprints supporting platform programs and initiatives. Platform Engineers are well versed in modern infrastructure and/or cloud based platforms, industry/technology best practices and actively work on improving the reliability and scalability of the platforms they manage. We are looking for a highly motivated, business focused platform engineer who wants to work in a fun and highly collaborative environment and is willing to be the player as well as coach for the Data Hub team. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Implements and supports master data and reference data models, workflows & UI components. Collaborates with delivery pods and Architects to improve production deployments, platform operations, and environment stability. Assesses technical components, translates high level design into low level technical design and executes updates based on SLAs & OLAs. Manages the Data Hub platform on an ongoing basis while performing typical run functions such as monitoring, patching, and support. Conducts regular platform checkups and reports inefficiencies to relevant business and technology stakeholders Develops and instruments monitoring dashboards depicting platform health and performance. Develops and implements Platform as a Service (PaaS) Solutions. Supports the creation of documentation and artifacts used to describe the mechanisms used for deployment, monitoring, and maintenance for the Data Hug platforms. Delivers against business objectives by effectively managing and partnering with technology vendors. Conducts research and makes recommendations on standards, products, and services. Ensures application and infrastructure architectural solutions are stable, secure, and compliant with company standards and practices as well as regulatory requirements. Implements and maintains system configurations and baselines to support secure application development software control best practices and standards. Implements service monitoring across all platforms to ensure continuous availability and operational continuity of critical systems. Participates in DevOps, Agile, and continuous integration frameworks Required 3+ years experience implementing, configuring and solutioning on master data technology (i.e. STEP (Stibo), Informatica MDM, Reltio etc.) 2+ years experience with Javascript, J2EE, XML, SOAP, REST, and Web Services. Database knowledge in RDBMS systems such as Azure SQL Database, MS SQL Server, etc. Extensive knowledge and experience in defining master data strategies, services and capabilities, metadata management, data governance, and data quality solutions. Ability to manage priorities and timelines. Proven experience successfully implementing solutions for large cross platform projects. Good understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem resolution. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; including ability to work with all management levels. Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business; available to provide 24x7 support as needed. Recommended Stibo Step MDM implementation experience. Working knowledge on Stibo Java Scripting API’s and integration endpoints. Experience with coding in GraphQL. Azure Certifications. Experience implementing data integration techniques such as event/message based integration (Kafka, Azure Event Hub). BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience. Java technology framework and tools including open source, JavaEE and Spring stack, MQ/messaging. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits — medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, commuter benefits, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan, SmartDollar financial wellness program, to eligible employees.

Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Data Hub platform engineer will be responsible for process, technical leadership, design oversight and implementation of master data platforms. Platform Engineers translate high level platform design into low level technical design and are responsible for implementing, administering, supporting and patching their corresponding platforms. Platform Engineers work closely with Solution Architects to enable the capabilities defined on roadmaps and blueprints supporting platform programs and initiatives. Platform Engineers are well versed in modern infrastructure and/or cloud based platforms, industry/technology best practices and actively work on improving the reliability and scalability of the platforms they manage. We are looking for a highly motivated, business focused platform engineer who wants to work in a fun and highly collaborative environment and is willing to be the player as well as coach for the Data Hub team. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Implements and supports master data and reference data models, workflows & UI components. Collaborates with delivery pods and Architects to improve production deployments, platform operations, and environment stability. Assesses technical components, translates high level design into low level technical design and executes updates based on SLAs & OLAs. Manages the Data Hub platform on an ongoing basis while performing typical run functions such as monitoring, patching, and support. Conducts regular platform checkups and reports inefficiencies to relevant business and technology stakeholders Develops and instruments monitoring dashboards depicting platform health and performance. Develops and implements Platform as a Service (PaaS) Solutions. Supports the creation of documentation and artifacts used to describe the mechanisms used for deployment, monitoring, and maintenance for the Data Hug platforms. Delivers against business objectives by effectively managing and partnering with technology vendors. Conducts research and makes recommendations on standards, products, and services. Ensures application and infrastructure architectural solutions are stable, secure, and compliant with company standards and practices as well as regulatory requirements. Implements and maintains system configurations and baselines to support secure application development software control best practices and standards. Implements service monitoring across all platforms to ensure continuous availability and operational continuity of critical systems. Participates in DevOps, Agile, and continuous integration frameworks Required 3+ years experience implementing, configuring and solutioning on master data technology (i.e. STEP (Stibo), Informatica MDM, Reltio etc.) 2+ years experience with Javascript, J2EE, XML, SOAP, REST, and Web Services. Database knowledge in RDBMS systems such as Azure SQL Database, MS SQL Server, etc. Extensive knowledge and experience in defining master data strategies, services and capabilities, metadata management, data governance, and data quality solutions. Ability to manage priorities and timelines. Proven experience successfully implementing solutions for large cross platform projects. Good understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem resolution. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; including ability to work with all management levels. Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business; available to provide 24x7 support as needed. Recommended Stibo Step MDM implementation experience. Working knowledge on Stibo Java Scripting API’s and integration endpoints. Experience with coding in GraphQL. Azure Certifications. Experience implementing data integration techniques such as event/message based integration (Kafka, Azure Event Hub). BA/BS in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent software/services experience. Java technology framework and tools including open source, JavaEE and Spring stack, MQ/messaging. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas. jobTitle: Platform Engineer (DI Admin team) - Data Platforms
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Platform Engineer on the Data Integration Administration team translates high level platform design into low level technical design and is responsible for implementing, administering, supporting, and patching the ETL Platforms and underlying linux servers within the Data & Analytics area of the company. The Platform Engineer works closely with Solution Architects, ETL Developers, Database Administrators, O/S Administrators, and other internal users to support projects on Azure. The P latform Engineer is well versed in modern infrastructure platforms, industry/technology best practices; and actively works on improving the reliability and scalability of infrastructure. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Collaborates with delivery pods and Architects to improve production deployments, platform operations, and environment stability. Manages the platform on an ongoing basis while performing typical run functions such as monitoring, patching, and support. Configures, implements, customizes, and tests software/hardware; documents software/hardware defects; and reviews and interprets error logs to diagnose errors. Drives governance through designing, developing, implementing, supporting, and documenting enterprise policies, standards, guidelines, monitoring services, solutions, configurations, and procedures. Researches, analyzes, and recommends changes required for system growth (both on-prem and cloud) by utilizing industry standard monitoring and research tools. Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options, implements solutions, communicates results to ensure corrective and timely action is taken, and manages incident resolution to ensure all components work together. Manages/Coordinates virtual and physical servers including: server provisioning, upgrading, installing, monitoring, maintaining, and performance optimization. Develops and implements Platform as a Service (PaaS) Solutions. Remediates platform issues and bottlenecks impacting software development activities. Supports the creation of documentation and artifacts used to describe the mechanisms used for deployment, monitoring, and maintenance. Identifies, develops, implements, reviews, and revises process improvements, procedures, and controls (including SOX) to ensure data accuracy, security, and legal and regulatory compliance. Recommends and follows security management practices, including the ongoing promotion of awareness on current threats, auditing of server logs, and other security management processes. Creates queries, programs, scripts, and reports supporting and adhering to change control policies that help to define and develop best practices for systems management and automation. Works in an Agile environment; collaborates with Operations, Development, and QA functions to develop solutions and systems that are predisposed to scalability, security, and simplified maintenance, utilizing automation whenever possible. Coordinates with suppliers for software support issues and end user support. Required 4+ years’ of IT experience with at least 2 years’ in product implementation and hands-on technical activities within enterprise environments, preferably with an ETL product suite. Documented experience of application administration, not limited to installation, configuration, and management of Linux-based software systems. Working knowledge of Linux/Unix/AIX Operating Systems, shell scripting, package management systems, and other utilities. Working knowledge of version control (GitHub preferred) and automation tools such as ADO, Terraform, Ansible, Puppet etc. Experience with RDBMS and noSQL DB, such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, MySQL, SynapseDB, CosmosDB, etc. Experience with SaaS, PaaS, and Cloud solutions. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Self-motivated; detail-oriented with excellent Organization skills. Strong troubleshooting skills and a methodical approach to issue resolution. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business; available to provide 24x7 support as needed. Recommended B.S. degree in Computer Science or equivalent formal technical training and experience. Working knowledge of at least one scripting language. Experience with Informatica (IICS, PowerCenter, Axon, DPM, TDM) and Pentaho. Experience with No-SQL data stores. Experience implementing or supporting enterprise security products such as DLP, UEBD, SIEM, IAM, PIM, etc. Background in application development with HTML5, JQuery, Web Services, etc. Troubleshooting experience with Database queries and fine tuning of Database queries. Proven expertise in Performance Tuning and Capacity Planning. Understanding of Configuration Management and Change Management Best Practices. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Ecommerce Production Operations Team works closely with our business and IT partners to drive the most effective response, recovery, and remediation to ensure the Costco website is highly available, scalable, and secure to meet the current and future needs of our members and our eCommerce business units. This team is responsible for supporting a website, which is highly visible and critical to the success of our eCommerce platform to meet current and future sales growth expectations. This position performs IT functions such as design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging, and implementation of applications or programs supporting the highly visible eCommerce business processes and operations, and/or network-based (cloud) product systems. Infrastructure Engineer evaluate, install, acquire, modify, and support operating systems, database software or utilities software. Infrastructure Engineer plan, conduct, and direct the investigation of business problems with automated systems solutions, and contribute to the development, testing, evaluation or design of systems or architecture used throughout the IT solution set. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs, plans, installs, configures, tests, and maintains the eCommerce B2C and B2B production environments to ensure that applications, configurations, integrations are available and perform as expected. Plans, coordinates, and performs the installation of application, operating system, data, and integration level changes into the eCommerce production environments. Provides operational support for Websphere Commerce, Websphere Application Server, and IHS servers. Develops a comprehensive understanding of the applications and infrastructure within the eCommerce environment and how they impact member experience, site performance, stability, and quality. Manages resolution and root cause of incidents and problems through effective collaboration, communication, and follow up with management, IT teams, and vendors. Manages growth and performance of the systems. Creates and runs reports relating to performance and capacity planning. Monitors our eCommerce dashboards; Splunk, Dynatrace, mPulse for system health and performance. Coordinates with our Services Management, Sustained Engineering, development product, and pod teams, as well as our vendors, to follow up and remediate production issues repair to meet Costco’s service levels as defined. Develops, maintains, and publishes system configuration documentation including inventory, process, configuration, and design documents. Follows Enterprise standards for Security and Best Practices. Required 3+ years’ experience provisioning and supporting complex pre-production or production environments using Websphere Commerce. 3+ years’ experience IBM WAS (WebSphere Application Server), IHS (IBM HTTP Server) or equivalent. 3+ years’ experience Unix and/or Linux, preferably AIX or Red Hat. Experience with workflow automation and orchestration. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Excellent customer service skills. Responsible, conscientious, and possess a passion for excellence. Experience with scripting frameworks and languages such as Kornshell, Python, Bash, and Powershell. Demonstrated ability to perform systems analysis on high availability pre-production environments within an enterprise setting. Broad technical knowledge of enterprise compute platforms, such AIX as well as cloud container technologies. Experience in analyzing system performance data for performance characteristics. Ability to collaborate with architecture, database, and application teams regarding all pre-production environments. Ability to explain complex solutions to an audience with a wide variety of technical skills and background. Ability to guide and mentor others through the design, build, and implementation phases of system deployments. Detail-oriented and possess strong problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Strong interpersonal skills, able to work with people at all management levels. Works well under pressure and in a crisis situation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong proven leadership/team building and personnel development skills. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, 24x7x365 operations - evening, weekend, holiday and on-call required on a rotational basis. Recommended Exposure to middleware technologies using MQ Messaging, Message Broker or equivalent. Configuration/Administrator level knowledge using Sterling Order Management components, API's, related interfaces. Ability to collaborate with other technical experts and develop solution and functional design documents to support development of final solutions. General understanding of: Networking and troubleshooting networking issues. Network technologies such as BigIP, DHCP and DNS. Active Directory (AD). Performance and functional testing environments. Experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Tivoli, and Dynatrace. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. This position is responsible for the support and maintenance of the overall eCommerce ecosystem focusing on the infrastructure, web, middleware, and application layers and their interactions. This is a highly collaborative position working with other areas of IT to implement technology solutions, resolve site issues and deploy releases into production. The Platform Engineer - Ecommerce is responsible for analyzing and resolving issues as well as recommending and implementing improvements. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Participates in the ongoing process of investigating, analyzing and providing long term resolutions to site issues. Coordinates across teams, working closely with peers to ensure the appropriate focus and sense of urgency is applied to all production issues. Works with third party suppliers and vendors for support, upgrades and implementations. Works closely with business teams regarding site content. Provides operational support for WebSphere Commerce Server, WebSphere Application Server and Sterling Order Management. Provides infrastructure support for backend Windows based Order Management System. Works with engineers and Solution Analysts to implement and support new capabilities. Follows Enterprise standards for security and best practices. Seeks opportunities to learn, automate, document, share, educate, and improve processes where appropriate. Quickly develops a comprehensive understanding of the applications and infrastructure within the eCommerce environment and how they impact member experience, site performance, stability, and quality. Works closely with application and infrastructure teams to stay informed of changes that could affect site functionality and viability. Required 5+ years’ experience provisioning and supporting complex pre-production or production environments, preferably in an eCommerce environment. 5+ years’ experience supporting IBM WAS (WebSphere Application Server), IHS (IBM HTTP Server), Scripting frameworks and languages such as KornShell, Python, Bash, or Powershell. Experience with workflow automation and orchestration. Demonstrated ability to perform systems analysis on high availability pre-production environments within an enterprise setting. Experience in analyzing system performance data for performance characteristics. Collaborates with architecture, database, and application teams regarding all pre-production environments. Explains complex solutions to an audience with a wide variety of technical skills and background. Guides and mentors others through the design, build, and implementation phases of system deployments. Detail-oriented and possess strong problem solving skills, with the ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Innovative, creative, and possess a passion for excellence. Ability to work under pressure and in a crisis situation. Ability to analyze a situation for potential future problems. Excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as strong proven leadership/team building, and personnel development skills. Strong interpersonal skills, able to work with people at all management levels. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Excellent customer service skills. Responsible, conscientious and possess a passion for excellence Recommended 5+ years’ experience: Windows, Unix and/or Linux, preferably AIX or Red Hat. Exposure to virtual environment management such concepts and tools such as PowerVM and VMWare. Exposure to middleware technologies such as MQ Messaging, Message Broker or equivalent. Ability to collaborate with other technical experts and develop solution and functional design documents to support development of final solutions. General understanding of: Networking and troubleshooting networking issues. Network technologies such as BigIP, DHCP and DNS. Active Directory (AD). Performance and functional testing environments. Unix administration or certification. IBM WebSphere Application Server certification. WebSphere Commerce Server experience is a plus. Experience with monitoring tools such as Splunk, Tivoli, and Dynatrace. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The IT Merchandising project portfolio is a collection of enhancements, projects, programs that support the financial and strategic goals of Costco’s Merchandising functions. The role of the Merch Portfolio Delivery manager is to optimize the portfolio, aligning projects with the business strategic direction, making the best use of limited resources, and building synergies between projects. As a project portfolio delivery manager, you will be the chief architect and process owner of the portfolio management process, developing the following capabilities: work intake, project portfolio roadmap, prioritization, release-gate, portfolio tracking, and resource capacity planning. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Architects and manages the project portfolio process. Responsible for creating and managing detailed portfolio roadmaps, managing inter project dependencies and reporting critical paths. Responsible for ensuring that the outcomes in the portfolio support the Merchandising business objectives and IT strategic goals, engaging Business and IT leaders, Delivery managers, Product managers and Solution Architects, while taking into account capacity planning and resource management constraints. Responsible for resource capacity planning and reporting, including considerations of key skill sets and budgetary constraints. Managing the full Merch portfolio of projects, which includes approving, prioritizing or rejecting projects and program ideas, and managing stakeholder expectations. Responsible for setting standards for the portfolio, such as providing direction on what project management methodologies are used, whether traditional waterfall or an agile framework, when managing the project. Acts as advocate and educator of project portfolio management, including for senior leaders. Leads the Portfolio Delivery Review forum (involving all value stream owners, shared services leaders, and the portfolio release manager) to focus on upcoming milestones and future roadmap. Assists with the allocation of resources and provides solution/delivery teams with the necessary support to remediate impediments and reported issues. Participates in program increment (PI) sessions to ensure a consistent delivery approach across the portfolio. Works with delivery managers, project managers and release manager to plan release schedules across value streams. Supports the primary delivery manager(s) with the estimation efforts to quantify the total resource/capacity needs to support the implementation of an initiative. Required 10+ years’ experience as a Project Portfolio Manager/Analyst, Program Manager or Project Manager. Experience with large scale, complex, multi-platform, multi-partner, high-transactional systems. Experience creating and managing detailed portfolio roadmaps, managing inter project dependencies and reporting critical paths. Experience implementing a project portfolio management process. Experience with resource capacity planning, including considerations of key skill sets. Experience considering budgetary constraints. Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze project and portfolio date, as well as developer reports, dashboards and analytics, providing actionable insights for senior leadership. Strong executive presence, ability to communicate up to executive leadership and across the organization. Collaborative leadership style. Strong interpersonal skills, able to work with people at all management levels. Detail oriented and thorough, with ability to think “big picture.” Recommended Understanding of Delivery Management and the Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe). PMP, PgMP, Agile, SAFe certifications. Knowledge of retail systems. Proficient in the use of the Google products: Gmail, Sheets, Docs, slides. Working knowledge of Service Now (Carts+) Portfolio & Program Management module and/or Azure Dev Ops. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. jobTitle: Product Manager - Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Network Security
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Cybersecurity Infrastructure team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member’s and employee’s privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Product Manager is responsible for setting a product vision and strategy, drawing out the most value from a product and guiding the team to execute on the product vision. The Product Manager also works closely with architects and other technical leads to ensure the solution effectively addresses program priorities while maintaining technical integrity. The Product Manager also facilitates product management meetings, planning and backlog/vision refinement sessions. Product Managers work with Product Owners and customers to understand and communicate their needs, define system features and participate in validation. This position will ensure that our Network Security program provides comprehensive and up to date information about our network assets to enable visibility, discovery, categorization, triage, patching, hardening, and response capabilities at scale across Costco globally. You will build meaningful relationships with teams and management at Costco. This role will drive implementation, execution, metrics, and sustainability of program objectives that allow Cybersecurity Infrastructure to continuously improve our ability to protect and respond to vulnerabilities and threats to our global footprint. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Owns the overall vision and roadmap of a given product and leads the ideation, technical development and launch of new features and capabilities. Monitors new and emerging security, compliance and privacy related requirements, technologies, trends, issues, and solutions and assesses their applicability to Costco Wholesale’s key business initiatives and business strategies. Provides advice and consulting to senior management and the organization in the development, implementation, and administration of actions to meet these emerging requirements. Coordinates and monitors information security activities throughout the organization, including the preparation of periodic status and progress reports to applicable parties, leadership teams, and stakeholders. Collaborates with business stakeholders to define and prioritize the features and epics which yield the highest business benefit for the organization. Supports teams as an all-around product resource explaining and clarifying functionality, demonstrating benefits and communicating new ideas to help grow the business. Collaborates with architects to understand the need to address technical debt and support technical innovation. Leads activities to support the delivery of new functionality including product launch communications, training materials, user acceptance testing, business validation, success criteria measurement and analysis, and post-deployment analysis to identify improvements. Facilitates program ceremonies (e.g., product increment planning sessions, retrospectives, demos, etc.). Coordinates the development and maintenance of a given product through the collaboration and partnership with internal customers, vendors and strategic partners. Defines the product roadmap and collaborates with stakeholders to create release plans and backlogs. Writes features and success criteria with key stakeholders and business leaders. Refines the product roadmap based on insights gained from customer feedback. Makes final business decisions related to the product with input from business and technology stakeholders. Collaborates with business stakeholders to identify and explore new opportunities (e.g., promotions, partnerships) to extend products to new customers, verticals, and late adopters. Serves the organization as the subject matter expert with respect to competition, industry trends, technological advances, and changing customer needs. Demonstrates thought leadership and champions the product vision across the company. Required Proven experience working on a Scrum and/or Agile team. Conversant in technology matters related to security, architecture, emerging InfoSec trends, compliance, and risk. Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, load balancers, and proxies. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, that can communicate security and compliance issues to executives, end users, and security experts in an effective and appropriate manner. Outstanding customer\client relations skills to ensure that security and business objectives are always in alignment and a flexible and business-oriented focus on security matters. Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific programs/projects involved. Expertise in utilizing standard documentation tools/utilities. Must be extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Deadline oriented and capable of self-management. Able to work well under stress and handle crisis situations professionally. Able to support 24x7x365 operations including off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. International travel may be required. Recommended A deep understanding of Cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, controls and remediation strategies in global enterprise environments. Understanding of Network security capabilities such as Anomaly Detection, SSL Interception, and Access Control. An ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, verbally and in writing, in an easily-understood, authoritative, and actionable manner. Hands-on experience related to security design, architecture, incident response, and strategic planning. One or more professional security certifications such as Security+, GSEC, CISA, CISM or CISSP (or equivalent work experience). Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail, excellent time management and organizational skills. Ability to work both independently and within a close team environment. Ability to listen to and understand business needs. Possess experience with one or more IT management frameworks, such as: ISO/27001, ITILv3, or SIX Sigma. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.
