The Product Manager is responsible for setting a product vision and strategy, drawing out the most value from a product and guiding the team to execute on the product vision. The Product Manager also works closely with architects and other technical leads to ensure the solution effectively addresses program priorities while maintaining technical integrity. The Product Manager also facilitates product management meetings, planning, and backlog/vision refinement sessions. Product Managers work with Product Owners and customers to understand and communicate their needs, define system features, and participate in validation. This position will ensure that our Data Loss Prevention program provides comprehensive and up to date information about our hardware and software assets to enable discovery, categorization, triage, patching, hardening, and response capabilities at scale across Costco globally. You will build meaningful relationships with teams and management at Costco. This role will drive implementation, execution, metrics, and sustainability of program objectives that allow Cybersecurity Infrastructure to continuously improve our ability to protect and respond to vulnerabilities and threats to our global footprint. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Owns the overall vision and roadmap of a given product and leads the ideation, technical development, and launch of new features and capabilities.. Monitors new and emerging security, compliance and privacy related requirements, technologies, trends, issues, and solutions and assesses their applicability to Costco Wholesale’s key business initiatives and business strategies. Providing advice and consulting to senior management and the organization in the development, implementation, and administration of actions to meet these emerging requirements. Coordinates and monitors information security activities throughout the organization, including the preparation of periodic status and progress reports to applicable parties, leadership teams, and stakeholders. Collaborates with business stakeholders to define and prioritize the features and epics which yield the highest business benefit for the organization Supports teams as an all-around product resource explaining and clarifying functionality, demonstrating benefits, and communicating new ideas to help grow the business. Collaborates with architects to understand the need to address technical debt and support technical innovation. Leads activities to support the delivery of new functionality including product launch communications, training materials, user acceptance testing, business validation, success criteria measurement and analysis, and post-deployment analysis to identify improvements. Facilitates program ceremonies (e.g., product increment planning sessions, retrospectives, demos, etc.) Coordinates the development and maintenance of a given product through the collaboration and partnership with internal customers, vendors, and strategic partners. Defines the product roadmap and collaborates with stakeholders to create release plans and backlogs. Writes features and success criteria with key stakeholders and business leaders. Refines the product roadmap based on insights gained from customer feedback. Makes final business decisions related to the product with input from business and technology stakeholders. Collaborates with business stakeholders to identify and explore new opportunities (e.g., promotions, partnerships) to extend products to new customers, verticals, and late adopters. Serves the organization as the subject matter expert with respect to competition, industry trends, technological advances, and changing customer needs. Required Proven experience working on a Scrum and/or Agile team. Conversant in technology matters related to security, architecture, emerging InfoSec trends, compliance, and risk. Experience working with Data Loss Prevention tools and platforms. Excellent communication skills, both oral and written, that can communicate security and compliance issues to executives, end users, and security experts in an effective and appropriate manner. Outstanding customer\client relations skills to ensure that security and business objectives are always in alignment and a flexible and business-oriented focus on security matters. Deep understanding of business requirements elicitation pursuant to specific programs/projects involved. Expertise in utilizing standard documentation tools/utilities. Must be extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Deadline oriented and capable of self-management. Able to work well under stress and handle crisis situations professionally. Able to support 24x7x365 operations including off-hours work as required, including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. International travel may be required. Recommended A deep understanding of Cybersecurity threats, vulnerabilities, controls and remediation strategies in global enterprise environments Working knowledge of Data Loss Prevention technologies to classify and secure data at rest and in motion for on-prem, remote, and cloud environments. An ability to communicate complex and technical issues to diverse audiences, verbally and in writing, in an easily-understood, authoritative, and actionable manner Hands-on experience related to security design, architecture, incident response, and strategic planning. One or more professional security certifications such as PMP, CPM, SPM, PDMA (or equivalent work experience). Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail, excellent time management and organizational skills. Ability to work both independently and within a close team environment. jobTitle: Project Mgr - IT Strategic Planning & Delivery
jobDescription: IT Project Manager - IT Strategic Planning & Delivery (ideal candidate has a background that includes development, architecture or some engineering) This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Strategic Planning team will partner with leadership to establish a consistent framework to prioritize business direction and align with IT priorities. This function will establish dependencies between core business direction, solution designs, portfolio planning, and program management; providing the aligned source of direction across the IT horizontal and vertical teams. The Project Manager on the IT Strategic Planning team provides direct program leadership to the delivery teams responsible for the foundational core services to support the business’ omnichannel goals. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works with functional managers to staff projects by acquiring the necessary personnel from the various functional areas. Works with the project team to define and document project scope. Creates a project plan and critical path with appropriate level of detail and manages tasks to support project governance requirements. Develops project budgets, manages changes and tracks actual costs and variance to approved budget. Manages issues, risks, and changes to project scope, schedule and budget. Manages the completion of project tasks according to the schedule. Communicates project status to IS and business management. Finalizes project through identification and summarization of lessons learned and creation of the project closedown report. Mentors team members in project management artifacts, processes, tools and techniques. Ensures all project artifacts and deliverables are documented, approved, and stored for re-usability, support, and audit purposes in designated project tools. Must be available for evening, weekend, and holiday work. Required Minimum of five years’ experience applying project management methodologies. Experience in leading portfolio and/or project management efforts using industry standard methods. Demonstrated leadership in simultaneously managing multiple large, complex, cross-functional projects on time, on budget, with requirements met. Proven ability to develop business relationships and work successfully with people at all levels of management. Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills to executive level business stakeholders. Proven ability to manage program/project level budgeting and provide financial tracking over several million dollars. Demonstrated ability to motivate project teams in the completion of projects. Extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Available evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed and travel 25% of the time. Recommended Familiarity with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK). Experience with Rational Team Concert (RTC). Successfully navigates a highly matrixed organization. Demonstrate technical and/or data related acumen, as a project manager. Working knowledge of Service Now (Carts+) Portfolio & Program Management module and/or similar tools such as Smartsheets, MS Project, Ariba. Google Suite (e.g., Spreadsheets, Doc, Presentation, etc.). PMP, Scaled Agile, Scrum Master or equivalent experience. LEAN Six Sigma certification encouraged. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

jobTitle: Project Mgr - SOX Compliance and Security
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2021, Costco contributed over $58 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The Project Manager is a key member of the Information Security Compliance team, reporting to the Manager of Compliance. This role is specifically focused on supporting and driving activity for the SOX Compliance Program, working across Costco Wholesale globally to ensure the compliance team and our business partners are on track to meet our regulatory obligations. The Project Manager will work very closely with Security and other IT Leadership and Management team members to build and maintain a strong compliance program. This position works closely with key global business units such as IT, Legal, Audit, Regional Managers and Senior Management, requiring the ability to balance business needs and security risks. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Defines, plans, and executes to plan. Provides a laser focus approach to managing scope, schedule, budget and resource allocation. Manages large-scale, technical projects, often with multiple internal and external partners/stakeholders. Leads the mitigation and resolution of high impact issues and risks. Collaborates with Architects, Information Security Analysts, Engineers, vendors, and business leaders across business facing portfolios. Develops and executes communication, training and post delivery support plans. Defines, tracks and communicates project milestones proactively. Mentors team members in project management artifacts, processes, tools and techniques. Ensures all project artifacts and deliverables are documented, approved, and stored for re-usability, support, and audit purposes in designated project tools. Develops project budgets, manages changes and tracks actual costs and variance to approved budget. Required Experience managing technical enterprise level projects for 5+ years, with experience managing Compliance projects preferred. Ability to work in varying time zones with international stakeholders as needed. Familiarity with running a project following the Agile/SCRUM methodologies including both technology and non-technology projects. Proficient with managing project level budgeting and providing financial tracking. Demonstrable leadership and team-building skills, with a proven track record for successful delivery of projects, working cross-functionally with business and IT. Proven ability to develop business relationships and communicate successfully with people at all levels of Management exhibiting excellent interpersonal and diplomacy skills. Must be able to define and execute a comprehensive communication plan. Strong communication skills, both oral and written, including presentation skills. Proven history of meeting deadlines, within project constraints, to deliver quality solutions. Excellent and effective delegation skills, with strong follow-up skills. Extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency, and work with a positive attitude. Recommended Past or current certifications in one of the following areas: PMP, CISA, CSM, CISSP, ISA, QSA, or Security+. Proven people management experience - worked with a variety of teams globally. Experience with Agile and SCRUM methodologies is desired. Experience with Google Docs and Google Sites desired. Experience with ServiceNow Platform preferred. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. This is accomplished through: software/web testing; evaluating, and approving of development tasks as completed for their team/domain; developing, modifying and executing software strategies and test plans; analyzing and writing test standards and procedures; maintaining documentation of test results to assist in debugging; and modification of software. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs, develops, and executes software test strategies, test plans, and test scripts. Confirms accuracy and completeness of functional, integration, system, end to end, and acceptance test plans. Designs, creates, and approves or oversees the creation and approval of, project test cases, scripts, and conditions, as well as QA-related documentation. Develops and ensures adherence to standardized software quality assurance best practices, policies, processes, and controls as it pertains to the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Develops and communicates accurate project estimates based on testing dependency analysis as requested by project/management team. Analyzes and determines test dependencies, including QA environment, QA tools, training, build and deployment plans, and communication processes Analyzes relevant business content and participates in requirement gathering sessions providing input on requirement and design documents; assessing requirements for testability, clarity, purpose, inherent ambiguity, contradictory functions, and implementation. Develops, documents, and leads the Defect Management process. Ensures test cases are traceable to originating story/requirement, and those tests fully test feature requirements and/or user story acceptance criteria . Manages defects appropriately by assigning, monitoring, and providing timely communication through the defect lifecycle. Conducts QA risk management process throughout the test plan phase defining and differentiating between risk, defect, and issue Assists teammates in growing and developing the skills necessary to grasp application concepts and tool suite. Identifies and resolves problems often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions. Required Software quality assurance experience. Experience testing in one or more of the following environments: Cloud based testing, UI testing, functional testing, n-tier client/server, and RDBMS. Hands-on experience using HP, IBM or other industry standard SQA tools. Experience with Oracle, MS SQL Server or DB2, and the ability to write SQL queries using table joins. Strong knowledge of Agile, SDLC, and SQA methodology. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent test resource planning and test scheduling skills. Ability to produce and mentor others in creation of effective software test plans and test cases. Ability to write quality defects and work directly with developers to resolve the defects. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. Ability to communicate and work closely with other teams - System administration, db administration, Test data management, etc. Recommended Experience with Korber Highjump and/or Descartes Route Planning is a plus. Costco is looking for a dedicated and experienced Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst to join its e-commerce testing team. The ideal candidate will have significant experience testing large scale, multi-system integrated applications, ideally in the e-commerce industry or Order Management Systems. Their experience will demonstrate that they have a solid understanding of and follow Quality Assurance best practices, yet know when flexibility within those guidelines is acceptable. Candidates must have a clear understanding of the multiple software development methodologies and will have worked in several. They will have solid technical skills which will be used to not only find, but troubleshoot and research problems and issues when they arise. They will understand the benefits of test automation and will have been a part of a team that has successfully used it in the past. They will have strong communication skills demonstrating their ability to collaborate with not only other QA people but with developers, project managers and various levels of management. They will be effective in the use of their time, demonstrate a strong sense of project urgency along with an ability to work under pressure while still delivering on schedule. Their experience will show that they can effectively work on multiple projects at one time - prioritizing their daily work to meet the needs of the projects. They are personable, approachable, willing to help others, able to work under minimal supervision and not easily distracted from their tasks. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. Helps to mentor and develops skills in others. Incorporates test automation as part of their work process. Collaborates with onshore and offshore team members on all project related testing. May oversee and coordinate onshore and offshore testing activities. Works with Business customers in understanding and clarifying requirements and stories. Is available 24/7 and provides 3rd-level application support as necessary. Required Minimum 7 years’ software quality assurance experience. Minimum 4 years’ functional and back-end testing of e-commerce websites and backend applications, including order management systems. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools. Experience with Oracle, MS SQL Server or DB2 and ability to write basic SQL queries. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology as well as experience testing on an Agile team. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent test resource planning and test scheduling skills. Ability to produce effective software test plans and test cases. Proven ability to provide project testing estimates. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. High level understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Ability to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Strong communication and leadership skills with ability to communicate with all levels of the organization from senior management down to staff level. Strong work ethic, positive attitude and excellent collaboration skills. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Costco is looking for a dedicated and experienced Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst to join its e-commerce testing team. The QA Analyst will test Costco websites, Order Management systems, and supporting e-commerce business applications. The ideal candidate will have significant experience testing large scale, multi-system integrated applications, ideally in the e-commerce industry or Order Management Systems. Their experience will demonstrate that they have a solid understanding of and follow Quality Assurance best practices, yet know when flexibility within those guidelines is acceptable. Candidates must have a clear understanding of the multiple software development methodologies and will have worked in several. They will have solid technical skills which will be used to not only find, but troubleshoot and research problems and issues when they arise. They will understand the benefits of test automation and will have been a part of a team that has successfully used it in the past. They will have strong communication skills demonstrating their ability to collaborate with not only other QA people but with developers, project managers and various levels of management. They will be effective in the use of their time, demonstrate a strong sense of project urgency along with an ability to work under pressure while still delivering on schedule. Their experience will show that they can effectively work on multiple projects at one time - prioritizing their daily work to meet the needs of the projects. They are personable, approachable, willing to help others, able to work under minimal supervision and not easily distracted from their tasks. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Creates and/or oversees the creation and approval of project test cases and QA-related documentation. Creates and gains project approval on project test plans. Provides accurate and justifiable estimates for QA resources and testing schedules. Effectively executes tests and records results working with others to identify and resolve defects. Helps to mentor and develops skills in others. Incorporates test automation as part of their work process. Collaborates with onshore and offshore team members on all project related testing. May oversee and coordinate onshore and offshore testing activities. Works with Business customers in understanding and clarifying requirements and stories. Is available 24/7 and provides 3rd-level application support as necessary. Required Minimum 7 years’ software quality assurance experience. Minimum 4 years’ functional and back-end testing of e-commerce websites and backend applications, including order management systems. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools. Experience with Oracle, MS SQL Server or DB2 and ability to write basic SQL queries. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology as well as experience testing on an Agile team. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent test resource planning and test scheduling skills. Ability to produce effective software test plans and test cases. Proven ability to provide project testing estimates. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. High level understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Ability to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Strong communication and leadership skills with ability to communicate with all levels of the organization from senior management down to staff level. Strong work ethic, positive attitude and excellent collaboration skills. Recommended Experience and/or working knowledge in a broad range of platforms, environments and tools, including, but not limited to, the following (or equivalent) technologies: Experience with iSeries/AS400 a plus. Understanding of web services, SOAP, REST and XML concepts and technologies. Database knowledge in a major RDBMS system such as DB2, MS SQL Server or Oracle. Experience creating test automation scripts. Degree in computer science or a related technical field. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Costco is looking for a dedicated and experienced Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst to join its International eCommerce QA team. This position oversees the processes, practices, and execution of both manual and automated UAT, BAT, and Regression testing for all countries deployed on the Costco International SAP Commerce solution. These practices must be managed within Costco Confluence/JIRA (or other approved repository) and adhered to globally. This role will be required to oversee the execution of these practices for every release by every country. The successful candidate must have strong communication skills demonstrating their ability to collaborate with QA individuals, Business Stakeholders, Engineers, Project Managers, and various levels of management. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Performs Test Lead activities. Coordinates and oversees test team activities for in-house, onshore, and offshore testing of multiple initiatives. Participates in requirements and user story review; ensures the appropriate acceptance criteria are included and approved globally. Creates and gains project approval on project test plans. Creates and/or oversees the creation and approval of project test cases and QA-related documentation. Executes tests and records results working with others to identify and resolve defects. Assists with automating and executes automated test cases. Oversees or generates all QA-related documentation. Ensures adherence to standardized QA policies, processes, and documentation standards. Ensures that QA processes and procedures for test environments are followed, and that the integrity of the various environments are not compromised. Executes test cases, defect management, and adherence to test schedule. Attends and/or facilitates daily standup meetings and provides status updates. Provides weekly QA project status reports. Helps to mentor and develop skills in others. Attends all sprint completion meetings and demos to stakeholders. Required Minimum 5 years’ experience in software testing and leadership capacity. Minimum 5 years’ functional and back-end testing of eCommerce websites and backend applications. Minimum 5 years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology as well as experience testing on an Agile team. Experience leading QA teams. Experience in eCommerce Solutions, specifically SAP Commerce Platforms. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans. Ability to produce effective software test plans and test cases. Familiar with source code, version management, and code deployment standards; and utilizes this knowledge. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. High level understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Ability to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Strong communication skills with ability to communicate with all levels of the organization from senior management down to staff level. Proven leadership skills; demonstrated team-building skills with ability to influence and motivate team members that report to other groups in the organization. Strong work ethic, positive attitude, and excellent collaboration skills. Flexible; must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction; able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines. Ability and willingness to travel internationally and adjust work hours to accommodate international teams. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business in a 24 x 7x 365 operations environment- evening, weekend, and holiday work will be required. Recommended Degree in Computer Science or in a related technical field preferred. Experience with projects focused on infrastructures and software solutions. SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. 2-5 years’ of retail business knowledge. Knowledge of French, Spanish, Korean, and Mandarin is a plus. Proficient in the use of Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation, and analytics. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Costco IT is seeking an individual to join our Merchandising Software Quality Assurance department. This position will be responsible for software/web testing, evaluation, and approval of development tasks as completed for the Merchandising (Global, Collaboration and Compliance). This Quality Assurance Analyst will review release notes, design test cases scenarios and create test automation scripts based on user stories, and requirements identified by the business users, in addition to following the Costco QA Software Development Life Cycle. This candidate should be an analytical and logical thinker who is highly organized and able to meet milestones and deadlines while being able to work in a fast paced environment. The Merchandising Quality Assurance Analyst will have to work independently and as part of various teams in the IS Department. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Participates actively in requirement gathering sessions and gives input on requirement and design documents. Reviews requirements for assigned projects and creates test cases scenarios as applicable. Develops, modifies and executes manual tests for scenarios that cannot be automated. Executes smoke, functional, integration, and non-functional test scripts as part of the product/application delivery lifecycle. Executes test automation scripts and maintains the existing framework. Manages and grooms the automated and manual test suites regularly to ensure proper balance between. Creates test data to support the execution of functional and nonfunctional testing activities. Prepares and delivers video demonstrations of testing to Business Stakeholders for each development cycle. Analyzes test results to identify defects, ensures features and user stories work as expected and recommends corrective action as appropriate. Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software. Works closely with a Product Ownership Team on test results and testing required code changes. Identifies and documents software defects in HP-ALM or ADO. Consults and provides feedback for resolution of problems. Establishes and evolves formal QA processes and standards, and ensures that industry's best practices are consistently maintained on project. Abides by and follows software quality assurance standards, processes and controls as it pertains to Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Develops, applies, and maintains quality standards for company products. Required Minimum 5 years’ software quality assurance experience. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools, preferably HP-ALM. Minimum 3 years’ experience working in an Agile environment. Minimum 5 years’ experience working with Software Quality Assurance methodologies and processes. Minimum 2 years’ experience with Oracle or MS SQL Server or DB2 and the ability to write SQL queries using table joins. Ability to digest and understand complex and/or ambiguous user requirements and construct test cases to validate them. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology as well as experience testing on Agile or DevOps teams. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. Strong organizational skills. Ability to work within a team environment. Communicates technical issues clearly in written and oral forms. Ability to multitask in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Must be detail-oriented and capable of working in an environment with changing priorities. Strong work ethic, positive attitude and excellent collaboration skills. Recommended Experience working with Merchandising businesses. Minimum 1 years’ experience using with different scripting languages C#, Java, JavaScript etc., in the test automation process. Minimum 1 years’ experience using Automation tools like Ranorex, Jenkins, SauceLabs, Splunk, Selenium, etc. Experience with automation for test, integration, and build/release. SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. Knowledge and experience with AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals. Understanding of web services, SOAP, REST and XML concepts and technologies.. Working knowledge of ADO and Google Suite. Familiarity working with Vendors for QA testing, defect management, and troubleshooting. Analytical thinker possessing strong problem solving and decision making skills. Degree in computer science or related technical field preferred. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. Prepares software/web development which includes C# coding, MSSQL coding, testing, evaluation, and approval of development tasks as completed. Develops, applies and maintains quality standards for company products. Assists in other areas of the department and company as necessary. Required Minimum 2 years of software quality assurance experience. Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools, preferably HP-ALM. Minimum 2 years’ experience working in an Agile environment. Minimum 2 years’ experience working with Software Quality Assurance methodologies and processes. Minimum 1 year experience with Oracle or MS SQL Server or DB2 and the ability to write SQL queries using table joins. Minimum 1 year experience using with programming languages C#, Java, JavaScript in the test automation process. Ability to digest and understand complex and/or ambiguous user requirements and construct test cases to validate them. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology as well as experience testing on Agile or DevOps teams. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Knowledge of and experience using Visual Studio and GIT. Strong organizational skills. Ability to work within a team environment. Communicates technical issues clearly in written and oral forms. Ability to multi-task in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Must be detail-oriented and capable of working in an environment with changing priorities. Strong work ethic, positive attitude and excellent collaboration skills. Possesses a quick ability to learn product/domain knowledge through many applications. Must be able to work nights/weekends as necessary. Recommended Minimum 1 year experience using Automation tools like Ranorex, Jenkins, SauceLabs, Splunk, Selenium, etc. Understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. Experience working with Costco Pharmacy, Optical or Hearing Aid businesses. Experience with automation for test, integration and build/release. SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. Knowledge and experience with AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals. Knowledge and experience with XML, web-based services. Working knowledge of HP ALM and Google Suite. Working knowledge of Microsoft Azure. Working knowledge of SauceLabs. Familiarity working with Vendors for QA testing, defect management, and troubleshooting. Analytical thinker possessing strong problem solving and decision making skills. The Quality Engineer - Ancillary Solutions will be responsible for software/web development which includes C# coding, MSSQL coding, testing, evaluation, and approval of development tasks as completed for the Ancillary Business Units (Pharmacy, Optical, Hearing Aids, Photo, and CWT). The Quality Engineer will review release notes, design test cases scenarios and Code C# test automation test cases; maintain and monitor Azure farm of VM’s, User Stories, and requirements identified by the business users, in addition to following the Costco QA Software Development Life Cycle. The successful candidate should be an analytical and logical thinker who is highly organized and able to meet milestones and deadlines, while being able to work in a fast paced environment. The Ancillary Quality Engineer will have to work independently and as part of various teams in the IT Department. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Provides accurate project estimates for assigned tasks as required by the Product Owner. Participates in requirement gathering sessions and gives input on requirement and design documents. Reviews requirements for assigned projects and creates test cases scenarios as applicable. Works closely with the Product Ownership Team and Scrum Master on test results and testing required code changes. Works with off-site or Vendor Development teams to ensure software is adequately tested and up to Costco’s Business requirements. (No on-site development). Develops, modifies, and executes manual tests for scenarios that cannot be automated. Manages executions of test automation test suites in Azure VM farm and local stand-alone environments. Codes new C# modules to extend existing frameworks. Manages SQL Server solution, schema, and objects. Codes enhancements and fixes when necessary. Creates test data to support the execution of functional and nonfunctional testing activities. Prepares and delivers video demonstrations of testing to Business Stakeholders for each development cycle. Analyzes test results to identify defects; ensures features and User Stories work as expected; and recommends corrective action as appropriate. Maintains documentation of test results to assist in debugging and modification of software. Identifies and documents software defects in HP-ALM and Vendor systems. Consults and provides feedback for resolution of problems. Establishes and evolves formal QA processes and standards; and ensures that industry's best practices are consistently maintained on project. Abides by and follows software quality assurance standards, processes, and controls as it pertains to Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Develops, applies, and maintains quality standards for company products. Required 3+ years’ software quality assurance experience. 3+ years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools, preferably HP-ALM. 3+ years’ experience working in an Agile environment. 3+ years’ experience working with Software Quality Assurance methodologies and processes. 2+ years’ experience with Oracle or MS SQL Server or DB2, and the ability to write SQL queries using table joins. 2+ years’ experience using with programming languages C#, Java, JavaScript, etc. in the test automation process. 2+ years’ experience using Automation tools like Ranorex, Jenkins, SauceLabs, Splunk, Selenium etc. Ability to understand complex and/or ambiguous user requirements and construct test cases to validate them. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology, as well as experience testing on Agile or DevOps teams. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. Knowledge of and experience using Visual Studio and GIT. Strong organizational skills. Ability to work within a team environment. Communicates technical issues clearly in written and oral forms. Ability to multitask in a fast paced, dynamic environment. Must be detail-oriented and capable of working in an environment with changing priorities. Strong work ethic, positive attitude and excellent collaboration skills. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including evenings, weekends, and 24/7 on call responsibilities. Recommended Degree in computer science or related technical field preferred. Experience working with Costco Pharmacy, Optical, or Hearing Aid businesses. Experience with automation for test, integration, and build/release. SQA experience working within an iterative development framework. Knowledge and experience with AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals. Knowledge and experience with XML, web-based services. Working knowledge of HP ALM and Google Suite; Microsoft Azure, and/or SauceLabs Familiarity working with suppliers for QA testing, defect management, and troubleshooting. The Membership IT team is looking for an experienced and talented IT Quality Engineer (QE) to join us in transforming Costco’s digital member experience. With our team, the QE will be challenged every day to help deliver and maintain customer-facing products using modern programming languages, frameworks, and infrastructure. The ideal candidate for this role is someone who owns and is passionate about quality standards for large, customer-facing systems. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Partners with an Agile scrum delivery pod of developers, full stack engineers, QEs, and product management to deliver high-quality, multi-platform functionality - from user-story creation through development, testing, acceptance, and release. Develops and executes well-designed testing strategies, test plans and cases, test automation, and manual testing to validate functional and non-functional requirements for new features. Builds, maintains, leverages, and supports scalable test infrastructure, automation framework, and CI/CD pipelines to maximize coverage, improve speed of delivery, and enable consistently high-quality results. Creates quality metrics, publishes reports, and drives goal-achieving improvements in system quality and performance. Logs, tracks, and reports test-execution and defect-resolution status through completion. Certifies monthly releases through end-to-end smoke, integration, regression, and performance testing prior to deployment. Collaborates in paired programming and conducts peer code reviews with others. Teams with QEs across the organization to influence and adopt best practices, implements shift-left testing, mentors, and raises the bar in overall test coverage and execution. Required 2+ years’ of professional C# and JavaScript experience. Experience with UI and/or API test automation development. Proven track record for independently delivering complex, multi-platform solutions as part of a team. Experience working on a team while independently owning and ensuring customer-focused, high-quality functionality. Able to effectively track, communicate, and problem-solve for multiple responsibilities simultaneously. Recommended Computer Science degree or 3+ combined years’ of experience working in IT Quality Assurance and Test Automation. Experience in a QA or QE lead role - driving testing efforts, and teaching, coaching, and/or mentoring others. Experience working with cross-functional teams to deliver large systems. Previous experience using the .NET, Angular, and Azure frameworks/platforms. Working knowledge of on-prem and cloud databases (Cosmos, SQL, DB2, etc.). Familiarity with tools like: Azure DevOps, Microsoft VisualStudio Pro, Postman Pro, GitHub, Selenium, LucidCharts, etc. Experience with DevOps and CI/CD pipelines. Familiarity with Costco membership business processes or similar customer-loyalty system experience. Quality Engineers are core delivery team members responsible for the validation of functional and nonfunctional requirements implemented by a team. They are responsible for decomposing the functional and technical requirements created by Product Owners and Systems Analysts into test scripts. Quality Engineers raise defects as issues are identified and support the remediation process with teams. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops functional test plans for complex systems. Tests required code changes while working closely with developers and product owners. Designs and develops high quality test automation, from which others can create repeatable automated tests. Generates API Level Automation using various technologies and tools. Analyzes, identifies, and validates functional aspects of a shared service, supporting multiple downstream systems. Raises the standards for QA practices and stays up-to-date with the latest technologies both in the Company and industry and utilizes them to good effect. Regular and reliable workplace attendance at your assigned location. Ability to operate vehicles, equipment or machinery. Computer, phone, printer, copier, fax Required 1-3 years’ of current and demonstrable experience as an SDET in API/UI. 1-3 years’ of automation and testing experience with XML and web-based SOAP/RESTful services. 1-3 years’ of current design and development experience in Java or C#. At least 1 year of development experience in any scripting language. At least 1 year of experience with Microsoft SQL and/or Transact-SQL. At least 1 year of experience with backend testing writing SQL queries and testing Stored Procedures. Proficient with Agile testing methodologies and best practices in an SDET role. Excellent communication, collaboration, reporting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Ability to work both independently and within a close team environment. Computer Science and engineering skills and equivalent experience. Recommended Appreciation for CI/CD and DevOps. Experience working with Maven, Git, JDBC, Splunk. Experience in Unit Testing frameworks like Junit/TestNG. Experience with UI automation tools, ideally Selenium Web Driver. Testing and automation experience MS VSTS technology stack including TFS, MTM, and Lab Center. Tomcat/Apache knowledge. Travel industry knowledge. Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal. Successful internal candidates will have spent one year or more on their current team. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The Release Manager is responsible for overseeing and orchestrating the cross-organizational efforts required to introduce applications, infrastructure and middleware changes into the cloud environment. Ensuring all capabilities required to package changes for delivery to users are in place while maintaining the integrity and availability of the existing system. Setting and communicating release expectations across all involved teams and impacted users. Working with all necessary I.S. teams to build, maintain and manage an overall Release Schedule. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Manages build, deploy and release requests by acting as the focal point for driving project priorities within the team and coordination of work efforts as they correspond to projects and I.S. needs. Acts as liaison between Development, QA, Project Management, Infrastructure, and other IS teams across the project portfolio roadmap and ensures the build, deploy, release team can proactively prepare for future needs. Develops and maintains critical success factors and key performance indicators to measure and support team metric definitions and report release quality. Manages and orchestrates release and deployment activities across functional teams which may include Business Relations, Development, Infrastructure, Quality Assurance, Change Management, and Service Desk to ensure awareness, successful operational handoffs, deployment and acceptance of releases. On-going development and stewardship of the Release Management process. This includes establishing and enforcing specific policies to govern the process. Champions, adheres to and contributes improvements to the release process to support quality releases and minimize risk to the production environment. Establishes and communicates release schedules, expectations and release activity progress. Provides reports across all involved teams. Creates required release documentation that supports the release through its lifecycle, including a back out strategy. Manages and controls issues and risks for the duration of the release cycle to ensure a well-organized and successful deployment. Tracks to ensure artifacts required for production deployment are in place. Obtains approvals for any exceptions to the normal required production artifacts. Required Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills as well as a positive attitude. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Excellent organizational and planning skills, with experience building tactical plans. Experience in negotiating timelines and deliverables with a strong sense of urgency. Strong process knowledge of System Development Life Cycles; Waterfall and Agile. Flexible, must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction, able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines. 24 x 7 x 365 operations - evening, weekend, and holiday work may be required from time to time. Recommended Minimum of 5 years’ experience in IT and/or Finance. BA/BS degree in computer science or related technical field is preferred. Project Management Certification/experience a plus. Agile process knowledge and/or Certifications a plus. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The eCommerce Release Manager is responsible for the release lifecycle. This includes the planning, scheduling, coordinating, deploying and overall management of the software build process through the different stages within Costco's delivery lifecycle. Release Managers are responsible for creating detailed readiness checklists and integrated release plans across several products and dependencies, while improving the software build process, and for optimizing the release pipeline. Release Managers are not only responsible for obtaining deployment approval, but manage the release activities into production during the scheduled maintenance windows. Release Managers build and maintain relationships with stakeholders, team members and peers and are responsible for communicating release expectations and statuses across value streams, program stakeholders and impacted users. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Facilitates integrated release planning sessions in conjunction with teams and product team members (e.g., Product Managers, Solution Architects) to align on release objectives, identify dependencies across product teams and value streams, define milestones, and provide automated deployments and set configurations. Creates deployment plans and accompanying readiness checklists to ensure dependencies are identified and managed. Creates and manages the Request For Change (RFC) end to end process . Creates and maintains the change management calendar in conjunction with IT change management standards. Communicates release milestones and activity progress to all program stakeholders and team members. Creates and maintains the integrated project delivery plan across all impacted products (within and across value streams). Facilitates the documentation of rollback strategies, hypercare support, and handoffs to production support teams. Builds operational readiness plan (e.g., Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA), run book, call trees with escalations, etc.) to ensure broader teams are prepared for deployment. Develops and maintains formal release records to track release content. Coordinates the release and deployment of the QA build to support Performance and User A cceptance Testing (UAT) activities as part of Costco’s release schedule. Collaborates with program stakeholders to obtain final sign-off to release a build. Communicates release impediments and collaborates with teams to define mitigation strategies. Supports/serves multiple teams and Product Managers to drive release goals and outcomes. Coordinates the execution of all code deployments to production environments using appropriate tools and tracking mechanisms. Coordinates the resolution of portfolio-related production issues due to build and deployment errors with the support of environment and tooling teams. Provides teams and program stakeholders with coaching on organizational release management practices and disciplines. Assembles and leads multiple cross-functional teams to support IT application releases of varying sizes, including building and maintaining release distribution lists. Defines and manages release readiness activities and success criteria in conjunction with program stakeholders. Builds and maintains relationships with stakeholders, team members and peers. Identifies automation tools to automate build and release pipelines to improve the speed and reliability of the release process. Ensures version control for added traceability and reliability of code to track code evolutions. Facilitates post-release retrospectives. Required 4+ years of eCommerce release management experience including deployment using a maintenance window. Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills as well as a positive attitude. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong organizational and planning skills, with experience building and executing tactical plans. Ability to negotiate timelines and deliverables with a strong sense of urgency. Strong process knowledge of System Development Life Cycles; Waterfall and Agile. Flexible, must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction, able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines. 24x7x365 operations including evening, weekend, and holiday work required during release cycles. Recommended 7+ years’ experience in IT; BA/BS degree in computer science or related technical field is preferred. Familiarity with eCommerce. Knowledge of Websphere Commerce, Order Management or Order Fulfillment systems. Project Management Certification (PMP) or related experience. Certified Scrum Master. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

As proof, Costco ranks seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”. The eCommerce Release Manager is responsible for the release lifecycle. This includes the planning, scheduling, coordinating and overall management of the software build process through the different stages within Costco's delivery lifecycle. Release Managers are responsible for creating detailed integrated release plans across several products and dependencies, for improving the software build process, and for optimizing the release pipeline. They build and maintain relationships with stakeholders, team members and peers and are responsible for communicating release expectations and statuses across value streams, program stakeholders and impacted users. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Facilitates integrated release planning sessions in conjunction with teams and product team members (e.g., Product Managers, Solution Architects) to align on release objectives, identify dependencies across product teams and value streams, define milestones, and provide automated deployments and set configurations. Creates deployment plans and accompanying checklists to ensure dependencies are identified and managed. Creates and manages the Request For Change (RFC) end to end process. Creates and maintains the change management calendar in conjunction with IT change management standards. Communicates release milestones and activity progress to all program stakeholders and team members. Creates and maintains the integrated project delivery plan across all impacted products (within and across value streams). Facilitates the documentation of rollback strategies, hypercare support, and handoffs to production support teams. Builds operational readiness plan (e.g., Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA), run book, call trees with escalations, etc.) to ensure broader teams are prepared for deployment. Develops and maintains formal release records to track release content. Coordinates the release/deployment of the QA build to support User Acceptance Testing (UAT) activities as part of Costco’s release schedule. Collaborates with program stakeholders to obtain final sign-off to release a build. Communicates release impediments and collaborates with teams to define mitigation strategies. Supports/serves multiple teams and Product Managers to drive release goals and outcomes. Coordinates the execution of all code deployments to production environments using appropriate tools and tracking mechanisms. Coordinates the resolution of portfolio-related production issues due to build and deployment errors with the support of environment and tooling teams. Provides teams and program stakeholders with coaching on organizational release management practices and disciplines. Assembles and leads multiple cross-functional teams to support IT application releases of varying sizes, including building and maintaining release distribution lists. Defines and manages release readiness activities and success criteria in conjunction with program stakeholders. Builds and maintains relationships with stakeholders, team members and peers. Identifies automation tools to automate build and release pipelines to improve the speed and reliability of the release process. Ensures version control for added traceability and reliability of code to track code evolutions. Facilitates post-release retrospectives. Required Excellent interpersonal and diplomatic skills as well as a positive attitude. Strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong organizational and planning skills, with experience building and executing tactical plans. Ability to negotiate timelines and deliverables with a strong sense of urgency. Strong process knowledge of System Development Life Cycles; Waterfall and Agile. Flexible, must be able to change priorities quickly, focus on new ones without distraction, able to deal with conflict and work under pressure to meet deliverable dates/timelines. 24x7x365 operations including evening, weekend, and holiday work required during release cycles. Recommended 7+ years’ experience in IT; BA/BS degree in computer science or related technical field is preferred. Familiarity with eCommerce. Knowledge of Websphere Commerce, Order Management or Order Fulfillment systems. Project Management Certification (PMP) or related experience. Certified Scrum Master. The International IT Release Manager coordinates and orchestrates the efforts required to introduce application changes into production for delivery to end-users. The Release Manager is responsible for setting and communicating release expectations, milestones, and statuses; creating and sending post-release reports to all involved parties and impacted users, from end-user to enterprise leadership. This role would partner with both IT Operations Analysts and Project Managers for local and large scale efforts. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Manages and orchestrates the cross-organizational efforts required to introduce applications, infrastructure, and middleware changes into all environments. Connects development, QA, Project Management, Infrastructure, and other IS teams to support project portfolio roadmap; and ensures the Build, Deploy, Release team can proactively prepare for future needs. Develops and stewards the Release Management process, along with establishing specific standards to govern the process. Adheres and contributes to improvements to the release process that support quality releases and minimize risk to the production and non-production environments. Establishes and communicates release expectations, milestones, and release activity progress; provides reports for and across all involved teams. Identifies critical success factors and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure and report on release quality. Creates and maintains required release documentation that supports any given release through its production life cycle. Maintains and controls risks for the duration of the release cycle to ensure a well-organized and successful deployment. Tracks to ensure that approved entrance/exit criteria required for production deployment are in place. Coordinates environment refresh cycles with various enterprise teams to minimize release impact and sustain system integrity and availability. Works with the various enterprise teams to proactively plan system patching and application upgrades/enhancements to minimize release impact and risk. Travels up to 25% as dictated by business needs. Supports business functions and outages as needed, including nights, weekends, and holidays (24/7) to help drive resolution of issues and outages. Experience managing program level activities by developing and executing against a strategic program charter. Familiar with Costco’s IT or similar project methodology, processes, and procedures. The SAP GRC Analyst is responsible for the creation and maintenance of General IT control objectives in the area of SAP Security. This position will be responsible for ensuring that all SAP Security IT control objectives are in compliance and running to full efficiency. In addition this role will assist with the daily and monthly reporting of SOD (Segregation of Duties) activities from SAP GRC in support of meeting applicable compliance objectives. Candidates must have direct “hands-on” experience in IT audits and functional experience using SAP GRC. This is a cross-functional role, working closely with the SAP Security team and other functional teams to ensure security requirements and solutions meet compliance objectives. Effective communication and technical leadership is critical to the success of this role. Candidates must be able to mentor and teach junior level employees as well as possess the ability to fluently speak both technical and business language interchangeably. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Creates and/or remediates GITC (General IT Controls) in support of meeting audit objectives for all SAP modules, and their supporting Databases, within the Costco SAP landscape (i.e. Finance, Retail, Warehouse Management, Payroll, Oracle, HANA, etc...). Designs IT testing procedures to identify and evaluate risk exposures and determine the effectiveness and efficiency of controls. Assists with the creation of effective remediation solutions and/or exception documentation where applicable. Serves as the subject matter expert and point of contact to Internal and External Auditors. Assists project teams with creation and implementation of IT controls objectives and integration into SAP-GRC. Assists with the successful completion of the quarterly UAR (User Access Review) audit process. Collaborates with Internal Audit in developing, testing, and devising solutions to effectively meet applicable IT control objectives. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Available for 24x7 on call rotational support. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness and quality of work. Assists in other areas of the department and company as necessary. Required Minimum of 5 years’ experience of SAP GRC Access 10.0 and or 12.0 with expertise using the following modules; Account Request Management (ARM), Access Risk Analysis (ARA), Emergency Access Management (EAM), User Access, Review (UAR), and/or Process Control (PC). Minimum of 5 years’ work experience in IT Risk Management, SOX compliance and/or auditing with a strong background in IT controls. Minimum of 5 years’ experience with SAP Security across various applications including but not limited to S/4 HANA, ECC, BW, MDG, Fiori, PI/PO, eWM, Solution Manager. Understanding of SAP cloud security. Minimum of 5 years’ experience with SOD conflict resolution. Strong understanding of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and other compliance requirements that may impact SAP Security. Expertise in working with Internal and External auditors. Experience developing security solutions that address Sarbanes-Oxley requirements. Ability to effectively mentor less experienced team members on SAP compliance. Experience in successful project implementation and follow-up. Strong conceptual, analytical, problem-solving, troubleshooting and resolution skills. Ability to monitor and manage the progress of tasks. Designs, develops and maintains SAP user management and security architecture across SAP environments. This includes hands-on role design and build across a number of complex SAP applications and databases. Strong time management skills. Good decision making skills. Recommended: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Information Technology or Computer Science preferred. Documentation and presentation skills catered to a diverse technical and business audience. Technical knowledge of SAP landscapes and roadmaps. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

The Scrum Master (SM) is responsible for facilitating team level Agile processes and around requirements definition, scope, and delivery. The SM must resolve team level impediments, manage risk, and drive continuous improvement throughout the delivery teams and lifecycle. They are responsible for working closely with Product Owners to ensure that team members are working on the highest priority work items defined within their respective roadmaps. The SM has a strong understanding of Agile Scrum and Kanban principles and practices. Scrum Masters also are responsible for providing hands-on coaching to support the adoption of agile practices and identifying opportunity areas for continuous improvement. Scrum Masters are strong communicators and are required to work closely with other delivery / application teams to support the implementation of working software. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works with Product Manager and Product Owners to help ensure execution alignment for Scrum Teams. Facilitates Agile Scrum Team execution and feature completion tracking for multiple Scrum Teams. Supports the Product Owner with the creation, refinement, and prioritization of user stories within a product backlog. Identifies and creates metrics that measure and report on team performance, backlogs health, and continuous improvement. Works with multiple in-house and external Scrum Teams enterprise-wide to remove impediments and manage dependencies. Arranges and facilitates daily stand-up meetings and demos/retrospectives. Ensures quick inspection and proper use of an Agile process. Escalates and assists in the resolution of impediments to support the timely completion of sprint deliverables. Encourages and guides the adoption of Agile policies and procedures. Provides coaching on Agile practices and methods for assigned as well as other Scrum Teams. Supports the implementation of improvement areas identified in team retrospectives. Ensures the work implemented by teams adheres to the steps and procedures (e.g., test scripts must be written and executed to validate a user story) outlined within the definition of done (DoD) framework. Participates in scrum-of-scrums (SoS) to support the management and remediation of dependencies across multiple product/application teams. Acts as a servant leader for multiple teams and their stakeholders. Required 1+ years’ experience as a Scrum Master. 1+ years’ experience leading technical and non-technical teams in an Agile environment. Certified Scrum Master (CSM). Experience in managing at least one or Multiple Scrum Teams. Understanding of ITIL framework. Strong manager, collaborator, and servant leader. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills. Proven ability to develop business relationships and communicate successfully with people at all levels of management; exhibit excellent interpersonal and diplomacy skills. Proficient with managing program / project level initiatives. Must be extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency and a positive attitude. Recommended 3+ years’ experience as a Scrum Master. 3+ years’ experience leading technical and non-technical teams in an Agile environment. Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) preferred. ITILv3 or v4 Certified. Prior experience successfully managing a delivery of a technology solution. Demonstrate technical and/or data related acumen, as a project management leader. Ability to plan, lead, and deliver mission critical, complex data analytics solutions. Familiarity with eCommerce and Order Management processes.
