SDET's are core delivery team members responsible for the validation of functional and nonfunctional requirements implemented by a team. They are responsible for decomposing the functional and technical requirements created by Product Owners and Systems Analysts into test scripts. SDET's raise defects as issues are identified and support the remediation process with teams. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Defines the testing strategy and approach to validate new or enhanced functionality implemented by teams. Collaborates with team members to decompose functional and nonfunctional requirements into test scripts and scenarios. Determines test dependencies including QA test environment, QA tools, training, build and deployment plans, intra-team dependencies, and communication processes. Creates and executes manual and automated test scripts to validate the acceptance criteria defined within the epics and user stories implemented by team members. Develops manual test cases for all functional and non-functional requirements; and collaborates with development team members to identify candidates for test case automation. Identifies risks impacting the timely delivery of a given product; and collaborates with team members to prepare mitigation strategies. Executes smoke, functional, integration, and non-functional test scripts as part of the product/application delivery lifecycle. Collaborates with team members to investigate the root cause of failed manual or automated test scripts. Creates defects with detailed information pertaining to the failed test case/scenario with supporting documentation (screenshots, environment details, log files, etc.). Collaborates with team members to identify existing manual and automated test scripts that will be impacted through the development of new features and capabilities. Shares feedback with the team members pertaining to the quality of sprint deliverables during retrospectives. Manages the remediation of defects raised throughout the development lifecycle; and creates supporting quality reports that are shared with stakeholders. Collaborates with product team members (e.g., Product Owners, System Analysts) to define the automating testing approach/strategy for a given product/application. Develops testing protocols and standards to improve end-to-end testing outcomes and shares and adopts best practices with the center of excellence (CoE) and other Quality Engineers. Creates test data to support the execution of functional and nonfunctional testing activities. Develops and executes automated test scripts to accelerate team velocity through the reduction of manual testing efforts. Maintains the automated testing suite and accompanying framework for a given product. Collaborates with team members (e.g., DevOps Engineers, Systems Architects) to incorporate new automated test scripts into the continuous integration pipeline. Shares test automation practices with engineers to promote “shift left” testing disciplines and practices (incorporate testing earlier in development) within a team. Required Computer Science degree or experience working in IT Quality Assurance and Test Automation. Experience with UI and/or API test automation development. Professional C# and JavaScript experience. Proven track record for independently delivering complex, multi-platform solutions as part of a team. Experience working on a team while independently owning and ensuring customer-focused, high-quality functionality. Able to effectively track, communicate, and problem-solve for multiple responsibilities simultaneously. Recommended Experience with Korber Highjump and/or Descartes Route Planning is a plus. California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Costco is looking for an experienced Quality Engineer to join our e-commerce team to help us elevate our business to the next level, while having fun learning new technologies and solving complex problems. The Quality Engineer will ensure Costco members have the best possible experience purchasing products on Costco websites and mobile apps as well as supporting e-commerce business applications. The ideal candidate will be a highly-seasoned Quality Engineer with a track record of delivering quality software solutions. You will have significant experience testing large scale, integrated applications in an e-commerce system. The candidate must have a clear understanding of software development methodologies and will have consistently delivered high-quality software solutions using various methodologies. The candidate will demonstrate solid technical skills which has served them to find, troubleshoot and research problems and issues and bring them to resolution. You will proficiently create and leverage automation as one of the many tools in their QA toolkit. You will be responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and maintaining automated test cases for Costco eCommerce websites, mobile apps and supporting e-commerce business applications. You will work with the project team to identify test cases for automation, define and document test requirements, analyze target applications/systems under test, develop automated tests, execute automated tests and analyze the results. Strong communication and interpersonal skills is a must, with ability to communicate with other team members such as; Scrum Masters, Product Owners, Full Stack Engineers and various levels of management. You must be able to effectively manage your time and deliverables while delivering on schedule. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Creates and owns review and execution of project test plans, test cases, automation and all QA-related collateral and documentation for a feature or product area. Creates and leverages automation during all phases of the test process using Selenium and Java. Reports and analyzes test results and discovered defects. Maintains automated testing tools as needed. Provides accurate project estimates for assigned tasks. Executes testing directly and/or leveraging offshore resources while ensuring accurate results, identifying failure patterns and supporting bug triage processes to bring issues to closure. Mentors junior team members. Creates and leverages automation during all phases of the test process using Selenium and Java. Ensures the completeness and accuracy of all documentation for assigned work products. Keeps current on technology related to areas of focus. Adheres to Costco quality standards with a focus on continuous quality improvement. Provide 24X7 on call support, as needed (approximately 1 week every 2 months). Required 5+ years’ recent hands-on experience with designing, coding, and executing automated test solutions using Selenium, Java and TestNG. Comparable experience with C#, Ranorex or equivalent may be considered. 5+ years’ progressive, hands-on software quality assurance experience, with a sound understanding of quality processes and methodologies. Solid proficiency in web technologies, including: HTML, CSS, client scripting, DOM interrogation and manipulation. Must have a strong understanding of object-oriented programming and demonstrate solid technical design skills. Ability to mentor other automation Analysts and members of the QA team in automated test execution and troubleshooting. Excellent skills in all of the following areas: analysis and problem solving, good development practices, troubleshooting, debugging and code maintenance. Database knowledge in a major RDBMS system such as DB2, MS SQL Server or Oracle. Experience with automated testing of API’s. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Proven ability to work under pressure and to effectively multitask. Willingness and ability to take ownership of tasks and drive them to completion with minimal guidance. Innovative, creative, and responsive team player with a solid work ethic and strong sense of urgency. Recommended 4-year degree in computer science, related technical field or equivalent work experience. Experience testing Android and iOS using Appium. Experience testing enterprise e-Commerce systems. Experience with agile methodologies. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. jobTitle: Security Analyst - Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Asset and Cloud Intelligence
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Cybersecurity Infrastructure team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member’s and employee’s privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Analyst will be a key member of the Cybersecurity Infrastructure - Asset and Cloud Intelligence team that will support, maintain, and develop tools and projects focused on delivering asset visibility and intelligence to the Information Security and Compliance departments. The Analyst should have in-depth knowledge of system discovery and data management software and tools. They will work with management and vendors for product consideration including the auditing of information system activities. As a Subject Matter Expert, they will provide consultative services, drive innovation in technology, process, and procedure. Additional responsibilities include: maintaining operational excellence for their tools, services, and programs; creating and maintaining documentation related to policies, standards and procedures; leading and mentoring team members with lesser subject matter expertise. The Analyst should have in-depth working experience and knowledge of asset discovery, system integration, data collection, consolidation, manipulation, validation and reporting; solid skills in Windows and Linux environments along with experience with working with enterprise networks; experience with cybersecurity frameworks and best practices. This work will involve working with many groups throughout IT both domestically and internationally. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Assesses existing Cybersecurity Infrastructure platforms and tools. Creates the roadmap for addressing capability gaps, maturity improvements and innovation. Supports security standards and procedures; identifies, develops and implements mechanisms to detect sensitive data and security incidents. Mentors and develops team members. Evaluates and hardens tooling and instrumentation to prevent cybersecurity exploits. Performs duties necessary to assist in establishing practices and system configurations to ensure the safety of information systems assets and to protect information systems from intentional or inadvertent access or destruction. Works with information systems custodians (i.e., department managers, user community and systems administrators) at different levels in the organization to understand their respective security needs and assist with implementing practices and procedures consistent with Costco’s Information Security Policy. Assists with monitoring and auditing of information systems activities and systems to confirm information security policy compliance and provide management with security policy compliance assessments and system monitoring reports. Works with stakeholders to provide security solutions that support their business requirements. Conducts security risk assessments on new products and systems, periodic security risk assessments on existing systems and identifies and/or recommends appropriate security countermeasures and best practices. Coordinates activities or engagements with loss prevention, and interacts with legal and law enforcement. Identifies security gaps that expose Costco to potential exploit and develops short and long term prioritized remediations to address those gaps ensuring management is apprised of the risk in a timely manner. Maintains current knowledge of industry trends and standards. Assumes a leadership role in advocating internally and externally for compliance with security measures to protect Costco’s applications and environments. Required A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field or a minimum of 5 years information systems security experience. Expertise in managing IT Asset Management (ITAM) or CMDB systems such as Service Now, Axonius, Etc. Experience with integrating disparate systems for data enrichment such as using PowerBI or APIs. Experience performing complex data management, validation, reporting, and analysis. Experience with discovery protocols and tools such as Ping, NMAP, ARP, SNMP, etc. Experience with networking technologies, such as firewalls, routers, switches, load balancers, and proxies. 3 - 5 years’ experience with deploying, configuring and securing cloud PaaS & IaaS resources such as Azure, GCP and AWS. Experience with at least one scripting/programming language: PowerShell, shell scripting, python, etc. Working knowledge of information systems security standards/practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). Ability to clearly communicate Information Security matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers, using appropriate language, examples and tone. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Demonstrates a high level of communication skills, verbal and written. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness and quality of work. Responsible for continued personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Recommended One or more professional certifications such as Security+, Network+, CCNA, GSEC, CISA or CISSP (or equivalent work experience). Thorough experience within both Windows and Linux environments. Experience managing and using Configuration Management systems such as SCCM, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, etc. Strong knowledge of scalable multi-tier enterprise-level applications. Working knowledge of protocols and technologies such as ICMP, HTTP/HTTPS, SSH, SFTP, SNMP and DNS. Thorough understanding of the OSI model, as well as IPv4/IPv6 protocol suite. Working knowledge and experience with data warehouses and data lakes would be beneficial. Experience performing computer forensics. Experience with ITILv2/v3 processes such as Service Support, Service Delivery, or Continual Service Improvement. Experience with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI. Experience in a DevOps or DevSecOps environment. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The role of each Cybersecurity Infrastructure team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco, including meeting legal, ethical and regulatory obligations; protecting member privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. The Cybersecurity Infrastructure Analyst provides consultative services; works with suppliers for product considerations and recommendations; performs monitoring and auditing of information system activities; creates and maintains documentation related to policies, standards, and procedures; mentors other team members. The analyst will understand systems management knowledge with security emphasis in following areas: IPL process, job management, job queues, job scheduler, job descriptions, output queues, job scheduler, job descriptions, output queues, system values, job logs. The analyst has knowledge of IBM security best practices, IBM i (iSeries) OS, IT audit, policies, vulnerability risk remediation, and regulatory requirements. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Works analytically to solve both tactical and strategic problems. Works with IBM Lab Services, Costco Compliance, Internal Audit, and Business teams to identify and analyze risks. Works with stakeholders to provide security solutions that support their business requirements. Identifies, develops, and implements mechanisms to detect security incidents in order to enhance compliance with and in support of security standards and procedures in place. Works with the Incident Response team to remediate discovered security incidents by informing appropriate custodians, determining root cause, and actions (if necessary) required to re-establish respective information system security. Understands compliance requirements that may impact security and works with business areas and project teams to develop security solutions that address these requirements. Coordinates activities or engagements with Loss Prevention, Legal, and law enforcement as required. Participates in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness, and quality of work. Keeps up to date in the areas of: technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Maintains current knowledge of industry trends and standards. Travels internationally as required. Required Security, and Systems Administration knowledge and experience. Working knowledge of information systems security standards/practices (e.g., access control and system hardening, system audit and log file monitoring, security policies, and incident handling). High level of communication skills, verbal and written, with the ability to clearly communicate Cybersecurity Infrastructure matters to executives, auditors, end users, and engineers, using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Demonstrate a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Knowledge of IBM security best practices, IBM i (iSeries) OS, IT audit, policies, vulnerability risk remediation, and regulatory requirements. Systems management knowledge with security emphasis in following areas: IPL process, job management, job queues, job scheduler, job descriptions, output queues, job scheduler, job descriptions, output queues, system values, job logs. Knowledgeable with multi factor authentication and authentication processes and protocols. TACACS+, Radius, LDAP, AD, authentication services, as well as PKI and token/certificate based authentication. Working knowledge of IBM i Privileged Elevation and Antivirus tools. Strong analytical skills. Project Management skills. Ability to handle highly confidential information in a strictly professional manner. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including nights, weekends, and holidays. Recommended One or more IBM i (iSeries) System Administrator certifications. One or more professional audit or security certifications such as: CompTia Security+, CISA, GSEC, or CISSP (or equivalent experience). Experience with one or more scripting languages. General knowledge of enterprise-level applications including ERP. General networking knowledge. Experience with tools such as: NMAp, NetCat and Enum, DNS, NTP and Citrix, TACACS, IDS, IPS and various SIEMS. Working knowledge of protocols and technologies such as TCP, UDP, SSL, FTP, SMTP, NetBIOS, DHCP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript and WML. Experience with performing vulnerability scans and assessments, as well as computer forensics. We’re looking for a highly motivated and talented analyst with a passion for vulnerability management. The ideal candidate will have experience supporting and managing vulnerability management activities in large enterprise environments. They will lead key vulnerability remediation initiatives that will minimize security weaknesses in the environment by working with the cybersecurity, IT infrastructure, and application teams to drive vulnerability remediation across the enterprise. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Logs and tracks discovered vulnerabilities within management and risk scoring platform. Builds and maintains processes to enable rapid distribution of vulnerability information to teams in a timely manner. Supports application and system vulnerability management processes and outcomes to ensure proactive remediation of risks. Triages remediation tasks and assign them to the system owner, tracking tasks accordingly. Facilitates routine vulnerability management review meetings with stakeholders to drive remediation efforts. Serves as a subject matter expert on application and system vulnerabilities and threat management. Utilizes and enforce the utilization of cybersecurity and vulnerability management procedures, tools, and internal reporting/tracking mechanisms. Participates in the development and maintenance of executive and team dashboards and/or regular reports to communicate department-specific cybersecurity risks and threats. Contributes to the design and implementation of our vulnerability management program that leverages a risk-based approach to address current vulnerabilities for the most impactful asset categories. Demonstrate in-depth knowledge and understanding of the global threat landscape, cybersecurity trends, emerging technologies, and the ability to relate them to the IT teams and application developers. Applies knowledge of operating systems, applications, and database vulnerability assessments (to include system configuration checks) on various Information Systems. Conducts research on current vulnerabilities and exploits using publicly available, trusted resources, and other finished vulnerability products. Effectively communicate security vulnerabilities and risks to issue owners and assist in remediation planning efforts where possible. Applies root cause analysis to identify and assess problems and key drivers of success. Developing potential conclusions from data with limited complexity. Helps maintain patch and vulnerability management best practices to protect against the exploitation of critical application and system vulnerabilities. Facilitates the application of risk treatments to vulnerabilities that cannot be remediated through business-as usual (e.g., systems that cannot be updated per regulatory restrictions, systems that require significant technology upgrades, etc.) Completes ad hoc metrics and reporting when requested. Maintains awareness of current business and industry trends relevant to the business and cybersecurity. Maintains regular contact with teams to manage remediation and advice as required. Consults on and helps build processes/testing triggers within other infrastructure teams. Participates in the evaluation and implementation of other new security solutions and technologies. Required 3-5 years’ experience in a vulnerability management role to include vulnerability management scanners and application scanning/testing tools and strategies. Working knowledge of Information Security best practices, policies, standards, and baselines, including industry standards and guidelines from ISO 27001/27002, NIST, CIS, and OWASP. Technical working experience/knowledge of operating systems, databases, web applications, middleware, and other computing devices/software components. Experience in computer software or computer networking. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication skills. Recommended Security certifications preferred (e.g., Security+, GCIA, GCIH, CISSP, CEH, CCSP, etc.) Ability to work with cross-business and cross-functional teams in a geographically distributed environment. Ability to work independently, as well as part of the team. Ability to conduct root cause analysis against vulnerabilities and determine feasible technical solutions. Ability to examine issues both strategically and analytically. Ability to work on multiple, simultaneous initiatives. Bachelor’s degree in Information Security, Computer Science, or equivalent experience. Experience in security testing of web application, mobile applications, APIs, Cloud hosted application, Containers and on-prem data centers. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Software Developers are responsible for designing, developing, and implementing complex enterprise software solutions. Individuals in this role collaborate closely with technical and non-technical roles such as data modelers, architects, business analysts, data stewards, and subject matter experts (SMEs) to provide design, technical analysis, development/configuration, testing, implementation, and support expertise representing the interest of the business across the enterprise. In this role, individuals participate in and lead design sessions and provide leadership for ongoing development efforts on various projects. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops or prototypes software modules at various levels of complexity, including but not limited to: service interfaces, process flows, service messages, SOA components, business logic, UI/UX, or data access logic. Develops efficient code in various development languages for enhancements and bug fixes. Designs, develops, tests, and deploys software solutions and process flows complying with standards, guidelines, and best practices. Executes against project plans and delivers assignments within scope, schedule, and budget. Creates, executes, and evaluates unit/integration tests. Adopts and adapts to newly approved technologies, programming languages, tools, and standards. Identifies, assesses, and formulates architectural impacts and solutions from business requirements. Collaborates to ensure application designs utilize appropriate patterns and standards. Analyzes user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints, including the ability to estimate work needed. Assesses functional and nonfunctional requirements and creates designs to meet both business and technical needs. Creates conceptual and detailed technical design documents. Provides implementation expertise contributing to rollback, post install, data migration, and other artifacts as required including creation of support plans. Adheres to security management practices and promotes established security standards. Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow, develops and evaluates options, and implements solutions. Required Minimum 2-5 years’ designing and/or developing with Java, J2EE, XML, SOAP, REST, and Web Services. Knowledge in Object-Oriented design architecture, analysis, UML modeling, Classic design patterns, J2EE patterns. Ability to manage priorities and timelines. Proven experience successfully implementing solutions for large cross platform projects. Good understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem resolution. Excellent verbal and written communication skills; including ability to work with all management levels. Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful. Database knowledge in a major RDBMS system such as DB2, MS SQL Server or Oracle. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. Recommended Java technology framework and tools including open source, JavaEE and Spring stack, MQ/messaging. The Software Developer is responsible for the installation, development, configuration, and operations of the API Gateway platform. The gateway is core to Costco integration strategy and works in support of API consumers and providers. Security configuration and management is hardened into all of these components. This developer role will be responsible for helping to document, design, and develop the service integration infrastructure and all of its capabilities. Additionally, this role will participate and provide leadership for ongoing development and maturity of API and service governance. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Maintains current knowledge of industry trends and standards around API management and security. Mentors members of the IT team and is an education resource for the integration team. Collaborates across teams to enhance and add new capabilities to our platform to support consumers and providers. Develops, configures, operates, and evolves the API Management platform (Apigee). Develops, evolves, hardens and maintains security infrastructure for service integration components. Helps define what a target end-state architecture will look like by leveraging Azure cloud solutions. Optimizes API and service proxy runtime components. Recommends and develops service integration standards, guidelines, and best practices. Works with Service Engineering to ensure that service designs utilize the appropriate patterns and standards Required Hands on experience with Azure. Experience with Azure, Azure DevopsProgrammability, Azure CLI, and Terraform. 3-5 years’ development experience using C#. 3-5 years’ development experience using Javascript. 3-5 years’ scripting to automate operational tasks. 1-2 years’ experience developing and deploying services or APIs. Experience working with SAML and OAUTH security. Ability to document standards, policies, installation guides. Recommended Hands-on experience with Apigee Edge, Datapower or other similar technologies. Hands-on experience with Splunk searching and reporting. Hands-on experience with scripting Jython/Python and Shell scripting. Hands-on experience with XSLT. Familiarity with application and service integration patterns. Familiarity with WebSphere Application Server, WebSphere Message Broker (IIB), and WebSphere MQ. Familiarity with WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSRR). Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. ROLE Provides daily support of the ServiceNow platform; including script development, configuration, integration, and administration. Participates in design and code reviews. Responds to requests and provides incident resolution. Creates process documentation for the team and provides internal training to team members. Generates reports and KPI analysis as needed. Required 1-3 years’ ServiceNow experience with knowledge of IT Service Management, IT Asset Management, Configuration Data Management, Governance, risk management, and compliance. 2-3 years’ experience with web technologies, including API's/CSS/XML/HTML/ReST/WebServices. Experience with the SDLC including Requirements Analysis, Design, Installation, Development, Testing (application code and user acceptance), and Deployment. Working knowledge of source code management tools. Ability to communicate technical information in business terms. Ability to work independently and multi-task. Ability to independently plan deliverables and coordinate with team-members. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem situations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Possesses a firm understanding of object-oriented concepts, especially as they pertain to JavaScript (ES5). Understands Costco Travel's IT processes and able to work closely with the business owners. Understands and adheres to Costco’s Mission Statement and Code of Ethics. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including 24x7 on call support as part of a scheduled rotation. Working knowledge of software design patterns. Working knowledge of test automation frameworks, such as ServiceNow ATF, Selenium or Cucumber. Experience as a ServiceNow Administrator, Developer or Implementation Specialist.Certified ServiceNow Admin (Advanced). jobTitle: Software Development Engineer in Test – Performance-Costco Travel
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale , the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers” . Costco Travel is seeking a Software Design Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our Engineering Productivity Team. This role will be responsible for designing and architecting the performance framework, infrastructure, and tools to support the diverse quality organization. The successful candidate will be a technical leader with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, who work collaboratively with the scrum teams to assure the highest member service experience. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world , simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops performance test scripts, executes tests, benchmarks to previous executions, analyzes, and reports results. Drills down and identifies the root cause of performance degradations in the applications. Collaborates with the development team on the resolution of issues that negatively impact performance to help build a scalable and robust product. Configures, runs, and monitors automated performance testing jobs. Troubleshoots issues across the entire stack of hardware, software, application, and network. Researches industry trends and technologies, and promotes adoption of best-in-class tools and technologies. Required 5+ years’ experience in performance testing large scale web applications Strong understanding of performance scripting and execution using JMeter and other performance testing tools Ability to perform profile/baseline, load, and stress testing Knowledge of application monitoring tools and usage for non-functional testing such as Splunk, Dynatrace, etc. Good understanding of TCP/IP networking (proxies, firewalls, etc.) and common web technologies (HTTP, REST, Web Services, XML/XPath, etc.). Experience with typical multi-tier application architecture (presentation, logic, data). Proactive and collaborative attitude, strong problem solving and decision-making skills. Proven ability to drill down into results and complete deep-dive root-cause analysis. Knowledge of database servers, web servers, application servers, and load balancer. Proficient with the following tools: Jenkins, SoapUI, Fiddler, Nessus, JVM & SQL Server. Experience working with architects, developers, and QA across multiple teams. Recommended CI/CD and DevOps experience. Familiarity with Docker, K8s and/or Jenkins DSL. Familiarity with mocking solutions like Wiremock. Tomcat/Apache knowledge Travel industry knowledge Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a close team environment. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Pay Ranges We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits — medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, commuter benefits, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan, SmartDollar financial wellness program, to eligible employees.

The individual in this role will coach and mentor engineers and developers to help them progress their technical knowledge and careers. Typical activities include leading requirements analysis, solution design, technical development, and process improvement coupled with the ability to drive efforts and solution improvements effectively. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Oversees the technical design and development of in-house travel booking web applications based on the gathered requirements for multiple development teams. Leads and collaborates in planning, decomposing, and estimating new delivery work. Ensures solutions are secure, durable, scalable, flexible, and accessible; and proactively mitigates against production support issues. Demonstrates technical leadership to manage and provide multiple technical solutions; performs code reviews; establishes and enforces coding guidelines and best practices. Initiates and facilitates team meetings to socialize technical ideas; encourages a culture of technical excellence within the organization and identifies opportunities for adopting innovation . Understands implications of design and implementation choices and provides solutions. Manages concurrent projects and multiple competing priorities. Builds and maintains strong working relationships with team members. Provides coaching and mentoring to team members; shares information through documentation, workshops, etc. to drive operational efficiencies and technical growth within the team. Understands and escalates technical challenges with options and recommendations. Required Bachelor's degree, or the equivalent, in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. 5+ years’ of experience with design and development of client/server and/or web based applications. 4+ years’ of experience with core Java, Java EE technologies (Servlet and JSP). 4+ years’ of experience working with relational databases (preferably MS-SQL Server and T-SQL). Good understanding and experience with SOAP and/or REST based Web services. Demonstrated track record of driving high-quality software design/implementation to production. Must be a quick learner with the ability to learn and incorporate new technologies and concepts. Self-motivated, dedicated, and driven to succeed. Able to easily shift focus with changing priorities. Good debugging, troubleshooting, and problem solving skills. Excellent communication, collaboration, analytical, and problem solving skills. In this role the Solution Architect will convert business requirements into an architecture and design that can become the blueprint for the solution being created to solve an identiified business problem. The conversion is based upon the requirements and objectives of the business and guided by the strategies, design patterns, and best practices established by the Enterprise Architecture group. The Solution Architect defines the end-to-end architecture and ensures the detailed design and implemented solutions are consistent with the overall architure. The Solution Architect position is considered a leadership position, and the selected candidate will be able to demonstrate that they are strong in driving issues, decisions, initiatives to completion, and be adept at soft skills such as leadership, teaming, collaboration, mentorship, governance, advocacy, ability to compromise, and willingness to take a strong stand where necessary. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Solution Planning Partners with Enterprise Architecture to develop strategies and standards for eCommerce Order Management. Researches and understands technical requirements, trends, and strategies for eCommerce Order Management. Assesses all project information to understand the scope, the current IT and business environment, objectives and priorities. Defines and documents the proposed, high-level solution, including the use of Commercial Off The Shelf (COTS) packages to create eCommerce Order Management solutions. Analyzes technical risks and advises on risk mitigation strategies. Identifies teams needed based on the proposed solution. Works with the Project Manager, Engineer and Functional/Business Analyst to develop a high-level project schedule, resource plan for the project, and project costs. Solution Delivery Responsible for the technical content (architecture and design), integrity and quality of the solution. Accountable for the delivery of the solution as specified (by requirements and architecture). Identifies new technologies and development tools as required. Analyzes available assets (frameworks, reference architectures, etc.) to bridge the gap between the as-is architecture and the to-be architecture. Works with the Business Analyst to define use cases, including alternate flows as needed. Defines system use cases and requirements. Evaluates non-functional requirements for testability and technical acceptance criteria. Addresses compliance requirements such as Payment Card Industry (PCI), Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA), Personally Identifiable Information (PII), and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX). Creates high-level models that guide solution architecture. Including component, context, data-flow security, data, services, infrastructure, deployment and integration viewpoints. Refines those high-level models based on ever-changing requirements. Creates transitional architecture views as part of solution design. Adheres to IT standards. Defines and documents the actions needed to close architecture gaps in support of business objectives. Participates in reviews of the designs, prototypes and other technical deliverables to ensure they fulfill requirements and meet standards. Clearly and accurately documents architectural decisions for consumption by Order Management teams Proven ability to estimate development effort. Required Experience in retail, and eCommerce 10+ years’ professional Information Technology experience in solutioning, designing, developing, and delivering computer systems. 3+ years’ technical team leadership experience. 3+ years’ hands-on solutions architecture experience with COTS package integration experience. Proven skills in leadership, relationship building, negotiation, collaboration, advocacy, governance, and consensus building. Knowledge of IT Application architecture, Design methodologies across multiple platforms. Excellent verbal and written communication skills (facilitation, negotiation, conflict resolution) at all levels. Ability to translate technical ideas/designs to multiple audiences, including Executives. Thorough understanding of and experience with multiple SDLC methods such as waterfall, SCRUM, and/or Agile. Team player. Proven ability to work effectively within a large organization that operates using a matrix organization. Ability to communicate trade-offs and transactional states with technical and business teams. Ability to make architecture changes in a dynamic Agile environment. Recommended Experience working in and leading the design of architectures for ERP, IBM Sterling, and other Order Management software, preferably Java or .Net/C# based. Experience in leading the implementation of Order Management, ecommerce and ERP systems. Solution Architecture Professional Certification (e.g., IASA CITA-F, CITA-A or higher). Experiencing using TOGAF as an architecture design methodology. Proficient in service oriented architecture (SOA), messaging, object-oriented programming concepts, multi-tiered distributed component based technology, legacy infrastructure platforms and technologies, and enterprise service bus. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. The IT Management Platform Principal Solution Architect - ServiceNow is a key member responsible for the architecture, design, development, configuration, implementation, and testing of Costco’s ServiceNow platform. This role will engage in projects, working with other platform support engineers, architects, software developers, and subject matter experts in the creation of architecture, process, and governance documentation for the platform. The IT Management Platform Architect is accountable for providing technical leadership within the team, including the design and implementation of a formal development, documentation, and code review processes. This role is responsible for overseeing the overall performance and availability of the ServiceNow platform at Costco. The IT Management Platform Architect will: provide analysis of problems while working toward solutions to technical issues; deploy new releases and/or enhancements; maintain and support the platform’s operational functions; and provide system architecture diagrams and documentation. The successful candidate will be part of a team responsible for the vision and future roadmap of the ServiceNow platform at Costco. The Architect must be able to act with a sense of urgency and adapt to changing priorities. Mentoring, coaching and training of team resources is also a responsibility of this role. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops solutions to Costco IT business problems that impact the IT Management platform and collaborates with Enterprise Architecture to ensure solution alignment with strategic discretion. Provides technical oversight of IT Management platform (currently ServiceNow); including scripting, configuration, integrations, and administration. Collaborates with cross-functional systems on product roadmap and architectural diagrams. Defines the technical standards and guidelines of the broader delivery and operations teams. Determines scope, estimates work effort and determines duration of development activities. Designs solutions to meet business requirements. Analyzes and translates business information and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint that outlines solutions to achieve complex business objectives. Drives solid instance health by reviewing and guiding the remediation of configurations that do not align to ServiceNow best practices. Specifies, Designs, and maintains API and data integration solutions between ServiceNow and partner systems. Performs ServiceNow Discovery configuration, customization, implementation, and mid-server architecture. Co-teams with the Technical Architect to produce a technical specification for custom development and systems integration requirements. Engages with customer enterprise architects to position ServiceNow as the digital transformation platform integrated with the core systems. Participates in the global planning and support of Costco’s ServiceNow implementations. Monitors health and usage of the IT Management platform. Designs, deploys, and participates in Global Governance processes such as design and code reviews. Responds to Service Requests and provides incident resolution. Designs and implements technical documentation processes for the team and provides internal training to team members. Establishes and manages technical governance processes. Generates reports and KPI analysis as needed. Understands Costco's ITSM, ITBM, ITOM and GRC processes, and works closely with the process team. Understands and adheres to Costco’s Mission Statement and Code of Ethics. Required 5+ years large program experience leading architecture and design. Enterprise Architect role and relevant experience. Enterprise Architect certification (Togaf, IT4IT, etc.) 5+ years of experience implementing ITSM and ITOM processes and solutions. Experienced in CMDB implementations. 3+ years’ experience with web technologies including API’s / CSS / XML / HTML / Web Services. Working knowledge of JavaScript design and development. Experience with Angular or similar Javascript frameworks. 3+ year experience in Rest Web Services development and integration. Experience with Agile, Scrum and SDLC including Requirements Analysis, Design, Installation, Development, Testing (application code and user acceptance), and Deployment. Knowledgeable on ServiceNow Security Best Practices and Procedures. Ability to communicate technical information in business terms. Demonstrated ability to own and resolve complex technical issues. Ability to work independently and multi-task. Strong project management skills; experience utilizing project management tools and formal methodology. Ability to independently plan deliverables and coordinate with team-members. Ability to work closely with other departments on projects and problem resolution, actively and effectively participate in technical discussions. Excellent trouble-shooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem situations. Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills to create and present documentation or proposals for projects/tasks. Prior experience mentoring and providing technical leadership. Recommended 5+ years’ experience as a ServiceNow Architect, Administrator, Developer, or Implementation Specialist. ITIL certification. Certified ServiceNow Admin (Advanced). Experience developing JavaScript applications using Angular. Understanding of LDAP and/or Active Directory Environment. Experience with Unix, Linux, Windows server administration and virtualization (VMWare). Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, or Related Field or equivalent work experience. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The role of every Cybersecurity Operations team member is to support the overarching values and business goals of Costco Wholesale as they relate to meeting legal, ethical, and regulatory obligations; protecting members’ and employees’ privacy; and maintaining a security technology environment for our operations. This Solution Architect position is mission-critical and will be a key member of the Cybersecurity Operations team that will design and develop cyber defense operations, services, programs, and projects with the focus of providing scalable, highly available, and efficient solutions and services to the other various Information Security and Compliance teams. The Solution Architect is responsible for developing dynamically scalable, available, fault-tolerant, and reliable cyber security designs-on premise and in the Cloud, utilizing best practice security architecture frameworks and methodologies. The successful candidate will be a thoughtful problem solver with excellent communication skills. Additionally, this position serves as an internal trusted advisor providing security consulting services across multiple departments, teams, and other IT leaders to provide advice on security and assist with compensating control alternatives where security requirements cannot be met. Integrates and extensively collaborates with Enterprise Architecture, Cloud, Infrastructure, and International teams to move quickly and accurately; promote and foster collaboration and standardization across multiple internal technology groups based on common technology interests and priorities. Establishes and maintains a repository of reference architectures, deployment best practices, and lessons learned to drive efficient business development initiatives. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Participates in Security Governance planning, decisions, and coordination. Architects and designs cloud IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS solutions and services. Analyzes technical risks and advises on risk mitigation strategies. Collaborates with Stakeholders such as Engineers, technical application leads, Project Managers, and Functional/Business Analysts to develop a high-level schedule and resource plan for projects. Applies technical knowledge and customer insights to create a modernization roadmap. Identifies security gaps that expose Costco to potential exploits, and develops short and long term prioritized solutions and services to address those gaps, ensures management is apprised of the risk in a timely manner. Collaborates with other Architects in developing complex end-to-end Enterprise solutions. Determines security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements. Creates comprehensive security requirements documenting certifications, compliance, and privacy requirements prior to product release. Creates and maintains security artifacts such as Conceptual Solution Architecture, System Diagrams, Network Diagrams, Application Diagrams, Logical data and process flow diagrams, Total Cost Of Ownership Analysis, Technology Impact Analysis, roadmaps, whitepapers, position papers, etc. Collaborates with Enterprise Architecture, Architects, and other stakeholders to ensure security by design. Participates and leads in team activities and team planning to improve team skills, awareness, and quality of work. Continues personal growth in technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Required A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field, or a minimum of 5 years’ information systems security experience. 3+ years’ in a Security Engineering role. Extensive knowledge in the following areas: Network Security, Cloud Security and Cloud Networking, Data Security, and Security Monitoring, SOC ops. Demonstrated ability to work in agile environments focused on fast and continual value delivery. Ability to work effectively, independent of assistance or supervision. Demonstrate a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Innovative, creative, and highly responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Demonstrate a high level of verbal and written communication skills. Ability to handle highly confidential information in a strictly professional and ethical manner. Ability to communicate to executives, auditors, end-users, and engineers, using appropriate language, examples, and tone. Recommended One or more professional certifications such as CCNA, GSEC, CISA, CISM, or CISSP. Experience creating and maintaining Conceptual Solution Architecture artifacts. Experience creating and maintaining Security Policies, Standards, and Procedures. Experience with ITILv2/v3 processes such as Service Support, Service Delivery, or Continual Service Improvement. Experience with Regulatory Compliance and industry standards, such as HIPAA, SOX, and PCI. Experience in a DevOps or DevSecOps environment. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Site Reliability Services is tasked to ensure industry leading performance across all channels of costco.com, including desktop and mobile. The Solution Architect owns the performance goals of all the products and platform services that are required for the success of costco.com, the Costco Android app, and Costco iOS app, and support velocity, efficiency, and quality assurance for the various technical initiatives. The Solution Architect will be hyper focused on improving the performance and stability of Costco’s web properties, and provide tools, checklists, and automation required for empowering developers, QA, SRE, Engineering, and architecture teams to track and optimize desktop and mobile performance incessantly. This is a technical lead role with an emphasis on strong coaching, mentoring, and communication skills across the organization to drive continuous improvement in reliability engineering aspects. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Defines and monitors key performance objectives and Indicators to ensure performance, efficiency, and reliability across all systems and platforms. Facilitates and conducts retrospectives; and drives their implementation. Partners with software engineers and technology leadership to establish performance strategy, and deliver against those expectations. Provides expertise in high performance management patterns and architectures. Implements and optimizes tooling for the Development and Ops teams to improve efficiency, velocity, and stability. Designs and implements solutions to evaluate and improve performance and scalability of systems, infrastructure, interfaces, applications, and platforms. Architects solutions for micro-services to do self-service performance and scalability evaluation. Leads root causes for performance and scalability issues; and contributes to product code to alleviate these issues. Optimizes sizing of deployed component instances for cost optimization. Develops performance and scale test plans based on deep understanding of domain, architecture, and product tech stack. Designs and implements relevant simulators to ingest large scale data. Designs, implements, and maintains test frameworks. Supports extended teams in troubleshooting problems, such as system malfunctions. Provides feedback, proposes solutions, and suggests improvements. Designs, Codes, Tests, and Delivers software to automate and realize the potential of self-healing architectures. Engages with Architects and Design Authorities across multiple areas to ensure end to end performance and scalability. Participates in Architecture and Engineering forums; performs design reviews. Participates in Development Modernization and adoption of emerging/modern technologies. Aligns with the security standards and guidelines to ensure systems are secure and protected. Collaborates across teams and domains to work through performance/power/cost trade-offs. Works on the innovation of the integration platform including cloud. Leads technical analysis/designs in preparation for the components and services to be developed. Participates and leads in team activities and team planning in regards to improving team skills, awareness, and quality of work. Continues personal growth in the areas of technology, business knowledge, and Costco policies and platforms. Required Minimum of 7 years’ in an engineering and architectural role. 5+ years’ proven experience in software engineering - focusing on performance, scale. 2+ years’ experience leading and mentoring scale/performance engineers. Experience in managing performance and integration of Digital Commerce environments, especially WebSphere Commerce with systems/services, such as Payment gateways, Order Management, Content Management systems, User generated content, Google Analytics, Geo Location service, etc. Experience with Cloud and on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services and machine data technologies, such as Datadog, Dynatrace, Grafana, AppDynamics, Splunk, ITRS Geneos. Strong understanding of OS fundamentals (AIX/ Linux/ Windows). Proven expertise in solving OS level performance issues. Advanced knowledge of Akamai or other CDN solutions. Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack, including web and mobile front end, caching layers, CDN and memory, file system, and relational databases. Experience with RUM tools and synthetic testing. Experience in defining rollout and backout strategies, and risk mitigation plans for software deployment. Skilled in both the art and science of benchmark creation and measurement and modeling of system behavior under load. Ability to find the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Passionate to optimize the performance bottlenecks and improve the services. Experience in tackling problems of load, scale, and optimizations of sophisticated large-scale deployments. Strong understanding of cloud-scale and micro/macro-services architecture. Experience with Azure tools, such as Terraform; Ansible is a plus. Ability to work effectively independent of assistance or supervision. Able to demonstrate a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive, with a strong sense of urgency. Willing to share knowledge and assist others in understanding technical and business topics. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business, including evenings, weekends, and holidays. Able to demonstrate a high level of verbal and written communication skills. Recommended Retail or E-commerce experience beneficial. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume Last two performance reviews Attendance records for current year (Do not include absences covered by paid sick/personal time, FMLA or other protected absences.) California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

An IT Compliance Engineer is a key member of the Information Security Compliance team, reporting to the Manager of Security Compliance. This position is focused on SOX compliance, working across Costco Wholesale globally to ensure and deliver support to our annual SOX audit and to work with our business and technology partners to improve our security and SOX control environment overall. The SOX Compliance Engineer will work closely with Information Security and IT leadership, management, and team members to build and maintain a strong SOX compliance program, while ensuring ongoing delivery on our SOX compliance and control obligations. If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide BEST companies “to work for”, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Serves as a trusted advisor and subject matter expert for ITGCs and SOX compliance to the business. Works directly with our business and technology partners to understand changes to the control environment. Drives necessary system and process updates; works in tandem with business and technology teams to maintain ongoing compliance and ensures new requirements are embedded upfront to enable compliance by design. Understands and applies established SOX scoping criteria into decision making. Obtains and reviews evidence of compliance to support technical or complex requirements. Supports the business in managing audit requirements. Manages and communicates key changes and updates to management and internal audit. Facilitates interaction between the business and Costco’s auditors. Stays current with new and evolving security topics and technologies via formal training and self-directed education. Shares knowledge and experiences with less experienced staff to help grow the team talent bench through training and mentoring. Required 7+ years’ IT or technical compliance experience; SOX IT compliance experience preferred A background in auditing SAP, Azure, iSeries, or other IT controls, along with automated and business process controls Strong understanding of SOX and other compliance requirements that may impact the business. Strong communication and relationship skills, especially the ability to understand and articulate advanced technical topics and build consensus among partners and management. Demonstrates a positive attitude, is self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Able to work well under stress and handle crisis situations professionally. Recommended Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Information Technology or Computer Science preferred, or equivalent experience Ability to propose creative solutions to successfully remediate identified compliance issues. Documentation and presentation skills catering to executive leadership and a diverse technical and business audience. Costco is looking for a dedicated and experienced Software Design Engineer in Test (SDET) to join its e-commerce quality team to help us elevate our business to the next level, while having fun learning new technologies and solving complex problems for our members. The SDET will be responsible to ensure Costco members have the best possible experience purchasing products on Costco websites, including Order Management systems, and supporting e-commerce business applications. The ideal candidate will be a highly seasoned SDET with a track record of delivering quality mobile software solutions and the ability to apply your experience to new areas or have significant experience testing large scale, multi-system integrated applications in an e-commerce system. Your experience will demonstrate that you have a solid understanding of Quality Assurance best practices, know where and when to apply them, and know when flexibility within those guidelines is acceptable. The candidate must have a clear understanding of the software development methodologies and will have consistently delivered high quality software solutions using various methodologies. The candidate will demonstrate solid technical skills which has served them to find, troubleshoot and research problems and issues and bring them to closer. They will proficiently create and leverage automation as one of the many tools in their QA toolkit. Strong communication and interpersonal skills is a must, with ability to communicate with other SDET team members, developers, project managers and various levels of management. They must be able to effectively manage their time and deliverables and be able to work under pressure, as needed, while still delivering on schedule. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Creates and owns review and execution of project test plans, test cases, automation and all QA-related collateral and documentation for a feature or product area. Provides accurate estimates for projects, including QA resourcing and testing schedules. Executes testing directly and/or leveraging offshore resources while ensuring accurate results, identifying failure patterns and supports bug triage processes to bring issues to closure. Mentors junior team members. Creates and leverages automation during all phases of the test process using Selenium,Java and XCTest. Collaborates with onshore, offshore and project team members as needed for project success. Works with business customers and analysts to understand and clarify requirements and stories as needed. Required Minimum 7 years’ software quality assurance experience with mobile devices. Minimum 4 years’ functional and back-end testing of eCommerce websites or comparable complex systems. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience using industry standard software QA tools including Selenium, Java, XCTest. Minimum 4 years’ hands-on experience writing automation to drive end to end and API test scenarios. Experience with at least one database technology, Oracle, MS SQL Server or DB2 and ability to write basic SQL queries. Strong knowledge of SDLC and SQA methodology as well as experience testing on an Agile team. Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem solving skills. Excellent test resource planning and test scheduling skills. Ability to produce effective software test plans and test cases. Proven ability to create project testing estimates and deliver on time and on quality. High level understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts. Ability to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Strong communication and leadership skills with ability to communicate with all levels of the organization from senior management down to staff level. Strong work ethic, positive attitude and excellent collaboration skills. Recommended Experience with iSeries/AS400 a plus. Understanding of web services, SOAP, REST and XML concepts and technologies. Database knowledge in a major RDBMS system such as DB2, MS SQL Server or Oracle. Solid understanding of build tools and software configuration management standards. The Principal System Analyst will join the SAP Linux team at Costco, participating in the administration of the Red Hat/Suse Linux environments, integration of licensed and/or OEM software packages, as well as all strategic and tactical planning of the environment required to meet Costco-specific business needs. The individual filling this role will also be expected to deliver excellent customer service and to interact in a highly effective manner with other team members and management. Costco is looking for a creative individual who can effectively manage projects and multiple tasks to meet business objectives. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Implements and maintains enterprise-class Red Hat | SUSE Linux Unix solutions that support the enterprise SAP Landscape. Designs and implements a toolset that simplifies provisioning and supports on premises and on Azure. Works closely with SAP Application teams to create a continuous integration pipeline focused on automation. Works closely with SAP Application and Database administrators to standardize and automate deployments. Plans and executes major platform software and operating system upgrades and maintenance across a highly virtualized environment. Manages the planning, implementation, and upgrade of OEM packages. Manages system resources to assure maximum system performance and appropriate additional capacity for peak periods and growth. Plans, configures, and implements features on the Red Hat | SUSE Linux platforms that improve availability, response time, and monitoring of key system metrics. Collaborates with the Enterprise Linux team to design and review decision documents. Provides support to the user community using incident and problem management tools, email, and voicemail. Serves as a mentor and provides guidance and training to other team members and I.S. personnel. Creates and maintains detailed up-to-date technical documentation. Required IT experience and Red Hat Linux experience in an enterprise environment. Experience with a diverse range of orchestration suites and tools, including, but not limited to: Puppet Enterprise, HP Operations Orchestration, GitLab, GitHub, Terraform, Ansible. Demonstrated ability with programming and scripting languages including, but not limited to, Python, Powershell, and shell scripting. Experienced in working closely with development teams to define and optimize CI/CD pipeline processes. Proven ability to perform custom RPM builds. Strong Cloud experience in Azure. Red Hat Certified Engineer (RHCE) or SUSE certification or higher certification or equivalent engineering experience. Experience with Satellite, preferably 6.0 and newer. Experience developing and documenting standard operating procedures and best practices in a technical repository. Demonstrated ability in Systems Management and Administration (applying fixes, loading the OS, creating Gold images, resolving system issues, working with suppliers to resolve issues, etc.). Strong scripting language expertise. Strong focus on design, build, deployment, security, system hardening, and securing services. Proven expertise in Performance Tuning and Capacity Planning. Understanding of Configuration Management and Change Management Best Practices. Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem situations. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Proven ability to partner with others in the area or company to deliver quality solutions. Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision. Self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail-oriented. Able to work well under pressure and handle crisis situations professionally. Strong experience with services in Enterprise – Active Directory, DNS, Apache, Tomcat. Strong understanding of Kerberos, cross-realm authentication, and Kerberized services. Proven experience reviewing and comparing multiple platform options for a given application and collaborating with appropriate teams to choose the right platform. Available for periodic off-hours work, including weekends and holidays and be able to provide 24x7 on-call support as necessary. Recommended BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent formal training and experience. 8+ years’ IT experience and 6+ years’ of Red Hat Linux experience in an enterprise environment. Experience with VMWare and virtualized environments. Willingness to mentor others team members. Working knowledge of Python scripting language.
