Available for periodic off-hours work, including weekends and holidays and be able to provide 24x7 on-call support as necessary. Recommended BS degree in Computer Science or equivalent formal training and experience. 8+ years’ IT experience and 6+ years’ of Red Hat Linux experience in an enterprise environment. Experience with VMWare and virtualized environments. Willingness to mentor others team members. Working knowledge of Python scripting language. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Site Reliability Services supports the overarching values and business of Costco's ECommerce and is tasked to ensure production readiness that is aligned to the service level objectives defined. The team specializes in reliability, scalability and performance characteristics of our platforms and services. The SRE team works together with architects, developers, engineering teams, security and other vendor partners to address unique technical challenges through comprehensive solutions while taking into account system/service uptime, reliability, and maintainability. As an Architect for the Costco ECommerce SRE team, you will be evangelizing an ideal high performance UI architecture – one that is focused on performance and meets the expectations of our members and customers. Reporting to the Director, SRE, you are an experienced enterprise level front-end developer with the talent to deliver robust (quality, reliability, performance and scalability) experiences to our users under tight timelines. You are a REACT/JavaScript/REST/XHR/CSS/HTML expert who follows emerging Web front-end technologies with the maturity to know when/how to adopt them into a client facing product for engaged and passionate clients. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Focuses on site performance, site security, third party integrations, and the planning and discovery process as an integral member of a SRE team. Benchmarks and evolves strategy and approach for front end performance for large web commerce sites. Owns and evolves the performance aspects of the front-end architecture of Costco.com website, Costco Android and iOS apps and contributes to the architectural roadmap. Collaborates with other solution architects, system architects, engineering, design, and product management teams to drive core programmatic design decisions and apply modern web frameworks on top of an existing highly scalable and flexible back end. Evangelizes best practices and guides team members in applying best front end performance in a hands-on development environment. Delivers the product roadmap with the team as an individual contributor and fully owns the technical backlog for front end performance. Demonstrates our values of passion for world class web experience. Designs and executes system strategies that ensure the scalability and the elasticity of the web commerce infrastructure. Defines non-functional requirements for achieving and enhancing availability, performance, scalability, security and resiliency for a given set of products within a complex ecosystem, Evaluates the impact of code on performance, scalability and resiliency of the production infrastructure; provide advice and partner with development and operations teams to ensure production readiness and performance. Defines and monitors key Service Level Objectives and Indicators to ensure efficiency and reliability across all systems. Facilitates and conducts retrospectives, and drives their implementation. Partners with software engineers and technology leadership to establish operational strategy and then deliver against those expectations. Provides expertise in zero downtime deployments, best incident management practices, and operational excellence. Implements and optimizes tooling for the Development and Ops teams to improve efficiency, velocity, and stability. Designs and implements solutions to evaluate and improve performance and scalability of systems, infrastructure, interfaces, applications and platforms. Architects solutions for micro services to do self-service performance and scalability evaluation. Leads root causes for performance and scalability issues and contributes to product code to alleviate these issues. Optimizes sizing of deployed component instances for cost optimization. Develops performance and scale test plans based on deep understanding of domain, architecture and product tech stack. Designs and implements relevant simulators to ingest large scale data. Designs, implements and maintains test frameworks. Supports extended teams in troubleshooting problems, such as system malfunctions. Provides feedback, proposes solutions and suggests improvements. Designs, codes, tests and delivers software to automate and realize the potential of self-healing architectures. Engages with Architects and Design Authorities across multiple areas to ensure end to end performance and scalability. Excellent understanding of Scalability processes and techniques. Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business. Required 4+ years’ in an engineering and architectural role. 3+ years’ proven experience in software engineering, focusing on performance, scale. Significant experience in architecting and designing solutions that utilize software and client-side design best practices. Extensive experience with various client-side technologies like JavaScript, REST, XHR, HTML/HTML5, and CSS (Sass/Less). Solid experience with React.js (AngularJS or similar ok), node.js, libraries (Underscore, etc.), design patterns, tools (Webpack, npm, etc.), cross-browser compatibility, unit testing, and performance optimization. Strong experience in managing performance engineering of web components, android and iOS apps. Experience with implementing marketing pixels, tag management software, data collection best practices, and current industry standards for web and mobile apps. Experience in managing performance and integration of Digital Commerce environments, (especially, WebSphere Commerce with systems/services such as Payment gateways, Order Management, Content Management systems, User generated content, Google Analytics, Geo Location service, etc.). Experience with Cloud and on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services and machine data technologies (Datadog, Dynatrace, Grafana, AppDynamics, Splunk, ITRS Geneos). Strong understanding of OS fundamentals (AIX/ Linux/ Windows).Proven expertise in solving OS level performance issues. Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack, including web and mobile front end, caching layers, CDN and memory, file system, and relational databases. Experience with RUM tools and synthetic testing. Ability to find the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Passionate to optimize the performance bottlenecks and improve the services. Experience in tackling problems of load, scale, and optimizations of sophisticated large-scale deployments. Experience in J2EE/WebSphere infrastructure architecture. (N-Tier architectures, high availability, scalability and performance). Experience in J2EE/WebSphere application architecture. (Design and development of software applications based on J2EE technologies and related best practices). Hands-on experience in administering high availability and high performance environments, as well as managing large-scale deployments of traffic-heavy applications. A strong ability to design and execute cutting

jobTitle: System Architect - eCommerce Platform and Products
jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Site Reliability Services supports the overarching values and business of Costco's eCommerce and is tasked to ensure production readiness that is aligned to the service level objectives defined . The team specializes in reliability, scalability, and performance characteristics of our platforms and services. The SRE team works together with architects, developers, engineering teams, security, and other supplier partners to address unique technical challenges through comprehensive solutions while taking into account system/service uptime, reliability, and maintainability. Costco is looking for a dedicated and experienced System Architect in designing and deploying applications in HCL Websphere commerce stack and who can build server clusters, API and microservices, including critical production environments powered by AIX infrastructure. This role will partner with full stack engineers, solution architects, and quality engineers to design and deploy for availability, performance, and scalability of applications and will ensure that the service delivery pipeline, monitoring, and health checks are fully automated. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs and executes system strategies that ensure the scalability and the elasticity of the web commerce infrastructure. Designs and executes system strategies that ensure the scalability, availability, Performance, and the elasticity of the infrastructure both on premise as well as in hybrid cloud (Azure) environments. Evaluates the impact of code on performance, scalability, and resiliency of the production infrastructure; provides advice and partners with development and operations teams to ensure production readiness and performance. Defines Caching schemes and CDN policies to optimize the customer experience across desktop and mobile platforms. Administers high availability and high performance environments, as well as manages large-scale deployments of traffic-heavy applications. Defines and monitors key Service Level Objectives and Indicators to ensure efficiency and reliability across all systems. Facilitates and conducts retrospectives, and drives their implementation. Partners with software engineers and technology leadership to establish operational strategy and then delivers against those expectations. Provides expertise in zero downtime deployments, best incident management practices, and operational excellence. Implements and optimizes tooling for the Development and Ops teams to improve efficiency, velocity, and stability. Designs and implements solutions to evaluate and improve performance and scalability of systems, infrastructure, interfaces, applications, and platforms. Architects solutions for microservices to do self-service performance and scalability evaluation. Leads root causes for performance and scalability issues and contributes to product code to alleviate these issues. Optimizes sizing of deployed component instances for cost optimization. Develops performance and scale test plans based on deep understanding of domain, architecture and product tech stack. Designs and implements relevant simulators to ingest large scale data. Designs, implements, and maintains test frameworks. Supports extended teams in troubleshooting problems, such as system malfunctions. Provides feedback, proposes solutions, and suggests improvements. Designs, Codes, Tests, and Delivers software to automate and realize the potential of self-healing architectures. Engages with Architects and Design Authorities across multiple areas to ensure end to end performance and scalability. Designs and executes cutting edge system testing strategies (smoke tests, performance/load tests, regression tests, capacity tests). Required 4 years’ in an engineering and architectural role. 3+ years’ proven experience in software engineering, focusing on performance, scale in on-premises, and cloud environments (Azure). Experience in managing performance and integration of Digital Commerce environments, (especially, WebSphere Commerce with systems/services such as Payment gateways, Order Management, Content Management systems, User generated content, Google Analytics, Geo Location service, etc). Experience with distributed Cache technologies such as Redis and CDN such as Akamai to enable highly optimized end user experience on mobile and desktop form factors. . Experience with Cloud and on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services and machine data technologies (Datadog, Dynatrace, Grafana, AppDynamics, Splunk, ITRS Geneos). Strong understanding of OS fundamentals (AIX/ Linux/ Windows). Proven expertise in solving OS level performance issues. Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack, including web and mobile front end, caching layers, CDN, and memory, file system, and relational databases. Experience with RUM tools and synthetic testing. Ability to find the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Passionate to optimize the performance bottlenecks and improve the services. Experience in tackling problems of load, scale, and optimizations of sophisticated large-scale deployments. J2EE/WebSphere infrastructure architecture. N-Tier architectures, high availability, scalability, and performance. J2EE/WebSphere application architecture. Ability to design and developm software applications based on J2EE technologies and related best practices. WebSphere Application Server (WAS), WAS ND, WebSphere Commerce Server (WCS), WebSphere eXtreme Scale (WXS), WebSphere Process Server (WPS), WebSphere Business Monitor (WBM), WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSSR), administration, configuration, performance tuning, security, monitoring, deployment, testing and troubleshooting. jobDescription: This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. Site Reliability Services supports the overarching values and business of Costco's eCommerce and is tasked to ensure production readiness that is aligned to the service level objectives defined . The team specializes in reliability, scalability, and performance characteristics of our platforms and services. The SRE team works together with architects, developers, engineering teams, security, and other supplier partners to address unique technical challenges through comprehensive solutions while taking into account system/service uptime, reliability, and maintainability. Costco is looking for a dedicated and experienced System Architect in designing and deploying applications in HCL Websphere commerce stack and who can build server clusters, API and microservices, including critical production environments powered by AIX infrastructure. This role will partner with full stack engineers, solution architects, and quality engineers to design and deploy for availability, performance, and scalability of applications and will ensure that the service delivery pipeline, monitoring, and health checks are fully automated. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Designs and executes system strategies that ensure the scalability and the elasticity of the web commerce infrastructure. Designs and executes system strategies that ensure the scalability, availability, Performance, and the elasticity of the infrastructure both on premise as well as in hybrid cloud (Azure) environments. Evaluates the impact of code on performance, scalability, and resiliency of the production infrastructure; provides advice and partners with development and operations teams to ensure production readiness and performance. Defines Caching schemes and CDN policies to optimize the customer experience across desktop and mobile platforms. Administers high availability and high performance environments, as well as manages large-scale deployments of traffic-heavy applications. Defines and monitors key Service Level Objectives and Indicators to ensure efficiency and reliability across all systems. Facilitates and conducts retrospectives, and drives their implementation. Partners with software engineers and technology leadership to establish operational strategy and then delivers against those expectations. Provides expertise in zero downtime deployments, best incident management practices, and operational excellence. Implements and optimizes tooling for the Development and Ops teams to improve efficiency, velocity, and stability. Designs and implements solutions to evaluate and improve performance and scalability of systems, infrastructure, interfaces, applications, and platforms. Architects solutions for microservices to do self-service performance and scalability evaluation. Leads root causes for performance and scalability issues and contributes to product code to alleviate these issues. Optimizes sizing of deployed component instances for cost optimization. Develops performance and scale test plans based on deep understanding of domain, architecture and product tech stack. Designs and implements relevant simulators to ingest large scale data. Designs, implements, and maintains test frameworks. Supports extended teams in troubleshooting problems, such as system malfunctions. Provides feedback, proposes solutions, and suggests improvements. Designs, Codes, Tests, and Delivers software to automate and realize the potential of self-healing architectures. Engages with Architects and Design Authorities across multiple areas to ensure end to end performance and scalability. Designs and executes cutting edge system testing strategies (smoke tests, performance/load tests, regression tests, capacity tests). Required 4 years’ in an engineering and architectural role. 3+ years’ proven experience in software engineering, focusing on performance, scale in on-premises, and cloud environments (Azure). Experience in managing performance and integration of Digital Commerce environments, (especially, WebSphere Commerce with systems/services such as Payment gateways, Order Management, Content Management systems, User generated content, Google Analytics, Geo Location service, etc). Experience with distributed Cache technologies such as Redis and CDN such as Akamai to enable highly optimized end user experience on mobile and desktop form factors. . Experience with Cloud and on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services and machine data technologies (Datadog, Dynatrace, Grafana, AppDynamics, Splunk, ITRS Geneos). Strong understanding of OS fundamentals (AIX/ Linux/ Windows). Proven expertise in solving OS level performance issues. Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack, including web and mobile front end, caching layers, CDN, and memory, file system, and relational databases. Experience with RUM tools and synthetic testing. Ability to find the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Passionate to optimize the performance bottlenecks and improve the services. Experience in tackling problems of load, scale, and optimizations of sophisticated large-scale deployments. J2EE/WebSphere infrastructure architecture. N-Tier architectures, high availability, scalability, and performance. J2EE/WebSphere application architecture. Ability to design and developm software applications based on J2EE technologies and related best practices. WebSphere Application Server (WAS), WAS ND, WebSphere Commerce Server (WCS), WebSphere eXtreme Scale (WXS), WebSphere Process Server (WPS), WebSphere Business Monitor (WBM), WebSphere Service Registry and Repository (WSSR), administration, configuration, performance tuning, security, monitoring, deployment, testing and troubleshooting. Performance tuning of database - Oracle, DB2, and Microsoft SQL. Application deployment and configuration. J2EE/WebSphere application performance tuning, monitoring, testing and troubleshooting. Web Servers - Apache, Microsoft IIS, Java Web Server, and IBM HTTP Server. Application Servers, Message Servers, Cache and Search Technologies. WebSphere Application Server (WAS) ND, WebSphere Commerce Server (WCS), WebSphere eXtreme Scale (WXS), WebSphere Process Server (WPS), WebSphere Enterprise Services Bus (WESB), WebSphere Business Monitor (WBM), WebSphere MQ (WMQ), WebSphere Message Broker (WMB), WebSphere DataPower, WebLogic Server etc. Excellent understanding of Scalability processes and techniques. This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The eCommerce performance engineering team is tasked to ensure the Costco eCommerce B2B and B2C site (both US and Canada) is consistently delivering industry leading performance and a responsive site, whose performance is aligned to the service level objectives defined. The system architects will be working closely with the solution architects, infrastructure architects, engineers, development team, testing team, security, and other supplier partners, to ensure we are building the eCommerce site product which will deliver a stable, scalable, highly performing, responsive, and secure eCommerce site/ application. The mission of System Architects would be to own the performance goals of all the products and platform services that are required for the success of Costco eCommerce B2B and B2C site (both US and Canada) , Costco Android app, and Costco iOS app, to support velocity, efficiency, and quality assurance for the various technical initiatives. System architects are hyper focused on improving the performance and stability of Costco’s web properties and provide tools, checklists, and automation required for empowering developers, QA, SRE, engineering, and architecture teams to track and optimize desktop and mobile performance incessantly. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Analyzes and fine-tunes the front end/application so as to derive the best performance. Works on front end frameworks and technologies like React, JavaScript, and CSS to extract the best of the performance and help build a stable and highly responsive eCommerce application. Works on Android and IOS apps to ensure quality of new products and features through performance engineering. Works on JSP/Java code and backend Commerce application as needed and ensures quality of new products and features through performance engineering. Collaborates proactively with multiple distributed value streams, suppliers, service providers, and ensures product artifacts (stories, epics, features, acceptance criteria, etc.) that are pertinent for performance are delivered. Shifts Left Performance analysis in DevOps cycle ---> Deliver Quality with velocity. Owns the performance goals of all the costco.com web components, Android mobile app and iOS app and all other channels of Costco’s web properties. Collaborates proactively with multiple distributed value streams, suppliers, service providers and ensures product artifacts (stories, epics, features, acceptance criteria, etc.) that are pertinent for platform performance are completed as planned. Builds roadmaps and lead prioritization; balance the right amount of structure and planning for a fast paced engineering team with many stakeholders. Partners closely with Business, Dev, SRE teams to identify the environment requirements for the performance goals of the projects and maintain an efficient CI/CD pipeline. Helps engineering teams establish and achieve software performance goals. Establishes consistency of performance measurement, observation, and tooling approaches. Develops, employs, and increases adoption of automated internal and external tools that help improve quality, improve performance, increase deploy frequency and enhance the overall platform experience. Contributes code to streamline performance and remove bottlenecks. Required 4+ years of Development Lead or System Architect or Solution Architect in ecommerce solutions. 10+ years’ of professional Information Technology experience delivering large-scale system solutions applications in large scale eCommerce applications. Very strong frontend skills like REACT, JavaScript, CSS, JSP and Java. Strong understanding of browsers and application responsiveness for desktop as well as mobile (both Android and IOS). Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack, including web and mobile front end, caching layers, CDN and memory, file system, and relational databases. Passionate about optimizing performance bottlenecks. Excellent understanding of emerging web technologies to support the development of eCommerce website products. Experience in tackling problems of load, scale, and optimizations of large-scale deployments on high volume sites. Experience in finding the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Optimizing performance bottlenecks with strong analytical, problem-solving & decision making skills. Proven skills in leadership, collaboration, advocacy, governance, and consensus building. Proven ability to effectively mentor junior team members on design, website load modeling, programming, and testing techniques. Recommended Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or similar technical discipline Experience with site reliability engineering (SRE) Experience with distributed system architecture Experience delivering Azure cloud technology solutions or hybrid cloud solutions Experience with on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services Strong backend and Database skills Good understanding of integration patterns, concepts, and best practices Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

System Analysts are responsible for: understanding the requirements of users; understanding requirements for team/domain specific systems; developing specifications representing both user interface and data interface requirements; interfacing with the supplier on technical and non-technical issues, providing input into designs; and assisting with the configuration of team/domain specific applications. Generate ad hoc reports for end-users using system tools, database, queries and scripts. Work closely with business groups and management to provide information to drive system data and usage decisions. Additional items include the design, testing, deployment, and maintenance of our supported business applications and services. ROLE Analyzes data quality metrics to proactively ensure the health of our business partners. Conducts root cause analysis; present findings and propose solution improvements. Collaborates with cross functional teams to resolve technical and support issues. Supports Knowledge Base articles for internal and external users for aide in troubleshooting, training, and other areas as defined. Runs Agile work streams within Costco, GHS, and its suppliers. Partners with the User Experience team to build new features. Explains technologies and solutions to technical and non-technical stakeholders. Maintains ownership of vendor relationships. Oversees the resolution (both reactive and proactive) of problems throughout the information system lifecycle, including classification, prioritization, and initiation of action, documentation of root causes, and implementation of remedies to prevent future incidents. Provides 2nd and 3rd level support with supplier and Costco incident management applications. Required Possesses good organizational, time, and project management skills, with the ability to multitask, prioritize, and stay well organized. Analytical skills and demonstrated ability to effectively improve processes and provide solutions. Able to identify and interpret trends and patterns in datasets and reports to improve processes and support Excellent written and verbal communication skills, which includes excellent customer service skills. Ability to present complex ideas and designs to a variety of technical or non-technical stakeholders and all levels of management. Able to demonstrate management of suppliers. Demonstrated strong organizational qualities; meticulous and detail oriented. Positive attitude with good interpersonal skills, a team player; able to work cooperatively with others, share ideas, and collaborate to obtain team goals. Demonstrates a logical and structured approach to time management and task prioritization while effectively teaching and mentoring others. The Systems Analyst will work with and when needed lead cross-functional development teams and vendors to deliver high quality products based on collaborative vision and values through a steady release plan using agile delivery methods as well as performing system, application and data analysis. The work will include developing, testing and supporting user and data interfaces providing direction on technical designs and the configuration of the Point of Sale platforms; collaborating with business stakeholders, business analysts, IT infrastructure and development teams to capture, justify and prioritize technology needs and issues; and performing the tasks necessary to develop and implement new solutions in Costco’s Point of Sale environment. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Installs, configures, tests and supports a variety of Point of Sale applications. Designs specific applications as assigned, including traceability back to requirements. Creates test scripts and executes adequate unit and system testing while providing necessary test documentation. Provides mentoring and support to both project and area team members. Creates strong relationships with vendor’s product development groups. Partners with management to initiate projects and develop and manage solution scope. Develops technical specifications by collaborating with technical and non-technical teams, translating functional designs into technical designs, validating macro designs and reviewing micro designs. Designs, develops and executes testing protocols to include: unit testing, integration testing and system testing, as driven by the requirements. Performs systems and data analysis on applications to understand functional design requirements determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes. Manages, defines, drives and executes as needed, the implementation of configurations across applications and interfaces. Assists teammates in growing and developing the skills necessary to grasp team application concepts and tool suite. Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions. Participates in the development of deployment and release work plan tasks within a phase. Coordinates, plans, designs and produces deliverables for the training phase. Develops and ensures adherence to establishment of standards, best practices, governances, and patterns. Required 2+ years of experience with Toshiba ACE. 2+ years of experience with Toshiba 4690 OS and hardware solutions. Strong understanding and working knowledge of PCI, SOX and Data Governance. Must be a self-starter, with the ability to work independently, with different groups and teams, utilizing solid communication skills. Strong understanding of evolving industry standards and technologies in the Point of Sale environment. Strong leadership and organizational skills. Excellent analytical skills and demonstrated ability to effectively troubleshoot and provide solutions. Demonstrated strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Must be responsible, conscientious and possess a passion for excellence. Strong work ethic, demonstrated attention to detail and excellent time management skills. Available to support the business as needed including nights, weekends, after hours and on-call. Recommended Deep understanding of evolving Point of Sale industry standards and technologies. Thorough understanding of Agile/Scrum product development frameworks, principles and values. Demonstrated knowledge of Costco business areas including - Buying, Membership and Warehouse Front End. This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. This System Analysts role is responsible for: understanding the requirements of users; understanding requirements for team/domain specific systems including, but not limited to, Vertex O’Series and tax management; performing technical system and data analysis; developing specifications representing both user interface and data interface requirements; interfacing with the supplier on technical issues, providing input into technical designs; and assisting with the configuration of Vertex. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Analyzes and delivers complex cross-functional business requirements and process flows. Performs gap analysis between as-is and to-be processes; makes recommendations on areas for continual process improvement. Executes and leads the development of technical specifications by collaborating with technical and non-technical teams; translates functional designs into technical designs; validates macro designs and reviews micro designs. Defines detailed technical requirement documentation aligned to the blueprints and technical designs prepared by System Architect. Designs, develops, and executes testing protocols to include: unit testing, integration testing, and system testing, as driven by the requirements. Performs systems and data analysis to understand functional design requirements and determines how the system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes. Assists teammates in growing and developing the skills necessary to grasp application concepts and tool suite. Manages, defines, drives, and executes the implementation of configurations across applications and interfaces as needed. Assists teammates in growing and developing the skills necessary to elicit and translate requirements into functional design. Identifies and resolves problems often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow; develops and evaluates options and implements solutions. Develops and ensures adherence to establishment of standards, best practices, governances, and patterns. Responds to requests from IT and Business teams. Works from documented detailed business requirements in context of target business outcome - business requirements must consider business processes, data, business-user, and technology. Collaborates with both IT and Business partners to clarify requirements and to support development. Verifies solution proposal for business requirement coverage. Supports delivery of projects and enhancements. Clarifies requirements and performs supporting configuration as needed. Participates in and/or verifies solution design. Coaches business team on data activities and UAT. Advocates for Procurement and our partners, and facilitates good communication between the two organizations. Required 5+ years’ experience working as a Systems Analyst or Functional Analyst in any domain/applications. Must have a minimum of 3 years’ functional analysis or similar experience, and commitment to applying appropriate skills and effort to meet deliverables. Excellent analytical skills and demonstrated ability to effectively troubleshoot and provide solutions. Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to negotiate and effectively engage with individuals at all levels of the organization. Demonstrated strong communication skills, both verbal and written. Strong work ethic; demonstrated attention to detail and excellent time management skills. Available to work as needed to honor project commitments, meet deadlines, and support assigned business area needs (e.g., nights and weekends). Proven track record for successful implementation, delivery of projects, and working cross-functionally with business and IS. Familiarity XML technologies, including SOAP or REST web services, XML Schemas, XSLT, and XPath. Recommended 2-5 years’ of Costco business knowledge. Experience with tax solutions (Vertex, Sabrix, Avalara) is a plus. Experience on SAP or other ERP implementation projects. Experience with tooling related to data analysis (SQL, SSIS, Data Profiling, etc.). Proficient in the use of the Google products: email, spreadsheet, document, presentation. Working knowledge of ServiceNow (Carts+) Portfolio and Program Management module. Past experience with Agile. This is an environment unlike anything in the high-tech world and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The ECommerce Website Development Systems Architect is responsible for the overall design of a product and the definition of the technical blueprints/designs to fulfill specific requirements. They provide technical expertise to Product Managers and the Development Pods as they reconcile the users' needs and requirements with what the engineers have determined to be doable within the given (engineering) constraints. They work closely with Solution Architects, Product Managers, POD teams and Product Owners to support the implementation and delivery of new and/or enhanced capabilities. Lastly, they are responsible for defining non-functional requirements (e.g., performance, resilience, etc.) to ensure the scalability and reliability of a given product within a complex ecosystem. This person must be a passionate, driven, self-starting problem-solver who is comfortable with change and excels in a fast-paced environment. They will have deep knowledge and experience working with ECommerce technologies - bonus for experience with WebSphere Commerce and REACT technologies. They will have practical experience in a broad range of skills from database architecture and management to security, performance analysis, continuous integration and deployment, and support of large distributed system operations. This individual will be a proven mentor who is able to work effectively cross-functionally with technical and non-technical teams, and will quickly develop an advanced understanding of business requirements and how technology fits those needs. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Provides technical expertise in establishing specific coding standards, patterns, and procedures. Supports release planning activities in conjunction with Product Owners and teams. Identifies high level requirements to support the definition and refinement of a robust testing strategy. Supports the Product Owner with the identification and definition of enablers/work items to support the architectural runway of a given product/application. Defines the non-functional requirements (e.g., performance, security, resiliency, etc.) which support the development of epics and user stories aligned to a value stream. Identifies technical dependencies across several product/application teams to support the implementation of new or enhanced functionality. Supervises systems and data analysis performed by Full Stack Engineers on products/applications to understand functional design requirements. Defines remediation tactics for large and complex defects impacting several features and/or capabilities within a given product/application. Collaborates with Product Managers and Product Owners to decompose solution blueprints and designs into detailed technical requirements. Collaborates with Solution Architects, Product management, and delivery teams to reconcile user needs and requirements within given engineering constraints. Supervises the development and preparation of technical documentation (e.g., runbooks, etc.). Identifies high-level requirements to support the definition and refinement of a robust testing strategy, and supports the planning and execution of functional and non-functional testing activities (performance, fail-over, etc.). Drives operational efficiency and technical growth by mentoring PODs through documentation, workshops and other methods in the areas of software applications design, development, automation, CI/CD pipeline, and architecture. Provides active support for business-critical outage situations. Required Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science or equivalent experience. 10+ years’ functional design and technical design experience with large-scale applications, specifically large enterprise level B2C and B2B ECommerce applications. Mastery of scaling applications from threading implementations to infrastructure scaling and topology planning. Experience designing, building and delivering Java and .NET solutions using DevOps and Continuous delivery principles. Experience in Java EE and specifically in developing Java based APIs. Spring Framework experience. Experience in .NET and specifically in developing C# based APIs. GraphQL and Entity Framework experience. Hands on Experience leveraging asynchronous communication patterns for developing distributed applications. Experience with IBM MQ, Biztalk, Azure Eventhub and Kafka are desirable. Strong familiarity with API gateway management (Apigee, APIM and DataPower). Data modeling experience. Good understanding of integration patterns, concepts and best practices. Familiarity with EDI solutions for batch and realtime transformations of data. Familiarity with data integration systems (Broker, B2Bi, PI/PO, etc.). Proven ability to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimal supervision. Proven ability to effectively mentor junior team members on design, data mapping, programming and testing techniques. Strong conceptual, analytical, problem-solving, decision making, troubleshooting and resolution skills. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrates a positive attitude, is self-motivated, responsible, conscientious, and detail oriented. Good understanding of corporate IT policies, procedures and standards. Recommended: Proven experience delivering Azure cloud technology solutions. Ability to lead and mentor devops teams. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The Merchandising Systems Architect will be responsible for the overall design of merchandising products and define the technical design to fulfill requirements to business users. This role will provide technical expertise to the Product Owner and Delivery Pods as they reconcile the needs/requirements of users with the capabilities of the tools available. The Systems Architects work closely with Solution Architects, Delivery Pods, and Product Owners to design, implement, and deliver new or enhanced capabilities. The Systems Architect will also be responsible for defining non-functional requirements (i.e. performance, resilience, etc.) to ensure the scalability and reliability of the merchandising ecosystem. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Develops the conceptual systems architecture design and the supporting technologies needed to enable new or enhanced functionality within the Merchandising ecosystem. Supports release planning activities in conjunction with Product Owners and teams. Defines new solution blueprints and technical blueprints to support the implementation of new features and capabilities Reviews technical documentation and requirements prepared by Developers and FSE to confirm accuracy and provide feedback and suggestions Leads discussions with Quality Engineers to review high level testing requirements to support the implementation of new features and capabilities Provides remediation tactics to resolve large defects or issues (impacting several application modules or features) identified by Quality Engineers Defines non-functional requirement documentation with input from the Product Owner to adhere to the expectations of end-users and customers, which support the development of epics and user stories aligned to a value stream. Participates in Scrum ceremonies (e.g., Sprint Planning, Retrospectives, Reviews) and in the Daily Stand-up to provide updates pertaining to architectural designs or changes impacting the delivery pod. Participates in Follow-ups with delivery pod team members to to provide support and clarity on architecture related topics Identifies high level requirements to support the definition and refinement of a robust testing strategy. Supports the Product Owner with the identification and definition of enablers/work items to support the architectural runway of a given product/application. Identifies technical dependencies across several product/application teams to support the implementation of new or enhanced functionality. Supervises systems and data analysis performed by Systems Analysts on products/applications to understand functional design requirements. Defines remediation tactics for large and complex defects impacting several features and/or capabilities within a given product/application. Defines coding standards and patterns to guide the implementation of new features and capabilities. Collaborates with Systems Analysts to decompose solution blueprints and designs into detailed technical requirements. Supervises the development and preparation of technical documentation prepared by Systems Analysts (e.g., runbooks, etc.). Supports the planning and execution of functional and non-functional (e.g., performance, fail-over, etc.) testing activities. Required 8+ years’ of professional Information Technology experience delivering large-scale system solutions applications, specifically enterprise level Supply Chain applications. 3+ years’ of technical team leadership experience Experience with Cloud platforms, Data integration, Data Governance tools, and end to end development and delivery roles and responsibilities. Experience with ASP.NET, C# and API Management. Must have working knowledge of Web Services, REST, SOAP, and XML technologies. Experience designing and implementing Agile. Proficient with Angular, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Experience programming in MS SQL Server (2012 or above). Knowledge of software engineering practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Proficient working with code versioning tools. Ability to share technical knowledge and clearly communicate technical concepts. Understanding of Security Architecture, Authentication, and Authorization SAML and OAuth. Understanding of performance management techniques. Understanding of both-front end and back-end design patterns. Fundamental networking knowledge. Participates in 24x7 on-call support, including evenings, weekends and/or holidays, as necessary. Recommended Experience as a development lead on major projects utilizing a formal software development lifecycle. Delivering complex and scalable business driven solutions. Writing micro services and containers in the Azure environment. Experience with UI / UX design. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The System architects will be working closely with the Solution Architects, Infrastructure architects, Engineers, development team, testing team, security, and other vendor partners, to ensure we are building the eCommerce site product which will deliver a stable, scalable, highly performing, responsive, and secure eCommerce site/ application. The System Architects will own the performance goals of all the products and platform services that are required for the success of Costco eCommerce B2B and B2C site (both US and Canada) and support velocity, efficiency, and quality assurance for the various technical initiatives. System Architects in this role are hyper focused on improving the performance and stability of Costco`s web properties, and provides tools, checklists, and automation required for empowering developers, QA, SRE, Engineering, and architecture teams to track and optimize desktop and mobile performance incessantly. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Analyzes the performance of the eCommerce application and backend services; fine-tunes the application to achieve the best performance. Works on backend Commerce platforms, various services using SOAP, REST or micro-services to extract the best of the performance; and helps build a stable and highly responsive eCommerce application. Works on JSP/Java code and backend Commerce application as needed and ensures quality of new products and features through performance engineering. Shifts Left Performance analysis in Devops cycle. Owns the performance goals of all the costco.com web components and properties. Collaborates proactively with multiple distributed value streams, vendors, service providers and ensures product artifacts (stories, epics, features, acceptance criteria, etc.) that are pertinent for platform performance are completed as planned. Builds roadmaps and leads prioritization. Partners closely with the Business, Development, and Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) teams to identify the environment requirements for the performance goals of the projects and maintains an efficient CI/CD pipeline. Helps engineering teams establish and achieve software performance goals. Establishes consistency of performance measurement, observation, and tooling approaches. Develops, employs, and increases adoption of automated internal and external tools that help improve quality, improve performance, increase deploy frequency, and enhance the overall platform experience. Contributes code to streamline performance and removes bottlenecks. Required 4+ years’ of Development Lead (Java/J2ee application) or performance engineering lead or System/Solution Architect in ecommerce solutions. 10+ years’ of professional Information Technology experience delivering large-scale system solutions applications in large scale eCommerce applications. Strong understanding of ecommerce application and building responsive eCommerce application/product Ability to discern performance impact across the full stack including web, caching layers, CDN and memory, file system, and relational databases. Passionate about optimizing performance bottlenecks. Excellent understanding of emerging web technologies to support the development of eCommerce website products. Experience in tackling problems of load, scale, and optimizations of large-scale deployments on high volume sites. Experience in finding the root cause of performance bottlenecks with profiling tools. Passionate about optimizing performance bottlenecks with strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision making skills. Proven skills in leadership, collaboration, advocacy, governance, and consensus building. Proven ability to effectively mentor junior team members on design, website load modeling, programming, and testing techniques. Recommended Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science or similar technical discipline. Strong frontend skills such as, REACT, Javascript, CSS, JSP, and Java. Experience with site reliability engineering (SRE). Experience with distributed system architecture. Experience delivering Azure cloud technology solutions or hybrid cloud solutions. Experience with on premise SRE Observability and Monitoring services. Strong backend and Database skills. Good understanding of integration patterns, concepts, and best practices. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.

The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. Costco IT is responsible for the technical future of Costco Wholesale, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”. The primary responsibilities of this role are to provide administrative and technical support for the Turnover change management environment (and future application development tools) and X-Analysis on the iSeries platform. This includes package configuration in support of department development methodologies; providing support to the project teams as it relates to change management workflow and environment support; DR/HA considerations, providing vision and strategy for process improvements, and responsibility for the supplier relationship. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Analyzes and resolves form issues related to the Turnover change management application on the iSeries systems. Analyzes and resolves job issues related to X-Analysis Cross Reference repositories on the iSeries systems. Analyzes root cause of production issues and follows through until resolution. Monitors intake for questions and issues and prioritize accordingly. Offers on-going technical project support as it relates to the Change Management application. Designs, creates, and maintains audit reports. Provides technical support for production forms for the Saturday Install Window. Provides technical support for SOX compliance and remediation. Analyzes technical impacts and coordinates upgrades as needed and resolve related issues if necessary. Analyzes programs and applications to determine how they function in order to integrate modifications or enhancements, primarily related to custom exit programs and API’s. Utilizes analytical skills to provide design direction for custom exit programs and API’s. Provides mentoring to team members. Provides (24/7) on-call support of the change management environment and scheduled weekend install windows. Develops test scripts and participates in iSeries upgrades and HA/DR testing. Designs, creates, and maintains Turnover-related exit programs and API’s as needed. Provides design/support of integrations between Turnover and external software. Oversees/Manages iSeries-based Object Ownership database. Required An understanding of Turnover “Applications”, “Projects”, “worklists” and other core package components. Minimum 5 years writing interactive and batch programs in RPGIV, RPGLE and CL on an iSeries, as well as structuring code as it relates to design, efficiencies, and clarity. Proficient in interactive SQL. Minimum 5 years’ analyzing, designing, and writing code specifications. Understanding of iSeries (AS/400) object authority, and work management concepts (Job queues, job descriptions, subsystems, etc.) Proficient in writing test plans and test scripts. Strong understanding of the workings of a multiple iSeries environment including DDM files, Opti-connect, Mimix and SQL Packages. Experience in both new development and production support. Must have excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Must have excellent communication skills. Recommended Experience as a Change Management Analyst (Turnover, Arcad, Aldon or other change management tools). Knowledge of Testbench, ROBOT and X-Analysis. Knowledge of AIX systems, SOA architecture. Willing to take ownership of all assigned tasks. Innovative, creative, and extremely responsive with a strong sense of urgency. Able to work independently to overcome obstacles. ITIL 3.0 Foundations Certified. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

The Data Analytics and Reporting team is responsible to meet the user expectations for all business areas of Costco. Delivering an effective user experience is key to adoption and usefulness of reports and insights by the business. Costco is looking for an experienced User Experience (UX) Designer with intermediate to expert visual design skills to join its Data Analytics and Reporting team. The UX Designer draws from a broad range of UX generalist skills, including user research, information architecture, interaction design, and prototyping to create compelling user experiences in a fast-paced environment. The ideal candidate will be a collaborative and creative problem-solver who communicates effectively while working with a diverse group of stakeholders and executive level leadership. If you want to be a part of one of the BEST “to work for” companies in the world, simply apply and let your career be reimagined. ROLE Collaborates with solution architects, business users, product owners, BI developers, and other stakeholders to design exceptional user experiences for multiple products concurrently. Solves complex design problems through a user-centered design (UCD) process that accounts for user goals, business requirements, and development needs. Uses a variety of iterative design methods to drive thoughtful design decisions including sketches, process flows, wireframes, and interactive simulations/prototypes. Analyzes and evaluates current user interfaces and proposes usability improvements (i.e. expert reviews). Creates interactive simulations/prototypes to help project teams, stakeholders, and users explore and understand proposed business solutions. Maintains and enforces UX style guides, UI standards, and interaction design pattern libraries. Mentors and aids junior designers in the design process by providing guidance and feedback to ensure growth in UX disciplines. Solves complex design problems through a user-centered design (UCD) process that accounts for user goals, accessibility, business requirements, and development needs. Required Minimum 4years’ experience in UX design, preferably in delivering BI and analytics reports. Expert knowledge of design tools - specifically Figma and Sketch. Experience working with other design-related software, such as Photoshop and Illustrator. Solid understanding of UI patterns/interactions and experience designing for tools, such as PowerBI, Tableau. Demonstrated proficiency with selecting appropriate UI patterns and applying UCD methodologies to effectively solve design problems. Strong understanding of responsive design principles, techniques, and frameworks. Creative and pragmatic problem solver with a strong attention to detail. Strong presentation and facilitation skills to clearly communicate design decisions and influence business process owners and stakeholders. Iteratively refine designs based on feedback and collaboration with executives, managers, and peers. Strong time management skills and the ability to be self-directed when needed. Strategic thinker; able to act tactically and solve problems quickly. Ability to manage multiple projects at one time. An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating the ability to create great user-centered design solutions. Recommended Graduate degree in Design or a related field or equivalent experience. Experience designing cross-channel user experiences. Experience designing user interfaces in an enterprise environment. Strong experience with form design. Ability to plan and conduct user research activities such as personas, user stories, competitive analysis expert reviews, user interviews/contextual inquiry, field research, and surveys. Experience with planning and executing usability tests and reporting results back to project teams and business stakeholders. Required Documents Cover Letter Resume California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice. Apart from any religious or disability considerations, open availability is needed to meet the needs of the business. If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. Applicants and employees for this position will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

Demonstrated understanding of mobile UI patterns/interactions and experience designing for native mobile applications (Android and iOS). Experience with design system frameworks. Iteratively refine designs based on feedback and collaboration with leadership and peers. Strong time management skills and the ability to be self-directed when needed.
